original: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: bi sh'a l'a aa ma la wa ti n'a ma pra m'a na sa mutstsha ya t'i k'a /
analyzed: bi sh'a l'a aa ma la wa ti n'a ma pra m'a na sa mutstsha ya t'i k'a /
translated: Visālāmalavatī-nāma-pramāṇasamuccayatyāyikā

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: yangs pa dang dri ma med pa ldan pa zhes bya ba tshad ma kun las btus pa'i 'grel bshad /
analyzed: yangs pa dang dri ma med pa ldan pa zhes bya ba tshad ma kun las btus pa'i 'grel bshad /
translated: The commentary on the compendium of valid cognition called “Possessing Vastness and Stainlessness”

original: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Buddha.🔽May the Sugata, whose nature is compassion, be victorious!

original: bde gshegs thugs rje'i bdag nyid can gyis rgyal gyur cig / nges par 'byung ba'i chos kyis rtag tu rgyal gyur cig / mtha' dag srid pa gsum po rnams kyis mchod bya ba //
analyzed: bde gshegs thugs rje'i bdag nyid can gyis rgyal gyur cig / nges par 'byung ba'i chos kyis rtag tu rgyal gyur cig / mtha' dag srid pa gsum po rnams kyis mchod bya ba //
translated: May the Dharma of renunciation always be victorious!

original: yon tan rab rgyas 'phags pa'i tshogs kyis rgyal gyur cig / dngos po thob pa rnams kyis dgra la yang //
analyzed: yon tan rab rgyas 'phags pa'i tshogs kyis rgyal gyur cig / dngos po thob pa rnams kyis dgra la yang //
translated: May the assembly of noble ones, whose qualities are fully bloomed, be victorious,🔽who are worshipped by the entirety of the three worlds.🔽Even towards enemies, those who have attained the goal

original: gzhan rjes 'dzin par byed pa dam pas bsngags //
analyzed: gzhan rjes 'dzin par byed pa dam pas bsngags //
translated: are praised by the highest for their care for others.

original: gzhan gyi lugs rnams rnyed pa rnams kyis kyang //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lugs rnams rnyed pa rnams kyis kyang //
translated: Even by those who have found other systems,

original: gzhan la phan pa de ni bya bar 'os //
analyzed: gzhan la phan pa de ni bya bar 'os //
translated: that benefit for others is worthy to be done.

original: de phyir shin tu rab tu rgyas pa yi //
analyzed: de phyir shin tu rab tu rgyas pa yi //
translated: Therefore, in this very extensive

original: slob dpon rnams kyi lugs rnams yang dag par //
analyzed: slob dpon rnams kyi lugs rnams yang dag par //
translated: The systems of the masters are not all

original: kun nas lta bar nus pa ma yin pa'i //
analyzed: kun nas lta bar nus pa ma yin pa'i //
translated: capable of being seen completely.

original: skye bo la ni blo zhan bdag las kyang //
analyzed: skye bo la ni blo zhan bdag las kyang //
translated: Even for those with little intelligence,

original: chos kyi grags pa dang ni gzhan rnams kyi'ang //
analyzed: chos kyi grags pa dang ni gzhan rnams kyi'ang //
translated: the system of Dharmakīrti and others,

original: lugs las cung zad nges par bsdus byas nas //🔽de las mthong bar gyur pa'i phyogs kyis kyang //
analyzed: lugs las cung zad nges par bsdus byas nas // de las mthong bar gyur pa'i phyogs kyis kyang //
translated: having been slightly ascertained,🔽should be seen with effort

original: 'bad pas @2a * //🔽rang gis mngon par brtag par bya //
analyzed: 'bad pas @2a * // rang gis mngon par brtag par bya //
translated: by the side that sees it.

original: don gyi de nyid rab phye ro zhim can //
analyzed: don gyi de nyid rab phye ro zhim can //
translated: The essence of the meaning, well-opened, is delicious.

original: phyogs kyi glang po'i lugs kyi bstan bcos kyi //
analyzed: phyogs kyi glang po'i lugs kyi bstan bcos kyi //
translated: This treatise of the system of Dignāga

original: rnam par bshad pa za ma tog lta bu //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa za ma tog lta bu //
translated: is an explanation like a treasure chest.

original: 'di ni bdag gis phan pa'i ched du bya //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gis phan pa'i ched du bya //
translated: This I have done for the sake of benefit.

original: tshad mar gyur pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: tshad mar gyur pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The authoritative and so on.🔽 Just as it is said:

original: ji ltar / khyod ni ri rab rgya mtsho khyod //🔽mgon khyod dpag bsam rkang 'thung ste //
analyzed: ji ltar / khyod ni ri rab rgya mtsho khyod // mgon khyod dpag bsam rkang 'thung ste //
translated: You are Meru, you are the ocean,🔽you are the protector, you are the wish-fulfilling tree,

original: sman pa bzang khyod sgron ma khyod //
analyzed: sman pa bzang khyod sgron ma khyod //
translated: you are the good doctor, you are the lamp,

original: khyod ni sgrol byed dam pa'o //
analyzed: khyod ni sgrol byed dam pa'o //
translated: you are the supreme liberator.

original: zhes pa 'di 'dra ba'i sgra sbyar ba med par yang de'i don rtogs pa de ltar 'dir yang ngo zhes pas tshad ma dang 'dra bas bcom ldan 'das tshad ma'o //
analyzed: zhes pa 'di 'dra ba'i sgra sbyar ba med par yang de'i don rtogs pa de ltar 'dir yang ngo zhes pas tshad ma dang 'dra bas bcom ldan 'das tshad ma'o //
translated: This is understood in the same way without such a verbal connection.

original: gang gi phyir ji ltar mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma ni skyes bu'i don la nye bar mkho ba sngar ma rtogs pa'i don gsal bar byed cing mi bslu ba yin pa de ltar /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ji ltar mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma ni skyes bu'i don la nye bar mkho ba sngar ma rtogs pa'i don gsal bar byed cing mi bslu ba yin pa de ltar /
translated: Just as valid cognitions such as direct perception are necessary for a person, they clarify previously uncognized objects and are undeceiving.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang gang la skyes bu'i don gyi mchog rag las pa 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid la de'i yul can gyi shes pa bskyed nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang gang la skyes bu'i don gyi mchog rag las pa 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid la de'i yul can gyi shes pa bskyed nas /
translated: In the same way, the Bhagavān generates the consciousness that is the subjective aspect of the four noble truths, which are the characteristics of reality, in those who are dependent on the supreme human goal.

original: nges par legs pa don du gnyer ba rnams la /
analyzed: nges par legs pa don du gnyer ba rnams la /
translated: He clarifies that which is not understood by those who seek definite goodness.

original: khong du ma chud pa de gsal bar byed pa dang mi bslu ba de'i phyir tshad ma dang chos mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir tshad ma'o //
analyzed: khong du ma chud pa de gsal bar byed pa dang mi bslu ba de'i phyir tshad ma dang chos mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir tshad ma'o //
translated: He is undeceiving. Therefore, because he is similar to a valid cognition, he is a valid being.

original: gyur pa ni skyes pa ste byung ba zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gyur pa ni skyes pa ste byung ba zhes pa'i don to //
translated: “Arisen” means “occurred.”

original: gyur pa'i tshig ni ma byung ba rtag pa dbang phyug la @2b sogs pa'i tshad ma gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa dgag pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: gyur pa'i tshig ni ma byung ba rtag pa dbang phyug la @2b sogs pa'i tshad ma gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa dgag pa'i don du'o //
translated: The term “having become” is for the purpose of refuting the permanent, non-arisen, and so on, imputed by other authorities such as Īśvara.

original: tshad ma yang 'di yin la gyur pa'ang yin pas tshad mar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: tshad ma yang 'di yin la gyur pa'ang yin pas tshad mar gyur pa ste /
translated: It is a valid cognition and it has become, thus it is a valid cognition that has become.

original: tshad mar gyur pa de la'o //
analyzed: tshad mar gyur pa de la'o //
translated: It is in regard to that.

original: 'o na 'dir ji ltar 'di nyid kyi 'grel par 'di lta bu'i yon tan can gyi ston pa la phyag 'tshal nas zhes pa ltar gnyis pa 'byung ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'dir ji ltar 'di nyid kyi 'grel par 'di lta bu'i yon tan can gyi ston pa la phyag 'tshal nas zhes pa ltar gnyis pa 'byung ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Well, then, how is it that in the commentary on this text it says, “Having paid homage to the teacher who has such qualities,” as if a second homage existed?

original: bden te / brjod 'dod 'di ni mchog gi sbyor ba'i rjes su 'brang ba nyid kyi phyir gang gi tshe las kyi byed pa brjod par 'dod la /
analyzed: bden te / brjod 'dod 'di ni mchog gi sbyor ba'i rjes su 'brang ba nyid kyi phyir gang gi tshe las kyi byed pa brjod par 'dod la /
translated: This is true, but because this is the supreme application of what is desired to be expressed, when the activity of expression is desired,

original: gang gi tshe don du gnyer ba dang ltag par zhen pa'i bya ba 'di dag gi mchog tu thob par 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir thob pa'i las su ston pa'i phyag 'tshal ba'i bya bas mngon par 'dod pa bya ba yang dag par rab tu sbyin pa nyid
analyzed: gang gi tshe don du gnyer ba dang ltag par zhen pa'i bya ba 'di dag gi mchog tu thob par 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir thob pa'i las su ston pa'i phyag 'tshal ba'i bya bas mngon par 'dod pa bya ba yang dag par rab tu sbyin pa nyid
translated: When it is asserted that the act of bowing is the act of obtaining the supreme of all desired objects and desired objects,

original: du brjod par 'dod pa de'i tshe las la bzhi pa nyid rigs te /
analyzed: du brjod par 'dod pa de'i tshe las la bzhi pa nyid rigs te /
translated: then it is logical that the fourth case is expressed.🔽Just as in the statement “I sleep on the bed,” the bed is the fourth case because it is the object of the action of sleeping, in the same way here

original: ji ltar de kho nar thob pa'i las kyi ming can nyal bas mngon par 'dod par bya ba nyid kyi phyir bdag po ched du bya bar brjod par 'dod pa na bdag po la nyal lo zhes pa 'dir bzhi pa kho nar gyur pa de bzhin du 'dir
analyzed: ji ltar de kho nar thob pa'i las kyi ming can nyal bas mngon par 'dod par bya ba nyid kyi phyir bdag po ched du bya bar brjod par 'dod pa na bdag po la nyal lo zhes pa 'dir bzhi pa kho nar gyur pa de bzhin du 'dir
translated: the fourth case is used.

original: yang ngo zhes pas skyon med do //
analyzed: yang ngo zhes pas skyon med do //
translated: There is no fault.

original: 'gro la phan bzhed la zhes pa 'gro ba la phan pa ni dor bar bya ba dang blang bar bya ba thabs dang bcas pa dag gi 'dor ba dang len pa phul du byung ba dag ste /
analyzed: 'gro la phan bzhed la zhes pa 'gro ba la phan pa ni dor bar bya ba dang blang bar bya ba thabs dang bcas pa dag gi 'dor ba dang len pa phul du byung ba dag ste /
translated: With regard to “the one who wishes to benefit migrating beings,” the benefit of migrating beings is the supreme relinquishment and acceptance of what is to be adopted and what is to be rejected, together with the methods.

original: de bzhed pa'i ngang tshul can la'o //
analyzed: de bzhed pa'i ngang tshul can la'o //
translated: It is the one who has that nature.

original: phyag 'tshal nas zhes pa yid dang ngag dang lus rnams kyis rab tu btud par byas nas so //🔽'di yang kun las btus pa bya //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal nas zhes pa yid dang ngag dang lus rnams kyis rab tu btud par byas nas so // 'di yang kun las btus pa bya //
translated: Having bowed down, having bowed down with mind, speech, and body.

original: zhes pa 'di dang sbrel lo //🔽'dis phyag 'tshal ba las mchod pa byas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa 'di dang sbrel lo // 'dis phyag 'tshal ba las mchod pa byas pa'o //
translated: This is also connected with the statement in the Compendium of Abhidharma:

original: ston la zhes pa 'dir aita med de sham si ksha da la sogs pa rnams las trin tri tsa dag ming la aita med pa ste /
analyzed: ston la zhes pa 'dir aita med de sham si ksha da la sogs pa rnams las trin tri tsa dag ming la aita med pa ste /
translated: Here, the word ita is not used because in the list of words ending in -a, such as śaṃsikṣa, the word ita is not used for the words trin and tric.

original: gzhan du yang mang por ro zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du yang mang por ro zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is explained that ita is used for many other words as well.

original: sdug bsngal zad par byed pa'i thabs nye bar ston pa ni bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zad par byed pa'i thabs nye bar ston pa ni bstan pa yin la /
translated: The teaching is the means for eliminating suffering.

original: de'i byed pa po ston pa zhes brjod de 'bras bu'i gnas skabs su'o //
analyzed: de'i byed pa po ston pa zhes brjod de 'bras bu'i gnas skabs su'o //
translated: The one who is the agent of that is called the teacher, in the context of the result.

original: 'dir ni bstan pa de nyid kyi rgyu lam goms par byed pa la 'bras bu nye bar btags pa'i phyir bstan pa'i sgra 'jug go //
analyzed: 'dir ni bstan pa de nyid kyi rgyu lam goms par byed pa la 'bras bu nye bar btags pa'i phyir bstan pa'i sgra 'jug go //
translated: Here, the word teaching is used for the cause of that teaching, the cultivation of the path, because the result is designated as the cause.

original: bstan pa de byed pa bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs la ston pa'i sgras brjod do //
analyzed: bstan pa de byed pa bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs la ston pa'i sgras brjod do //
translated: The Teacher is the Bhagavat, who is called the Teacher in the state of a Bodhisattva.

original: bde gshegs zhes pa legs par gshegs shing thob pa ste /
analyzed: bde gshegs zhes pa legs par gshegs shing thob pa ste /
translated: The Well-Gone is the one who has gone well and attained,

original: rnam pa thams cad du spang @3a * //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du spang @3a * //
translated: because he has completely abandoned all that is to be abandoned.

original: bya thams cad spangs pas bde bar gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: bya thams cad spangs pas bde bar gshegs pa'o //
translated: He is the Well-Gone because he has gone well to the abandonment of all that is to be abandoned in every way.

original: skyob la zhes pa 'dis skyob par byed pas skyob ste de yang rang gis mthong ba'i lam nye bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: skyob la zhes pa 'dis skyob par byed pas skyob ste de yang rang gis mthong ba'i lam nye bar ston pa'o //
translated: The Protector is the one who protects, and he is the one who shows the path of seeing to himself.

original: de 'di la yod pas skyob pa'o //
analyzed: de 'di la yod pas skyob pa'o //
translated: He is the Protector because he has that.

original: rtog pa sngon du gtong ba thams cad kyi rtsom pa la dgos pas khyab pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: rtog pa sngon du gtong ba thams cad kyi rtsom pa la dgos pas khyab pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because the undertaking of all conceptualization is pervaded by the necessity of a purpose,

original: de log na rtsom pa yang ldog cing /
analyzed: de log na rtsom pa yang ldog cing /
translated: when that is stopped, the undertaking is also stopped.

original: de yang 'di la med de de'i phyir 'di brtsam par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de yang 'di la med de de'i phyir 'di brtsam par mi bya ste /
translated: And that does not exist for him, therefore he does not undertake.

original: gang dgos pa med pa de rtog pa dang ldan pas brtsam par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dgos pa med pa de rtog pa dang ldan pas brtsam par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: That which has no purpose is not to be undertaken by one who has conceptualization.

original: dper na bsgrub bya ma yin pa'i yul can gyi shes pa brtag pa nye bar ston pa bzhin /
analyzed: dper na bsgrub bya ma yin pa'i yul can gyi shes pa brtag pa nye bar ston pa bzhin /
translated: For example, it is like the teaching of the examination of the cognition that has an object that is not to be established.

original: 'di la yang de med do zhes pa khyab byed mi dmigs pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la yang de med do zhes pa khyab byed mi dmigs pa'o zhe na /
translated: Here, it is the non-observation of the pervader, saying, “It does not exist.”

original: 'di ma grub par bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di ma grub par bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa /
translated: In order to teach that this is not established, it is said:

original: tshad ma grub ched ces so //
analyzed: tshad ma grub ched ces so //
translated: For the sake of establishing valid cognition.

original: tshad ma grub pa ni tshad ma bye brag tu rtogs pa yin la de'i don du 'di ste /
analyzed: tshad ma grub pa ni tshad ma bye brag tu rtogs pa yin la de'i don du 'di ste /
translated: Establishing valid cognition is the specific understanding of valid cognition. For the sake of that, this is begun.

original: de'i phyir brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir brtsam par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be begun.

original: gang dgos pa can de rtog pa dang ldan pas brtsam par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gang dgos pa can de rtog pa dang ldan pas brtsam par bya ba yin te /
translated: That which has a purpose should be begun by one who is rational.

original: dper na bsgrub par 'os pa'i yul can gyi shes pa brtag pa nye bar ston pa bzhin /
analyzed: dper na bsgrub par 'os pa'i yul can gyi shes pa brtag pa nye bar ston pa bzhin /
translated: For example, it is like the teaching of the examination of the cognition that has an object that is to be established.

original: 'di yang dgos pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes pa rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di yang dgos pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes pa rang bzhin no //
translated: This also has a purpose. This is the nature.

original: gal te de'i don du 'di brtsam par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te de'i don du 'di brtsam par bya ba yin na /
translated: If this is begun for the sake of that,

original: de'i tshe brtsam par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe brtsam par mi bya ste /
translated: then it should not be begun.

original: tshad ma grub pa ni rigs pa'i sgo la sogs pa rang gi gzhung gis khyod kyis sngar kho nar bsgrubs zin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma grub pa ni rigs pa'i sgo la sogs pa rang gi gzhung gis khyod kyis sngar kho nar bsgrubs zin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The establishment of valid cognition has already been accomplished by you previously, by means of your own texts such as the Gateway to Logic.

original: gang bsgrubs zin pa de ni sgrub pa'i ched du rtog pa dang ldan pas brtsam par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang bsgrubs zin pa de ni sgrub pa'i ched du rtog pa dang ldan pas brtsam par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: What has been accomplished need not be undertaken again for the sake of accomplishment by one who possesses understanding,

original: bsgrubs zin pa'i zan bzhin /
analyzed: bsgrubs zin pa'i zan bzhin /
translated: like food that has already been eaten.

original: tshad ma sgrub pa yang bsgrubs zin pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma sgrub pa yang bsgrubs zin pa yin no //
translated: The establishment of valid cognition has already been accomplished.

original: khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba'o zhe na /
translated: [Objection:] It is pervaded by the contradiction of the reason.

original: 'di bsal ba'i ched du gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di bsal ba'i ched du gsungs pa /
translated: [In response to this objection,] it is said:

original: rang gzhung rnam 'thor phyir zhes pa ste lnga pa 'di ni rgyu la'o //
analyzed: rang gzhung rnam 'thor phyir zhes pa ste lnga pa 'di ni rgyu la'o //
translated: Because of the scattering of one's own texts. This fifth [reason] is in terms of the cause.

original: rnam par 'thor ba ni rab tu bkram pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'thor ba ni rab tu bkram pa ste /
translated: Scattering is spreading.

original: rnam par bkram pa'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par bkram pa'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is spreading.

original: slar yang mdos bskor ba'i phyir ram du ma nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slar yang mdos bskor ba'i phyir ram du ma nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Again, because of being surrounded by the Veda, or because of being unable.

original: 'di ni 'di'i don gzhan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni 'di'i don gzhan pa ste /
translated: This is another meaning of this [verse]:

original: 'gro ba'i don thams cad shes pa'i don no zhes pas sri ta ni rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don thams cad shes pa'i don no zhes pas sri ta ni rtogs pa ste /
translated: The meaning of knowing all the purposes of beings. Therefore, sṛti means realization.

original: yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: It is fully understood.

original: rab tu rtogs pa ni pra sri ta'o //
analyzed: rab tu rtogs pa ni pra sri ta'o //
translated: Pra means “thoroughly.”

original: gang la rab tu rtogs pa dang bral ba de ni bi pra sri ta ste /
analyzed: gang la rab tu rtogs pa dang bral ba de ni bi pra sri ta ste /
translated: That which is devoid of thorough understanding is vipra.

original: rang gi gzhung rigs pa'i sgo la sogs pa ni tshad ma gtan @3b la 'bebs pa rab tu rtogs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi gzhung rigs pa'i sgo la sogs pa ni tshad ma gtan @3b la 'bebs pa rab tu rtogs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The scriptures of the opponent, such as the Yukti-sastika, are devoid of thorough understanding of the establishment of valid cognitions.

original: de ltar yang der mngon sum rtogs pa dang bral ba zhes pa mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid 'di la dmigs bsal byas pa med la /
analyzed: de ltar yang der mngon sum rtogs pa dang bral ba zhes pa mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid 'di la dmigs bsal byas pa med la /
translated: Thus, there is no exception to the definition of perception in that text, “perception is devoid of conceptuality.”

original: de'i phyir zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i shes pa yang mngon sum nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i shes pa yang mngon sum nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it follows that such things as the cognition of two moons are also perception.

original: rgyas pa dang bral ba yang de ste mdor bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa dang bral ba yang de ste mdor bsdus pa'o //
translated: Vipra also means “extensive,” that is, “detailed.”

original: des na gang mgo smos pas go ba phyogs tsam mthong bas kyang ma brjod pa'i don brtag par nus pa de kho na'i gtan la 'bebs byed du 'gyur gyi gzhan gyi ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gang mgo smos pas go ba phyogs tsam mthong bas kyang ma brjod pa'i don brtag par nus pa de kho na'i gtan la 'bebs byed du 'gyur gyi gzhan gyi ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, only that which can be analyzed by the mere mention of its name, whose meaning can be inferred by seeing just a part of it, is a proper object for a treatise; not others.

original: de ltar yang de nyid du /
analyzed: de ltar yang de nyid du /
translated: Thus, that same text says:

original: sgo tsam 'di ni dam pa'i don gyi tshul //
analyzed: sgo tsam 'di ni dam pa'i don gyi tshul //
translated: This is merely the door to the ultimate way.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa phyed snga mas blo gros bzang po mdor bsdus pa la dga' ba kho na la phan 'dogs pa'i ched du 'di byas so zhes gsal bar byas la /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa phyed snga mas blo gros bzang po mdor bsdus pa la dga' ba kho na la phan 'dogs pa'i ched du 'di byas so zhes gsal bar byas la /
translated: The first half of the verse makes it clear that this was composed for the sake of benefiting only those who delight in a concise, excellent intellect.

original: g-yo sgyu rnams zhes pa la sogs pa phyi ma phyed kyis ni cig shos rnams la 'dis phan par mi 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: g-yo sgyu rnams zhes pa la sogs pa phyi ma phyed kyis ni cig shos rnams la 'dis phan par mi 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: The second half, beginning with “those who are deceitful,” states that it will not benefit the other kind.

original: mu stegs pa'i rtog ges 'khrul par gyur pa blo zhan pa rnams ni rgyas par rtogs par bya ba ste /
analyzed: mu stegs pa'i rtog ges 'khrul par gyur pa blo zhan pa rnams ni rgyas par rtogs par bya ba ste /
translated: Those of little intelligence who are confused by the misconceptions of the tīrthikas should understand this in detail.

original: g-yo sgyu rnams dang bral bar byas nas /
analyzed: g-yo sgyu rnams dang bral bar byas nas /
translated: Having become free of deceit,

original: don gyi de nyid la rten ci ltar 'gyur te ma yin pa kho na'o zhes pa'i don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi de nyid la rten ci ltar 'gyur te ma yin pa kho na'o zhes pa'i don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: how could they rely on the reality of the object? They could not, because they understand the meaning.

original: 'dir ci ltar gyi sgras mi srid par gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: 'dir ci ltar gyi sgras mi srid par gsal bar byed do //
translated: Here, the word “how” makes it clear that it is impossible.

original: gang rnams ni blo dbye ba'i yul la smon pa'i don du smra bar byed de /
analyzed: gang rnams ni blo dbye ba'i yul la smon pa'i don du smra bar byed de /
translated: Those who speak for the sake of aspiring to the object of dividing the intellect

original: blo kha bye ba'i dug can mu stegs pa'i rtog ges 'khrul pas byas pa rnams lam ngan pa dang bral nas ci ltar gyur du zin kyang don gyi de kho na nyid la brten par gyur cig ce'o //
analyzed: blo kha bye ba'i dug can mu stegs pa'i rtog ges 'khrul pas byas pa rnams lam ngan pa dang bral nas ci ltar gyur du zin kyang don gyi de kho na nyid la brten par gyur cig ce'o //
translated: May they be free from the bad paths created by the confused conceptual thoughts of the tīrthikas, who have opened the door to the poison of wrong views. May they rely on the meaning of suchness, no matter what happens.

original: de rnams kyi de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi de ni mi rigs te /
translated: Those are not correct.

original: mu stegs pa'i rtog ge rnams skyon shin tu chen po can te de rnams ni rnam pa de lta bu rnams kyis bde blag tu mtshon pa yin la /
analyzed: mu stegs pa'i rtog ge rnams skyon shin tu chen po can te de rnams ni rnam pa de lta bu rnams kyis bde blag tu mtshon pa yin la /
translated: The conceptual thoughts of the tīrthikas are of great fault. They are easily illustrated by those types.

original: gang ma brjod du zin kyang rtogs par dka' ba'i don rnams phyogs tsam mthong bas rang gis brtag par nus pa de rnams /
analyzed: gang ma brjod du zin kyang rtogs par dka' ba'i don rnams phyogs tsam mthong bas rang gis brtag par nus pa de rnams /
translated: Even if they are not mentioned, it is possible for them to be seen partially by those who can investigate the meaning that is difficult to understand.

original: mtshon par sla ba ches rags pa'i skyon can mu stegs pa'i rtog ge rnams kyis lam log par drang bar bya ba yin no zhes pa 'di ni mi srid do //
analyzed: mtshon par sla ba ches rags pa'i skyon can mu stegs pa'i rtog ge rnams kyis lam log par drang bar bya ba yin no zhes pa 'di ni mi srid do //
translated: It is impossible that they would be led to a wrong path by the conceptual thoughts of the tīrthikas, which have very coarse faults that are easy to illustrate.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rnam pa 'di lta bu rang gi gzhung ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rnam pa 'di lta bu rang gi gzhung ste /
translated: For that reason, this is our own position.

original: des thams cad kyi tshad ma bye brag tu rtogs byed byas pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: des thams cad kyi tshad ma bye brag tu rtogs byed byas pa ma yin pa /
translated: It is not that it is a means of knowing everything in particular.

original: de'i phyir rang gi gzhung mdor bsdus pa'i phyir dang / tshad ma gtan la 'bebs byed rab tu gyur @4a * //🔽pa ma byas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi gzhung mdor bsdus pa'i phyir dang / tshad ma gtan la 'bebs byed rab tu gyur @4a * // pa ma byas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to summarize one's own texts, and because the means of knowing is not well established,

original: blo dman pa rgyas pa la mos pa rnams la yang phan gdags pa'i ched du spyir btang dang bcas pa dmigs bsal dang bcas rgyas pa dang bcas pa tshad ma gtan la 'bebs pa la rab tu gyur pa tshad ma kun las btus pa bya'o//
analyzed: blo dman pa rgyas pa la mos pa rnams la yang phan gdags pa'i ched du spyir btang dang bcas pa dmigs bsal dang bcas rgyas pa dang bcas pa tshad ma gtan la 'bebs pa la rab tu gyur pa tshad ma kun las btus pa bya'o//
translated: the Compendium of Valid Knowledge is to be composed in order to benefit those of lesser intellect who are interested in the extensive version.🔽In that regard, having cited other texts in each chapter, the Compendium is to be composed in the appropriate way.

original: de ci rigs pa'i sgo la sogs pa de nyid du rab tu byed pa re rer gzhung gzhan 'phangs nas kun nas btus pa bya'am zhes dri ba'i skabs la gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ci rigs pa'i sgo la sogs pa de nyid du rab tu byed pa re rer gzhung gzhan 'phangs nas kun nas btus pa bya'am zhes dri ba'i skabs la gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated in the context of the question, Is it to be composed in this very text, the Means of Valid Knowledge?

original: 'dir gcig par ni zhes so //
analyzed: 'dir gcig par ni zhes so //
translated: Here, it is to be composed in one place.

original: 'dir te rab tu byed pa gcig po 'dir bde blag tu rtogs pa'i don du kun las btus pa bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir te rab tu byed pa gcig po 'dir bde blag tu rtogs pa'i don du kun las btus pa bya'o //
translated: Here, in this very chapter, the Compendium is to be composed for the sake of easy understanding.

original: gzhung rnam par 'thor ba ni rab tu byed pa tha dad pas na bde blag tu kun nas blta bar mi nus so //
analyzed: gzhung rnam par 'thor ba ni rab tu byed pa tha dad pas na bde blag tu kun nas blta bar mi nus so //
translated: The scattered texts are not easily seen as a whole because of the different chapters.

original: gcig par ni zhes pa ni a'a di la sogs pa nyid kyi phyir ta si'o //
analyzed: gcig par ni zhes pa ni a'a di la sogs pa nyid kyi phyir ta si'o //
translated: The word “together” is because of the very ādi, and so on.

original: de ltar ni mchog gi sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar ni mchog gi sbyor ba ste /
translated: This is the supreme application.

original: tsa ra ka bsdus par /
analyzed: tsa ra ka bsdus par /
translated: In the Carakasamuccaya,

original: me dbal rnams rab zhi don du //
analyzed: me dbal rnams rab zhi don du //
translated: “For the purpose of completely pacifying fevers,

original: 'dir ni las rnams gang bshad pa //
analyzed: 'dir ni las rnams gang bshad pa //
translated: here the rites that are explained,

original: de rnams thams cad gcig tu ste //
analyzed: de rnams thams cad gcig tu ste //
translated: all of them together,

original: khrag 'byin byed pa gcig tu'o //
analyzed: khrag 'byin byed pa gcig tu'o //
translated: are for the single purpose of stopping the blood.”

original: zhes so // 'dir zhes pa tshigs su bcad par ro //
analyzed: zhes so // 'dir zhes pa tshigs su bcad par ro //
translated: Here, in the verse.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes pa la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes pa la /
translated: With regard to “the Bhagavān,”

original: bha ga'i sgra 'di ni dbang phyug la sogs pa rnams la 'jug ste /
analyzed: bha ga'i sgra 'di ni dbang phyug la sogs pa rnams la 'jug ste /
translated: this word bhagavān is used for Īśvara and so on.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said,🔽“Īśvara, good form, glory, fame, wisdom,

original: dbang phyug dang ni gzugs bzang dang // dpal dang grags dang ye shes dang // brtson 'grus phun sum chogs pa ste //
analyzed: dbang phyug dang ni gzugs bzang dang // dpal dang grags dang ye shes dang // brtson 'grus phun sum chogs pa ste //
translated: and perfect effort—

original: drug rnams bha ga ces par bshad //
analyzed: drug rnams bha ga ces par bshad //
translated: these six are explained as bhagavān.”

original: ces so // phun sum tshogs pa 'di yang de bzhin pa kho na la yod pas de kho na bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: ces so // phun sum tshogs pa 'di yang de bzhin pa kho na la yod pas de kho na bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: This perfection exists only in the Tathāgata, therefore, he is the Bhagavān.

original: yang na nges pa'i tshig gi rnam pas bdud bzhi bcom par gyur pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: yang na nges pa'i tshig gi rnam pas bdud bzhi bcom par gyur pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: Or, he is the Bhagavān because he has conquered the four demons by means of the etymological interpretation of the word bhagavān.

original: de'i bstod pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de'i bstod pa brjod pa ni /
translated: The praise of him is stated:

original: 'dis bstod par bya bas na bstod pas te yon tan dam pa yang dag pa ston pa'i ngag go //
analyzed: 'dis bstod par bya bas na bstod pas te yon tan dam pa yang dag pa ston pa'i ngag go //
translated: praises because he is to be praised; speech which reveals the highest virtues.

original: brjod pa ni 'dir brjod par 'dod pa'i don sgras go bar byed cing yang dag par rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa ni 'dir brjod par 'dod pa'i don sgras go bar byed cing yang dag par rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: The expression is the meaning which is desired to be expressed, and is the means of understanding through words and the means of correct expression.

original: bstod pas brjod pa ste /
analyzed: bstod pas brjod pa ste /
translated: The expression of praise is

original: bstod pa'i tshig gis yon tan dang ldan pa nyid du gsal bar byed pa zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: bstod pa'i tshig gis yon tan dang ldan pa nyid du gsal bar byed pa zhes pa'i don no //
translated: the statement of praise, the meaning of which is the revelation of the possession of virtues by means of the words of praise.

original: yon tan ci zhig gis nge ltar gsal bar byed ce na /
analyzed: yon tan ci zhig gis nge ltar gsal bar byed ce na /
translated: By what virtues is he thus revealed?

original: gsungs pa / tshad mar gyur pa nyid kyis zhes so //
analyzed: gsungs pa / tshad mar gyur pa nyid kyis zhes so //
translated: It is said: by his authoritativeness.

original: yon tan de yang gtan tshigs ci zhig gis she na /
analyzed: yon tan de yang gtan tshigs ci zhig gis she na /
translated: By what reason is that virtue?

original: gsungs pa / rgyu dang @4b 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pas zhes so //
analyzed: gsungs pa / rgyu dang @4b 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pas zhes so //
translated: It is said: “By the perfection of cause and effect.”

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi phun sum chogs pa rab tu gyur pa ste rgyu des so //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi phun sum chogs pa rab tu gyur pa ste rgyu des so //
translated: The perfection of cause and effect is the transformation. By that cause.

original: gang tshad mar gyur pa nyid ni thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan te /
analyzed: gang tshad mar gyur pa nyid ni thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan te /
translated: That which is valid cognition is the uncommon quality.

original: rgyu 'am gtan tshigs des bstod pa brjod cing bstod pa'i tshig gis bcom ldan 'das yon tan dang ldan pa nyid du nyan pa po rnams la rtogs par byed ces pa ji srid pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu 'am gtan tshigs des bstod pa brjod cing bstod pa'i tshig gis bcom ldan 'das yon tan dang ldan pa nyid du nyan pa po rnams la rtogs par byed ces pa ji srid pa'o //
translated: By that cause or reason, the praise is expressed. By the words of praise, the Blessed One’s possession of good qualities is made known to the listeners.

original: de yang ci'i don du zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yang ci'i don du zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: For what purpose is that? It is said:

original: rab tu byed pa la dang por gus pa bskyed pa'i don du zhes so //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa la dang por gus pa bskyed pa'i don du zhes so //
translated: In order to generate respect for the treatise at the beginning.

original: yang bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa brjod pas rab tu byed pa rtsom pa la gus par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa brjod pas rab tu byed pa rtsom pa la gus par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Moreover, how does the composition of the treatise through the expression of praise to the Blessed One generate respect?

original: gang gi phyir yon tan gzhan rnams yod na yang tshad ma nyid kyi yon tan gyis bstod pas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yon tan gzhan rnams yod na yang tshad ma nyid kyi yon tan gyis bstod pas /
translated: Because, even though other qualities exist, the quality of valid cognition is praised.

original: slob dpon gyis 'di gsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis 'di gsal bar bya ste /
translated: The master [Vasubandhu] clarifies this:

original: gang 'di mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid de ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nye bar bstan pa kho na las grub pa ste /
analyzed: gang 'di mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid de ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nye bar bstan pa kho na las grub pa ste /
translated: The definition of valid knowledge such as perception is established only through the teachings of the Bhagavān.

original: da lta kho bos rang nyid kyis brtags nas rnam par ma bzhag pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: da lta kho bos rang nyid kyis brtags nas rnam par ma bzhag pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: I have not posited it now through my own investigation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir chos mngon par yang gsungs so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir chos mngon par yang gsungs so zhes gsungs so //
translated: For that very reason, it is also stated in the Abhidharma.

original: re zhig mngon sum ni des nye bar bstan pa mthong ba'i phyir de las grub par rigs mod /
analyzed: re zhig mngon sum ni des nye bar bstan pa mthong ba'i phyir de las grub par rigs mod /
translated: It is reasonable that perception is established from that [Abhidharma], because it is taught by that [Abhidharma].

original: nye bar ma bstan pa'i rjes su dpag pa ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar ma bstan pa'i rjes su dpag pa ci ltar zhe na /
translated: But how is inference, which is not taught [in the Abhidharma], [established]?

original: de'i yang sbyor ba mthong ba'i phyir mtshan nyid mdzad pa kho nar rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i yang sbyor ba mthong ba'i phyir mtshan nyid mdzad pa kho nar rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Because the application of that [inference] is seen, it should be understood that the definition [of inference] was made by that [Abhidharma] itself.

original: ji skad du gang cung zad kun 'byung ba'i chos can de 'gog pa'i chos can no zhes pa la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyi rjes su dpag pa'i sbyor ba rnams mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ji skad du gang cung zad kun 'byung ba'i chos can de 'gog pa'i chos can no zhes pa la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyi rjes su dpag pa'i sbyor ba rnams mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: As the Lord has said, “Whatever is a phenomenon that has an origin is a phenomenon that has a cessation.”

original: 'di skad brjod pa na rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid brjod par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa na rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid brjod par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But how can this statement be an example of an inference?

original: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa'i rten ni med na mi 'byung ba can gyi rtags te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa'i rten ni med na mi 'byung ba can gyi rtags te /
translated: The basis of an inference is a reason that is a necessary consequence.

original: sbyor ba 'dis kyang rtags skye ba ni bsgrub par bya ba 'gog pa med na mi 'byung bar gsal ba kho nar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: sbyor ba 'dis kyang rtags skye ba ni bsgrub par bya ba 'gog pa med na mi 'byung bar gsal ba kho nar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: And this syllogism clearly shows that the arising of the reason is a necessary consequence of the cessation of the probandum.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar bstan pa kho na las grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar bstan pa kho na las grub bo //
translated: Therefore, the definition of an inference is established by the Lord himself.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar bstan pa las grub pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid rjes su sgrub par rab tu byed pa 'di'o zhes nges pa skyes pa rab tu grub pa'i bstan bcos pa rnams de la gus pa skye la /🔽de las kyang gus nas nyan @5a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar bstan pa las grub pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid rjes su sgrub par rab tu byed pa 'di'o zhes nges pa skyes pa rab tu grub pa'i bstan bcos pa rnams de la gus pa skye la / de las kyang gus nas nyan @5a * //
translated: Therefore, the author of this treatise has generated certainty in the definition of valid knowledge that is taught by the Bhagavat, and he has generated respect for the Bhagavat.

original: pa la sogs pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: pa la sogs pa la 'jug go //
translated: And having generated respect, he engages in listening and so on.

original: yang na 'dir rab tu byed pa'i dang por bcom ldan 'das kyi bstod pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: yang na 'dir rab tu byed pa'i dang por bcom ldan 'das kyi bstod pa brjod pa ni /
translated: Or else, at the beginning of this treatise, the praise of the Bhagavat is stated

original: bstod bya'i bcom ldan 'das la gus pa bskyed pa'i don du ste /
analyzed: bstod bya'i bcom ldan 'das la gus pa bskyed pa'i don du ste /
translated: in order to generate respect for the Bhagavat, the object of praise.

original: 'dis de la gus pa ji ltar skye zhe na /
analyzed: 'dis de la gus pa ji ltar skye zhe na /
translated: How does this generate respect for him?

original: gang gi phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'dis 'thad pa dang bcas pa'i tshad mar gyur pa nyid bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan du gsal bar byas la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'dis 'thad pa dang bcas pa'i tshad mar gyur pa nyid bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan du gsal bar byas la /
translated: Because this verse clearly shows that the Bhagavat has valid knowledge that is reasonable,

original: de las sngar rab tu ma grub pa'i bstan bcos pa rnams kyang de la gus pa skye na cig shos rnams lta ci smos /
analyzed: de las sngar rab tu ma grub pa'i bstan bcos pa rnams kyang de la gus pa skye na cig shos rnams lta ci smos /
translated: and if those who are not previously established in the treatise generate respect for him, what need is there to mention the others?

original: de la gus pa las kyang bsod nams kyi tshogs nye bar bsags pa'i rab tu byed pa gzung ba'i ched du zhugs pa rnams la bgegs dang log 'dren med par 'gyur ro zhes bas de la gus pa yang dgos pa dang bcas pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de la gus pa las kyang bsod nams kyi tshogs nye bar bsags pa'i rab tu byed pa gzung ba'i ched du zhugs pa rnams la bgegs dang log 'dren med par 'gyur ro zhes bas de la gus pa yang dgos pa dang bcas pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, respect for the Buddha is necessary for those who have undertaken to compose treatises in order to accumulate the requisites of merit.

original: 'o na 'ga' zhig rnams rnam pa de lta bu'i skyes bu dgag pa'i ched du skyes bu nyid la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa sbyor ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na 'ga' zhig rnams rnam pa de lta bu'i skyes bu dgag pa'i ched du skyes bu nyid la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa sbyor ba ma yin nam /
translated: But, someone might object, aren’t some people who are opposed to such a person as the Buddha using arguments such as “he is a person” to prove that he does not exist?

original: de'i phyir ci ltar de la bstod pa brjod pas gus pa nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ci ltar de la bstod pa brjod pas gus pa nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: So how can respect for him be generated by praising him?

original: gang gi phyir de ni rtogs par byed pa ma yin te /🔽ldog pa dang rjes su 'gro ba sgrub par byed pa dag mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni rtogs par byed pa ma yin te / ldog pa dang rjes su 'gro ba sgrub par byed pa dag mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is not a proof.🔽It is impossible to prove either the pervasion or the forward pervasion.

original: dbang po las 'das pa rnams la des ma mthong ba las ldog pa srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa rnams la des ma mthong ba las ldog pa srid pa ma yin te /
translated: In the case of imperceptible objects, it is impossible to prove the counter pervasion by the absence of the reason in the dissimilar instances.

original: yod pa rnams kyang de rnams kyis mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa rnams kyang de rnams kyis mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because even existent objects are not known by them.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'gal bar ma grub pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'gal bar ma grub pa'i phyir na /
translated: Therefore, since the contradiction is not established,

original: 'gal pa med pa dang lhan cig yod par mi 'gal pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal pa med pa dang lhan cig yod par mi 'gal pa'i phyir ro //
translated: there is no contradiction in the non-contradictory being present.

original: skyes bu cig shos dang mtshungs pa grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu cig shos dang mtshungs pa grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it established that the other person is similar,

original: khyad par mi srid par shes par mi nus pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: khyad par mi srid par shes par mi nus pa'i phyir la /
translated: because it is not possible to know that a distinction is impossible.

original: 'di 'dra ba rnams la mi dmigs pa gtan tshigs nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba rnams la mi dmigs pa gtan tshigs nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And in such cases, non-apprehension is not a valid reason.

original: skyes bu nyid la sogs par mtshungs na yang yid gzhungs pa la sogs pa yon tan gyi khyad par mthong ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: skyes bu nyid la sogs par mtshungs na yang yid gzhungs pa la sogs pa yon tan gyi khyad par mthong ba'i phyir la /
translated: Even if they are similar in being a person, etc., we see distinctions in their qualities, such as intelligence, etc.

original: de bzhin du 'du byed pa yod na gzhan yang srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du byed pa yod na gzhan yang srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And likewise, if there is formation, other things are possible.

original: khyad par srid pa la yang rjes su 'gro ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par srid pa la yang rjes su 'gro ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And even if a distinction is possible, the pervasion is not established.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa de lhag ma dang ldan pa ste ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa de lhag ma dang ldan pa ste ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, that inference is inconclusive, because there is doubt about the negative pervasion.

original: mi mthun phyogs la 'jug pa ma mthong na yang mi nus so //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs la 'jug pa ma mthong na yang mi nus so //
translated: And even if the engagement with the opposite is not seen, it is not possible.

original: de'i rnam pa 'di lta bu'i shes pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi tshad ma nyid mi srid pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa 'di lta bu'i shes pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi tshad ma nyid mi srid pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not impossible for a valid cognition to have the character of a cognition with that aspect.

original: @5b de'i sgrub byed rjes su bsgrub pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @5b de'i sgrub byed rjes su bsgrub pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is possible to establish the proof of that.

original: gang gang gi sgrub par byed pa phyin ci ma log pa rjes su sgrub pa des de thob pa srid pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gang gi sgrub par byed pa phyin ci ma log pa rjes su sgrub pa des de thob pa srid pa yin te /
translated: Whatever proof is established without error, it is possible to attain that by it.

original: dper na nad med pa'i sgrub par byed pa phyin ci ma log pa rjes su sgrub pa'i nad pa rnams bzhin /
analyzed: dper na nad med pa'i sgrub par byed pa phyin ci ma log pa rjes su sgrub pa'i nad pa rnams bzhin /
translated: For example, it is like the sick who attain health by establishing without error the proof of health.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang tshad ma'i sgrub par byed ba phyin ci ma log pa rjes su bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang tshad ma'i sgrub par byed ba phyin ci ma log pa rjes su bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: The Bhagavat is the one who establishes without error the proof of valid cognition.

original: rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of valid cognition is taught.

original: gang sgrub par byed pa rjes su bsgrubs pa las tshad ma nyid thob pa srid pa de ston par byed pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang sgrub par byed pa rjes su bsgrubs pa las tshad ma nyid thob pa srid pa de ston par byed pa gsungs pa /
translated: The one who teaches that it is possible to attain valid cognition from the establishment of the proof without error, states:🔽The cause is the perfection of intention and application.

original: de la rgyu ni bsam pa dang // sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa'o zhes so bsam pa ston par byed de /
analyzed: de la rgyu ni bsam pa dang // sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa'o zhes so bsam pa ston par byed de /
translated: He teaches the intention.

original: bsam pa ni 'gro ba la phan par bzhed pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'gro ba la phan par bzhed pa'o zhes so //
translated: The intention is the wish to benefit beings.

original: de yang 'gro ba mtha' dag shin tu sdug bsngal dang bral ba don du gnyer ba'i rnam pa can bskal pa mi nyung bar goms pas de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i thugs rje'o //🔽tshigs su bcad par 'gro la phan bzhed ldan //
analyzed: de yang 'gro ba mtha' dag shin tu sdug bsngal dang bral ba don du gnyer ba'i rnam pa can bskal pa mi nyung bar goms pas de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i thugs rje'o // tshigs su bcad par 'gro la phan bzhed ldan //
translated: Moreover, compassion is the nature of the bodhisattva's mind, which has the aspect of seeking the complete freedom from suffering of all beings, and has been cultivated for many eons.

original: zhes pa 'dis bstan te /
analyzed: zhes pa 'dis bstan te /
translated: The verse says that he is endowed with the wish to benefit beings.

original: de dang ldan pa'i phyir 'gro la phan bzhed ldan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i phyir 'gro la phan bzhed ldan du 'gyur ro //
translated: He is endowed with the wish to benefit beings because he has compassion.

original: goms pa las de de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba srid do //
analyzed: goms pa las de de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba srid do //
translated: It is possible that through cultivation, compassion becomes his very nature.

original: gang yid kyi yon tan de rnams ni shin tu goms pa yod na de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang yid kyi yon tan de rnams ni shin tu goms pa yod na de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: When there is very great familiarity with mental qualities, they become one's very nature.

original: rig byed pa dang yid 'byung ba nyid bzhin //
analyzed: rig byed pa dang yid 'byung ba nyid bzhin //
translated: This is like the Vedic ritualists' conviction that the self is imperishable, and like the conviction of those who are disgusted with samsara that the self is perishable.

original: snying rje yang yid kyi yon tan yin no //
analyzed: snying rje yang yid kyi yon tan yin no //
translated: Compassion is a mental quality.

original: rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin no //
translated: Nature

original: de des gzhan gyi don la rab tu bskul ba ni /
analyzed: de des gzhan gyi don la rab tu bskul ba ni /
translated: He is urged to work for the benefit of others by his compassion, which is his nature.

original: rang gis mngon du ma byas par pha rol rnams la sdug bsngal zhi bar byed pa'i thabs bstan par mi 'phrod do zhes rang gi sdug bsngal zhi ba'i thabs sgom pa'i don du re zhig sbyor bar byed do zhes ston par byed pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: rang gis mngon du ma byas par pha rol rnams la sdug bsngal zhi bar byed pa'i thabs bstan par mi 'phrod do zhes rang gi sdug bsngal zhi ba'i thabs sgom pa'i don du re zhig sbyor bar byed do zhes ston par byed pa gsungs pa /
translated: In order to meditate on the method of pacifying one’s own suffering, one should apply oneself for a while.🔽The application is as follows.

original: sbyor ba ni 'gro ba la ston par byed pa las zhes pa la sogs gang gang la brtse ba de des ji ltar de'i don du 'gyur ba de ltar rab tu spyor te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni 'gro ba la ston par byed pa las zhes pa la sogs gang gang la brtse ba de des ji ltar de'i don du 'gyur ba de ltar rab tu spyor te /
translated: Whatever one has compassion for, one should apply oneself to it in whatever way will benefit it.

original: dper na ma bu la brtse ba ji lta bu de'i don du 'gyur ba de ltar rab tu sbyor ba bzhin /
analyzed: dper na ma bu la brtse ba ji lta bu de'i don du 'gyur ba de ltar rab tu sbyor ba bzhin /
translated: For example, just as a mother has compassion for her child and applies herself in whatever way will benefit it,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang 'gro ba la brtse bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang 'gro ba la brtse bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the Bhagavān also has compassion for the world.

original: rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin no //
translated: This is the nature.

original: 'gro ba la ston pa dngos ni /
analyzed: 'gro ba la ston pa dngos ni /
translated: The actual teaching to the world is

original: rang gis mthong ba'i sdug bsngal zhi bar byad pa'i thabs nye bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: rang gis mthong ba'i sdug bsngal zhi bar byad pa'i thabs nye bar ston pa'o //
translated: teaching the method of pacifying the suffering that one has seen.

original: 'dir ni rgyu la 'bras bu nye bar gdags par byas nas /
analyzed: 'dir ni rgyu la 'bras bu nye bar gdags par byas nas /
translated: Here, the cause is designated as the effect.

original: thabs goms par byed pa 'gro ba la ston pa'i sgras brjod de /
analyzed: thabs goms par byed pa 'gro ba la ston pa'i sgras brjod de /
translated: Since it is the means of familiarization that is suitable to teach sentient beings,🔽it should be understood as being superior to other means of familiarization.🔽The term “teacher” is used to indicate the means of familiarization.

original: de sems can la ston par rung ba'i thabs nyid kyis na /
analyzed: de sems can la ston par rung ba'i thabs nyid kyis na /
translated: Since it is the means of familiarization that is suitable to teach sentient beings,

original: de las gzhan pa'i thabs goms par byed pa las khyad par du @6a * //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i thabs goms par byed pa las khyad par du @6a * //
translated: it should be understood as being superior to other means of familiarization.🔽The term “teacher” is used to indicate the means of familiarization.🔽Since it is the means of familiarization that is suitable to teach sentient beings,

original: 'phags pa nyid du shes par byas pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyid du shes par byas pa'i don du'o //
translated: it should be understood as being superior to other means of familiarization.🔽The term “teacher” is used to indicate the means of familiarization.

original: 'gro ba la ston par byed pa las zhes pa 'di mtshan nyid kyi rgyu ste /🔽des na ji ltar sra ba nyid las sa'o zhes brjod pan /
analyzed: 'gro ba la ston par byed pa las zhes pa 'di mtshan nyid kyi rgyu ste / des na ji ltar sra ba nyid las sa'o zhes brjod pan /
translated: Since it is the means of familiarization that is suitable to teach sentient beings,🔽it should be understood as being superior to other means of familiarization.🔽The term “teacher” is used to indicate the means of familiarization.🔽Since it is the means of familiarization that is suitable to teach sentient beings,🔽it should be understood as being superior to other means of familiarization.🔽The term “teacher” is used to indicate the means of familiarization.

original: sra ba'i rang bzhin can sa'o zhes rtogs pa de bzhin du 'gro ba la ston par byed pa las ston pa nyid do zhes brjod pa na de'i rang bzhin can ston pa nyid do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sra ba'i rang bzhin can sa'o zhes rtogs pa de bzhin du 'gro ba la ston par byed pa las ston pa nyid do zhes brjod pa na de'i rang bzhin can ston pa nyid do zhes pa'o //
translated: Since it is the means of familiarization that is suitable to teach sentient beings,🔽it should be understood as being superior to other means of familiarization.🔽The term “teacher” is used to indicate the means of familiarization.🔽Since it is the means of familiarization that is suitable to teach sentient beings,🔽it should be understood as being superior to other means of familiarization.🔽The term “teacher” is used to indicate the means of familiarization.🔽Since it is the means of familiarization that is suitable to teach sentient beings,🔽it should be understood as being superior to other means of familiarization.🔽The term “teacher” is used to indicate the means of familiarization.🔽Since it is the means of familiarization that is suitable to teach sentient beings,🔽it should be understood as being superior to other means of familiarization.🔽The term “teacher” is used to indicate the means of familiarization.🔽Since it is the means of familiarization that is suitable to teach sentient beings,🔽it should be understood as being superior to other means of familiarization.

original: de ni nye par len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid kyi sdug bsngal la res 'ga' ba nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyis mi rtag pa dang / de nyid kyi phyir mi rtag pa'i rgyu can dang / nad gzhi zad pas nad bzhin du 'di rgyu zad pas zad par nus la /
analyzed: de ni nye par len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid kyi sdug bsngal la res 'ga' ba nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyis mi rtag pa dang / de nyid kyi phyir mi rtag pa'i rgyu can dang / nad gzhi zad pas nad bzhin du 'di rgyu zad pas zad par nus la /
translated: Just as a disease is cured by the exhaustion of the cause of the disease, so too is this exhaustion possible through the exhaustion of its cause.🔽Otherwise, it is not possible.

original: gzhan du na ma yin no zhes nges nas 'di'i rgyu ci zhig ces rnam par dpyod par byed cing /
analyzed: gzhan du na ma yin no zhes nges nas 'di'i rgyu ci zhig ces rnam par dpyod par byed cing /
translated: Having ascertained this, one analyzes, “What is its cause?”

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ni gtso bor bdag la chags pa dang ldan pa'i sred pa kho nar rtogs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ni gtso bor bdag la chags pa dang ldan pa'i sred pa kho nar rtogs so //
translated: One realizes that the cause of suffering is craving, which is associated with attachment to self.

original: gang sems can gzhan gyis bkri bar bya ba ma yin par mngon par dga' pa sngon ma can dman pa'i gnas yongs su 'dzin pa de bdag la chags pa dang ldan pas sdug bsngal dang bde ba dor ba dang thob par 'dod pa sngon ma can yin te
analyzed: gang sems can gzhan gyis bkri bar bya ba ma yin par mngon par dga' pa sngon ma can dman pa'i gnas yongs su 'dzin pa de bdag la chags pa dang ldan pas sdug bsngal dang bde ba dor ba dang thob par 'dod pa sngon ma can yin te
translated: One who is not led by other sentient beings, who is delighted with what is not previously existent, who maintains a lower status, is associated with attachment to self, and is delighted with the abandonment of suffering and the attainment of happiness.

original: / dper na sbrang bu rnams mngon par 'dod pa sngon ma can mi gtsang ba'i gnas yongs su 'dzin pa bzhin /
analyzed: / dper na sbrang bu rnams mngon par 'dod pa sngon ma can mi gtsang ba'i gnas yongs su 'dzin pa bzhin /
translated: For example, flies, which are attracted to what is impure, take up residence in impure things.

original: srog chags rnams kyang sems can gzhan gyis bkri bar bya ba ma yin par mngon par dga' ba sngon ma can mngal la sogs pa dman pa'i gnas yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: srog chags rnams kyang sems can gzhan gyis bkri bar bya ba ma yin par mngon par dga' ba sngon ma can mngal la sogs pa dman pa'i gnas yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, living beings, which are attracted to what is base, take up residence in the womb, etc., which are not to be entered by other living beings.🔽The result is the same existence.

original: 'bras bu'o // srid pa de nyid bstan bcos su gtso bo yin pas na kun 'byung gi bden pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'bras bu'o // srid pa de nyid bstan bcos su gtso bo yin pas na kun 'byung gi bden pa zhes brjod do //
translated: It is called the truth of origination because existence is the principal thing in the treatise.

original: gtso bo yang des kun nas bslang ba'i 'bad pa'i dbang gis skye ba'i yul du 'gro bar byed pa'i phyir dang / de ma thag pa nyid kyi phyir yang ngo //
analyzed: gtso bo yang des kun nas bslang ba'i 'bad pa'i dbang gis skye ba'i yul du 'gro bar byed pa'i phyir dang / de ma thag pa nyid kyi phyir yang ngo //
translated: It is also principal because one goes to the place of rebirth by the power of the effort that is motivated by it, and because it is immediate.

original: mi shes pa yod na yang /
analyzed: mi shes pa yod na yang /
translated: Even when there is ignorance,

original: 'dod chags med par 'jug pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags med par 'jug pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is impossible for there to be entry without craving.

original: las pas kyang sred pa kho na gtso bo ste /
analyzed: las pas kyang sred pa kho na gtso bo ste /
translated: Craving is the principal thing, because it is the cause of action.

original: de ltar ni /
analyzed: de ltar ni /
translated: Thus,

original: las yod kyang ji srid du ma rig pa'i sa rdul gyis g-yogs pa dang sred pa'i 'dod chags kyis mngon par brlan par ma gyur pa de srid du 'bras bu dang ldan par mi 'gyur te dper na dgra bcom pa rnams bzhin no //
analyzed: las yod kyang ji srid du ma rig pa'i sa rdul gyis g-yogs pa dang sred pa'i 'dod chags kyis mngon par brlan par ma gyur pa de srid du 'bras bu dang ldan par mi 'gyur te dper na dgra bcom pa rnams bzhin no //
translated: But as long as the dust of nescience covers it and the moisture of craving does not drench it, it does not bear fruit, just as in the case of the Arhats.

original: de'i phyir sred pa de dang de las gzhan pa'i skyon rnams kyang bdag tu lta ba kho na las byung ba ste de ltar rtogs par mdzad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir sred pa de dang de las gzhan pa'i skyon rnams kyang bdag tu lta ba kho na las byung ba ste de ltar rtogs par mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, craving and the other faults arise only from the view of self.

original: bdag med do bdag gi ba med do zhes mthong ba @6b la ni yongs su 'dzin pa med pas 'gar yang chags pa med la /
analyzed: bdag med do bdag gi ba med do zhes mthong ba @6b la ni yongs su 'dzin pa med pas 'gar yang chags pa med la /
translated: One who sees “no self, no self” has no grasping, and so is not attached anywhere.

original: chags pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa la yang zhe sdang ba med do //
analyzed: chags pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa la yang zhe sdang ba med do //
translated: And one who is not attached has no hatred.

original: bdag dang bdag gi ba dang nye bar ma 'brel ba can dang nye bar 'brel pa so sor bcom pa la de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi ba dang nye bar ma 'brel ba can dang nye bar 'brel pa so sor bcom pa la de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since he is not related to self and self’s, and since he has destroyed the relation, he has no delusion.

original: de dang rigs mthun pa goms pa las skyes pa'i bdag tu lta ba dang bdag gi ba la chags pa skyes na zhe sdang dang bcas pa la sogs pa rnams so zhes pas sred pa la sogs pa'i skyon rnams thams cad 'jig tshogs la lta ba las skyes
analyzed: de dang rigs mthun pa goms pa las skyes pa'i bdag tu lta ba dang bdag gi ba la chags pa skyes na zhe sdang dang bcas pa la sogs pa rnams so zhes pas sred pa la sogs pa'i skyon rnams thams cad 'jig tshogs la lta ba las skyes
translated: In the same way, when the view of self and attachment to “mine” arise from habituation, then hatred and so on arise. Thus all faults such as craving arise from the perishable collection view.

original: pa'o // de nyid ni mi shes par brjod de de ni shes pa'i mi mthun phyogs yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'o // de nyid ni mi shes par brjod de de ni shes pa'i mi mthun phyogs yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: That is called ignorance because it is the antithesis of knowledge.

original: de nyid bdag tu lta ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid bdag tu lta ba ste /
translated: That is the view of self.

original: gang las skyon gyi rgyu yin pa de las 'byung zhing /
analyzed: gang las skyon gyi rgyu yin pa de las 'byung zhing /
translated: From that which is the cause of faults, they arise,🔽and from the exhaustion of that, craving and other faults are exhausted.

original: de zad pa las sred pa dang de las gzhan pa'i skyon rnams zad do zhes bsams nas gang goms pas de spang bar bya ba bdag tu lta ba'i mi mthun phyogs brtag pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de zad pa las sred pa dang de las gzhan pa'i skyon rnams zad do zhes bsams nas gang goms pas de spang bar bya ba bdag tu lta ba'i mi mthun phyogs brtag pa mdzad do //
translated: Thinking of that, he composed the chapter on the investigation of the self, which is the antithesis of the view of self, in order to abandon that view through habituation.

original: brtag par byed pa na yang de las bzlog pa'i rnam pa nyid kyi phyir bdag med pa nyid du lta ba kho na bdag tu lta ba'i mi mthun phyogs te de ltar rtogs par mdzad do //
analyzed: brtag par byed pa na yang de las bzlog pa'i rnam pa nyid kyi phyir bdag med pa nyid du lta ba kho na bdag tu lta ba'i mi mthun phyogs te de ltar rtogs par mdzad do //
translated: And when it is investigated, it is seen to be the very opposite of that, so the view of selflessness is the very antidote to the view of self.

original: gang gang las bzlog pa'i rang bzhin can de de'i mi mthun phyogs yin te /
analyzed: gang gang las bzlog pa'i rang bzhin can de de'i mi mthun phyogs yin te /
translated: That which is the opposite of something is the antidote to it.

original: rlung nad las bzlog pa'i rang bzhin can til mar rlung nad kyi bzhin /
analyzed: rlung nad las bzlog pa'i rang bzhin can til mar rlung nad kyi bzhin /
translated: For example, oil is the antidote to wind disorders.

original: bdag med pa nyid du lta ba yang bdag tu lta ba las bzlog pa'i rang bzhin can yin no zhes pa rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid du lta ba yang bdag tu lta ba las bzlog pa'i rang bzhin can yin no zhes pa rang bzhin no //
translated: The view of selflessness is the opposite of the view of self.

original: bdag tu lta ba dang 'gal ba'i bdag med pa nyid du lta ba ni de sngon du 'gro ba can bdag la chags pa la sogs pa skyon gyi tshogs dang yang 'gal ba kho na'o zhes mkhyen no //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba dang 'gal ba'i bdag med pa nyid du lta ba ni de sngon du 'gro ba can bdag la chags pa la sogs pa skyon gyi tshogs dang yang 'gal ba kho na'o zhes mkhyen no //
translated: The view of selflessness, which is incompatible with the view of self, is also incompatible with the host of faults such as attachment to self, which are preceded by the view of self.

original: gang gang gi rgyu dang 'gal ba de de la gnod pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gang gi rgyu dang 'gal ba de de la gnod pa yin te /
translated: That which is incompatible with the cause of something is also incompatible with that thing.

original: rlung las byung ba'i nad la de'i rgyu dang 'gal ba til mar bzhin /
analyzed: rlung las byung ba'i nad la de'i rgyu dang 'gal ba til mar bzhin /
translated: In the case of a disease arising from wind, the cause of the disease and its opposite are like oil.

original: bdag med par lta kha yang bdag tu chags pa la sogs pa'i rgyu bdag tu lta ba dang 'gal ba yin no zhes pa rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag med par lta kha yang bdag tu chags pa la sogs pa'i rgyu bdag tu lta ba dang 'gal ba yin no zhes pa rang bzhin no //
translated: In the same way, the view of selflessness is the opposite of the view of self, which is the cause of attachment to self and so on.

original: de de ltar mkhyen nas bdag med pa mthong ba de mang po rnam pa du mar dus ring por goms pa las de dang de'i mi mthun phyogs la yon tan dang skyon rnams thams cad rnam pa thams cad du rab tu gsal bar 'gyur ro //🔽gang zhig gang la shes rab can gyis mang por rnam pa du mar dus ring por goms par byed pa de de dang de'i mi mthun phyogs la skyon dang yon @7a * //
analyzed: de de ltar mkhyen nas bdag med pa mthong ba de mang po rnam pa du mar dus ring por goms pa las de dang de'i mi mthun phyogs la yon tan dang skyon rnams thams cad rnam pa thams cad du rab tu gsal bar 'gyur ro // gang zhig gang la shes rab can gyis mang por rnam pa du mar dus ring por goms par byed pa de de dang de'i mi mthun phyogs la skyon dang yon @7a * //
translated: Having understood this, the one who sees selflessness, through long and extensive cultivation of that view, will clearly see the faults and virtues of the opposing view.

original: tan rnams rab tu gsal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: tan rnams rab tu gsal bar 'gyur te /
translated: The wise who cultivate something extensively, in many ways and for a long time, will clearly see the faults and virtues of the opposing view.

original: dper na shes rab can 'ga' zhig bzo'i khyad par 'ga' zhig la mngon par sbyor ba goms pa bzhin /
analyzed: dper na shes rab can 'ga' zhig bzo'i khyad par 'ga' zhig la mngon par sbyor ba goms pa bzhin /
translated: For example, some wise people who apply themselves to some particular craft become skilled through practice.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang bdag med par lta ba la rnam pa du mar mang pos yun ring por goms par mdzad zin pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang bdag med par lta ba la rnam pa du mar mang pos yun ring por goms par mdzad zin pa yin no //
translated: The Lord has already cultivated the view of selflessness for a long time in many ways.

original: rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin no //
translated: Nature

original: thabs goms par byed pa 'di kho na yang lam gyi bden pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: thabs goms par byed pa 'di kho na yang lam gyi bden pa zhes brjod do //
translated: This very cultivation of the means is called the Truth of the Path.

original: de'i rnam pa 'di lta bu'i thabs goms pa gzhan dang / thun mong ma yin pa las sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i bag chags kyang ma lus te /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa 'di lta bu'i thabs goms pa gzhan dang / thun mong ma yin pa las sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i bag chags kyang ma lus te /
translated: From this cultivation of the means with such an aspect, the latent impressions of the cause of suffering are also completely eliminated.

original: 'di kho na bcom ldan 'das kyi bse ru la sogs pa las khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'di kho na bcom ldan 'das kyi bse ru la sogs pa las khyad par ro //
translated: This alone is the difference of the Lord from the rhinoceros-like.

original: gzhan gyi don la gtso bor 'jug pas kyang 'dis rnam pa 'di lta bu'i goms pa gdon mi za bar bya ste /🔽mi mthun phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs mtha' dag yongs su mi shes pas na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la gtso bor 'jug pas kyang 'dis rnam pa 'di lta bu'i goms pa gdon mi za bar bya ste / mi mthun phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs mtha' dag yongs su mi shes pas na /
translated: One who engages primarily in the welfare of others should undoubtedly cultivate this kind of aspect.🔽Because without fully understanding all the counteragents and their antidotes,

original: gzhan rnams la mi mthun phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs dag nye bar bstan par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams la mi mthun phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs dag nye bar bstan par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa'o //
translated: one is unable to teach the counteragents and their antidotes to others.

original: thabs goms par byed pa 'di dang sngar bstan pa'i thugs rje ni rgyu phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: thabs goms par byed pa 'di dang sngar bstan pa'i thugs rje ni rgyu phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: This cultivation of the means and the previously explained compassion are the perfect cause.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'o //🔽de la rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa ni ji skad bshad pa'i thabs goms pa las sdug bsngal gyi rgyu snga ma rang gi ngang gis 'gag pa na bdag med pa mthong ba de'i bdag nyid du gyur par gnas pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu phyi ma mi
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'o // de la rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa ni ji skad bshad pa'i thabs goms pa las sdug bsngal gyi rgyu snga ma rang gi ngang gis 'gag pa na bdag med pa mthong ba de'i bdag nyid du gyur par gnas pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu phyi ma mi
translated: Its result is the perfection of one's own and others' goals.🔽Therein, the perfection of one's own goal is the special state characterized by the non-arising of the future causes of suffering, which is the cessation of the former causes of suffering by the natural power of cultivating the previously explained means.

original: skye ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par te gang la 'gog pa'i bden pa zhes brjod pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par te gang la 'gog pa'i bden pa zhes brjod pa'o //
translated: It is the state of the one who sees selflessness.

original: de kho na khyad par gsum gyis khyad par du 'phags pa ni bde bar gshegs pa nyid ces brjod do //
analyzed: de kho na khyad par gsum gyis khyad par du 'phags pa ni bde bar gshegs pa nyid ces brjod do //
translated: That very reality, distinguished by the three special qualities, is called the state of the Sugata.

original: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa de ston par byed pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa de ston par byed pa gsungs pa /
translated: The perfection of one's own goal is taught by the following verse.

original: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa ni bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyis te zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa ni bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyis te zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The fulfillment of one's own aim is by the Sugata himself.

original: su'i sgra 'di ni 'dir rab tu gyur pa nyid la sogs pa'i don gsal bar byed par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: su'i sgra 'di ni 'dir rab tu gyur pa nyid la sogs pa'i don gsal bar byed par rig par bya'o //
translated: The word his here makes clear the sense of his own and so on.

original: gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: don rnam pa gsum nye bar blangs nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: don rnam pa gsum nye bar blangs nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Having taken up the three kinds of aims.

original: mchog tu gshegs shing thob pa ni bde bar gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: mchog tu gshegs shing thob pa ni bde bar gshegs pa ste /
translated: Sugata is one who has gone to the supreme and attained it.

original: mchog nyid kyang slar sdug bsngal gyi rten ma yin pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: mchog nyid kyang slar sdug bsngal gyi rten ma yin pa nyid kyis te /
translated: Supreme means that he is not a basis for suffering.

original: 'jig rten na bde ba dang de'i rgyu ni mchog ces brjod do //
analyzed: 'jig rten na bde ba dang de'i rgyu ni mchog ces brjod do //
translated: In the world, happiness and its cause are called supreme.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rten ma yin pa de yang bdag @7b med par lta ba shin tu goms pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rten ma yin pa de yang bdag @7b med par lta ba shin tu goms pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: And that he is not a basis for suffering is due to his thorough habituation to the view of selflessness.

original: yang na brjod ma thag pa'i thabs kyis rigs pa mthong bas gshegs pa'i phyir mchog tu gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: yang na brjod ma thag pa'i thabs kyis rigs pa mthong bas gshegs pa'i phyir mchog tu gshegs pa ste /
translated: Or else, he is a Sugata because he has gone to the supreme by seeing it through the method just mentioned.

original: 'jig rten na gang rigs pa sngon du 'gro bas 'jug pa de mchog tu bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten na gang rigs pa sngon du 'gro bas 'jug pa de mchog tu bya ba'o //
translated: In the world, that which is undertaken with reason is the best.

original: slar mi ldog par gshegs pas na bde bar gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: slar mi ldog par gshegs pas na bde bar gshegs pa ste /
translated: He is the Sugata because he has gone to the state of non-returning.

original: slar mi ldog pa ni skye ba dang skyon 'byung ba med pa yin la /
analyzed: slar mi ldog pa ni skye ba dang skyon 'byung ba med pa yin la /
translated: Non-returning is the non-occurrence of birth and faults.

original: de yang de'i rgyu sngar brjod med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang de'i rgyu sngar brjod med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is because its cause is not mentioned previously.

original: gang bdag tu lta ba dang chags pa dag med pa de la skye ba dang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i skyon 'byung ba med de //
analyzed: gang bdag tu lta ba dang chags pa dag med pa de la skye ba dang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i skyon 'byung ba med de //
translated: For one who is without the view of self and attachment, there is no occurrence of birth, desire, and so on,

original: dper na nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: just as in the case of space.

original: bdag med par lta ba de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa la yang bdag tu lta ba dang chags pa dag med do //
analyzed: bdag med par lta ba de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa la yang bdag tu lta ba dang chags pa dag med do //
translated: And for one who has become of the nature of the view of selflessness, there is no view of self and attachment.

original: rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The cause is not observed.

original: ma lus par gshegs pa ni bde bar gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: ma lus par gshegs pa ni bde bar gshegs pa ste /
translated: He is the Sugata because he has gone to the state of non-remainder.

original: 'di'i lus pa med par gyur pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di'i lus pa med par gyur pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “his non-remainder” is to be supplied.

original: lus la yang lus la sogs pa las su mi rung ba ste /
analyzed: lus la yang lus la sogs pa las su mi rung ba ste /
translated: And the body is not suitable as a remainder, and so on.

original: de yang rim pa ji lta bar rtsab krol can ma yin na yang goms pa las mchod zhing 'gro ba la sogs pa dang / nga'i snyam pa'i nga rgyal med na yang rmangs mo zhes smra ba la sogs pa dang / rtag tu mnyam par bzhag pa ma yin pas mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems kyi gnas skabs so //
analyzed: de yang rim pa ji lta bar rtsab krol can ma yin na yang goms pa las mchod zhing 'gro ba la sogs pa dang / nga'i snyam pa'i nga rgyal med na yang rmangs mo zhes smra ba la sogs pa dang / rtag tu mnyam par bzhag pa ma yin pas mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems kyi gnas skabs so //
translated: Furthermore, in order, if one is not a troublemaker, one is a worshipper, one goes to the village, etc. If one does not have the pride of thinking “I,” one is called a “fool,” etc. If one is not always in equipoise, one is in a state of mind that is not in equipoise.

original: yang na rnam pa de lta bu'i lam goms pa med pas lam dang de'i mi mthun phyogs dag shin tu yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir /
