analyzed: yang na rnam pa de lta bu'i lam goms pa med pas lam dang de'i mi mthun phyogs dag shin tu yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, because one does not cultivate a path of that kind, one does not know the path and its opposite very well.

original: khong du chud pa'i lam gyi rnam par dbye ba ston pa yang mi gsal ba nyid lus pa ste /
analyzed: khong du chud pa'i lam gyi rnam par dbye ba ston pa yang mi gsal ba nyid lus pa ste /
translated: The teaching of the classification of the path of understanding is also unclear.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis spangs pas de'i phyir 'di bde bar gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis spangs pas de'i phyir 'di bde bar gshegs pa'o //
translated: And that is abandoned by the Bhagavān, therefore he is the Sugata.

original: don gsum po 'di yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: don gsum po 'di yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The three topics are also, etc.

original: de la phyi rol pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams ni bdag tu lta ba'i rjes su song ba sdug bsngal gyi rten nyid kyi lam gyis 'gro ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la phyi rol pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams ni bdag tu lta ba'i rjes su song ba sdug bsngal gyi rten nyid kyi lam gyis 'gro ba'i phyir /
translated: Those non-Buddhists who are free from attachment, because they follow the view of self, go by a path that is the basis of suffering.

original: de'i dbang gis slar yang sdug bsngal la rten par byed la /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis slar yang sdug bsngal la rten par byed la /
translated: By the power of that, they again take up the basis of suffering.

original: rigs pa mthong ba'i lam gyis song ba yang ma yin no zhes pa de'i phyir de rnams mchog tu phyin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa mthong ba'i lam gyis song ba yang ma yin no zhes pa de'i phyir de rnams mchog tu phyin pa ma yin no //
translated: And they do not go by the path of seeing reality. Therefore, they do not go to the supreme.

original: de ltar ni 'jig rten na /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'jig rten na /
translated: In the world,

original: gang sdug bsngal la rten par byed pa dang / rigs pa sngon ma can ma yin par 'jug pa de bsngags par 'os pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang smad par 'os pa kho na'o //🔽slob pa rnams ni gal te yang sdug bsngal gyi rten ma yin pa dang rigs @8a * //
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal la rten par byed pa dang / rigs pa sngon ma can ma yin par 'jug pa de bsngags par 'os pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang smad par 'os pa kho na'o // slob pa rnams ni gal te yang sdug bsngal gyi rten ma yin pa dang rigs @8a * //
translated: those who take up the basis of suffering and who engage in it without the prior understanding of reality are not to be praised, but are to be criticized.

original: pas nges pa'i lam gyis mchog tu gshegs mod /
analyzed: pas nges pa'i lam gyis mchog tu gshegs mod /
translated: Even though trainees do not take up the basis of suffering and go to the supreme by the path that is ascertained by reasoning,🔽they are to be praised.

original: de lta na yang de rnams kyi skyon rnams dang skye ba yang slar yang 'byung ngo zhes pa de rnams kyang gnyis pa'i don gyis bde bar gshegs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang de rnams kyi skyon rnams dang skye ba yang slar yang 'byung ngo zhes pa de rnams kyang gnyis pa'i don gyis bde bar gshegs pa ma yin no //
translated: However, their faults and births occur again, and so they are not Sugatas in the sense of the second meaning.

original: mi slob pa rnams kyang don gnyis kyis bde bar gshegs par ni 'dod kyi /
analyzed: mi slob pa rnams kyang don gnyis kyis bde bar gshegs par ni 'dod kyi /
translated: The non-learners are accepted as Sugatas in the sense of the two meanings,

original: ma lus pa'i don gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ma lus pa'i don gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: but not in the sense of the complete meaning,

original: ji skad bshad pa'i lus la ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i lus la ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the body, as explained, is not abandoned.

original: gzhan don phun sum tshogs pa ni sgrol ba'i don gyis na zhes pa 'dis skyob pa'i sgra'i don gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan don phun sum tshogs pa ni sgrol ba'i don gyis na zhes pa 'dis skyob pa'i sgra'i don gsungs so //
translated: The perfection of the benefit of others is by the meaning of “deliverer.” This declares the meaning of the term “protector.”

original: 'dis 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las sems can rnams bsgral bar bya bas na sgrol ba ste rang gis mthong ba'i lam nye bar ston pa'o //🔽de kho na'i don te /
analyzed: 'dis 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las sems can rnams bsgral bar bya bas na sgrol ba ste rang gis mthong ba'i lam nye bar ston pa'o // de kho na'i don te /
translated: It is a deliverer because it delivers sentient beings from the ocean of cyclic existence. It is the meaning of reality

original: thar pa'i thabs 'dod pa rnams kyis don du gnyer bar bya bas na'o zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: thar pa'i thabs 'dod pa rnams kyis don du gnyer bar bya bas na'o zhes byas nas so //
translated: because it is the object of those who desire the method of liberation.

original: de 'di la yod do zhes pa'i don des bcom ldan 'das skyob pa nyid do //
analyzed: de 'di la yod do zhes pa'i don des bcom ldan 'das skyob pa nyid do //
translated: The meaning of the compound is that the Blessed One is the protector.

original: 'di kho na t'a ya ti'i don gzhan skyong ba ste /
analyzed: 'di kho na t'a ya ti'i don gzhan skyong ba ste /
translated: The meaning of the word “protector” is “one who protects others.”

original: 'di lta ste 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las sgrol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las sgrol ba'o //
translated: That is, he delivers them from the ocean of cyclic existence.

original: de phyin ci log tu nye bar ston pa yang mi srid de /
analyzed: de phyin ci log tu nye bar ston pa yang mi srid de /
translated: It is impossible for him to teach falsely,

original: de'i rgyu med pa'i phyir dang brtse ba'i bdag nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu med pa'i phyir dang brtse ba'i bdag nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: because he has no cause for doing so and because he is compassionate by nature.

original: lam legs par rig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: lam legs par rig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: He knows the path well.

original: chags pa la sogs pa'i skyon rnams ni phyin ci log tu mngon par brjod pa'i rgyu 'am /🔽kha cig dgos pa yin la /
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa'i skyon rnams ni phyin ci log tu mngon par brjod pa'i rgyu 'am / kha cig dgos pa yin la /
translated: The faults of attachment and so on are the cause of false speech or the purpose of false speech.

original: de yang med de /
analyzed: de yang med de /
translated: But he has no such faults.

original: brtse ba de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yang gzhan gyi de kho nar sdug bsngal zad pa'i thabs bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: brtse ba de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yang gzhan gyi de kho nar sdug bsngal zad pa'i thabs bsgrubs nas /
translated: Even if he were compassionate by nature, he would still have no need to establish a method for others to end suffering.

original: ci ltar rnam pa gzhan du ston //
analyzed: ci ltar rnam pa gzhan du ston //
translated: How could he teach falsely?

original: gang gang gi tshe brdzun du smra ba'i rgyu rnams med pa de de'i tshe brdzun mi smra ste /
analyzed: gang gang gi tshe brdzun du smra ba'i rgyu rnams med pa de de'i tshe brdzun mi smra ste /
translated: When there is no cause for false speech, he does not speak falsely.

original: dper na gzhan 'ga' zhig bden par smra ba'i dus na bzhin bde bar gshegs pa'i gnas skabs kyi dus na yang de la brdzun gyi rgyu rnams med do //
analyzed: dper na gzhan 'ga' zhig bden par smra ba'i dus na bzhin bde bar gshegs pa'i gnas skabs kyi dus na yang de la brdzun gyi rgyu rnams med do //
translated: For example, when someone is speaking the truth, his face is serene.

original: rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The non-apprehension of a cause.

original: gang zhig gang gi don bya ba'i ched du gang la brtse bas don gang sgrub par byed ba'i don de grub zin pa na de'i yul la snying rje ma btang ba de der de la mi slu ste /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi don bya ba'i ched du gang la brtse bas don gang sgrub par byed ba'i don de grub zin pa na de'i yul la snying rje ma btang ba de der de la mi slu ste /
translated: When the object of an action has been accomplished, the compassion of the one who has accomplished it is not abandoned with regard to the object.

original: dper na bu la phan pa'i zas kyi ched du bza' ba bsgrubs zin pa'i ma bzhin /
analyzed: dper na bu la phan pa'i zas kyi ched du bza' ba bsgrubs zin pa'i ma bzhin /
translated: For example, a mother, having prepared food for the sake of her son’s welfare, does not abandon her affection for him when the object, the food, has been accomplished.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang sems can gyi don bya ba'i ched du sems can la brtse bas sdug bsngal zad par byed pa'i thabs bsgrubs shing de'i yul la thugs rje ma btang ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang sems can gyi don bya ba'i ched du sems can la brtse bas sdug bsngal zad par byed pa'i thabs bsgrubs shing de'i yul la thugs rje ma btang ba'o //
translated: The Lord, having accomplished the means of eliminating the suffering of sentient beings out of compassion for sentient beings for the sake of accomplishing their aims, does not abandon his compassion for them.

original: khyab byed dang 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: khyab byed dang 'gal ba'o //
translated: The contradiction with the pervader.

original: de'i phyir tshad ma'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma'o //
translated: Therefore, it is valid cognition.

original: gang zhig gang don du @8b gnyer ba la don de'i thabs phyin ci ma log par 'chad par byed pa de ni de'i de la tshad ma ste /
analyzed: gang zhig gang don du @8b gnyer ba la don de'i thabs phyin ci ma log par 'chad par byed pa de ni de'i de la tshad ma ste /
translated: He is a valid cognition for that person who is seeking that object, because he explains the unmistaken method for attaining that object.

original: dper na nad pa nad med pa nyid don du gnyer ba la /
analyzed: dper na nad pa nad med pa nyid don du gnyer ba la /
translated: For example, a doctor is a valid cognition for a sick person who is seeking to be well.

original: nad med pa nyid kyi thabs phyin ci ma log par 'chad pa'i sman pa la de bzhin /
analyzed: nad med pa nyid kyi thabs phyin ci ma log par 'chad pa'i sman pa la de bzhin /
translated: The doctor explains the unmistaken method for attaining good health.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang sdug bsngal zad pa don du gnyer ba la sdug bsngal zad par byed pa'i thabs phyin ci ma log par 'chad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang sdug bsngal zad pa don du gnyer ba la sdug bsngal zad par byed pa'i thabs phyin ci ma log par 'chad do //
translated: Similarly, the Bhagavat explains the unmistaken method for attaining the cessation of suffering for those who seek the cessation of suffering.

original: rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin no //
translated: This is his nature.

original: de ltar tshad mar gyur pa zhes pa 'di kho na bstod pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: de ltar tshad mar gyur pa zhes pa 'di kho na bstod pa'i tshig ste /
translated: This statement, “He is a valid cognition,” is a verse of praise.

original: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes kyi mtshan nyid tshad ma nyid thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan gsal par byas shing /
analyzed: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes kyi mtshan nyid tshad ma nyid thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan gsal par byas shing /
translated: It clarifies the Bhagavat’s unique quality of being a valid cognition, which is the characteristic of his wisdom.

original: gang gi phyir de dang ldan pa'i phyir de tshad mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dang ldan pa'i phyir de tshad mar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because he possesses that, he is a valid cognition.

original: yon tan de ni rgyu med par mi 'grub po zhes ston par byed pas rgyu phun sum tshogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: yon tan de ni rgyu med par mi 'grub po zhes ston par byed pas rgyu phun sum tshogs pa gsungs so //
translated: This shows that those qualities are not accomplished without a cause, so the perfect cause is taught.

original: bde gshegs kyi sgras ni ye shes de'i mi mthun phyogs spangs pa'i khyad par 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pas bsdus pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bde gshegs kyi sgras ni ye shes de'i mi mthun phyogs spangs pa'i khyad par 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pas bsdus pa gsungs so //
translated: The word “sugata” teaches the special abandonment of the opposite of that wisdom, which is included in the perfect result.

original: de med na mchod pa la sogs par 'gro ba bzhin du ngag las go bar bya ba'i don rigs pa ma yin pa yang gsal bar byed pa'i lus kyis bya ba byed /
analyzed: de med na mchod pa la sogs par 'gro ba bzhin du ngag las go bar bya ba'i don rigs pa ma yin pa yang gsal bar byed pa'i lus kyis bya ba byed /
translated: If that were not so, then just like going to a place of worship, it would not be reasonable for the meaning to be understood from the words.

original: rmangs mo zhes smra ba la sogs pa bzhin du mi legs pa gzhan yang 'ga' zhig gi tshe smra bar byed /🔽rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa nyid kyis lung du ma bstan pa'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: rmangs mo zhes smra ba la sogs pa bzhin du mi legs pa gzhan yang 'ga' zhig gi tshe smra bar byed / rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa nyid kyis lung du ma bstan pa'i gnas skabs na /
translated: Also, at some times, one would speak unpleasantly, like a woman of the lower classes.

original: sems can gyi don bya ba mtha' dag nus pa ma yin par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba mtha' dag nus pa ma yin par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Because one is not always in equipoise, one would not be able to benefit sentient beings in all situations.

original: yang na gsal ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bag chags dang bcas pa ma spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na gsal ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bag chags dang bcas pa ma spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, because the opposite of clarity, together with its traces, would not be abandoned,

original: 'di'i rtogs pa'i lam rab tu gsal bar byed pa gsal pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'di'i rtogs pa'i lam rab tu gsal bar byed pa gsal pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin zhing /
translated: The path of realization of this is not clear, nor is it clear itself.

original: de yod na ni skyon 'di rnams 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i ched du spangs pa'i khyad par gsungs so //
analyzed: de yod na ni skyon 'di rnams 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i ched du spangs pa'i khyad par gsungs so //
translated: If it were, these errors would occur. This is why the special quality of abandonment is mentioned.

original: skyob pa zhes pa 'dis ni ye shes de nyid kyi bya ba'i khyad par ji ltar mthong ba'i lam nye bar ston pa bstan to //
analyzed: skyob pa zhes pa 'dis ni ye shes de nyid kyi bya ba'i khyad par ji ltar mthong ba'i lam nye bar ston pa bstan to //
translated: The word “protector” shows the special activity of that wisdom, which is the teaching of the path of seeing.

original: gal te de mi 'gyur na de tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te de mi 'gyur na de tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur la /
translated: If it were not so, it would not be valid cognition.

original: gal te rnam pa 'di lta bu de'i 'bras bur 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa 'di lta bu de'i 'bras bur 'gyur na /
translated: If that kind of aspect were the result of that,

original: de ltar de dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar de dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: then because it would possess that,

original: bcom ldan 'das ma rtogs pa'i don gsal bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma rtogs pa'i don gsal bar byed pa'am /
translated: the Bhagavatī would be the clear realization of the meaning of realization

original: de la mi bslu ba yin gyi rnam pa gzhan du na ma yin no zhes pa de'i phyir bya ba'i khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: de la mi bslu ba yin gyi rnam pa gzhan du na ma yin no zhes pa de'i phyir bya ba'i khyad par bstan to //
translated: or it would be undeceiving with regard to that, but not in any other way. Therefore the special activity is taught.

original: brtse ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: brtse ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs na /
translated: When the bodhisattva is in the state of loving kindness,

original: gang rang gi ngang gis 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bde bar @9a * //
analyzed: gang rang gi ngang gis 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bde bar @9a * //
translated: That which occurs by its own nature is the state of the Sugata.

original: gshegs pa'i gnas skabs nam brjod kyang grub pa kho na'o zhes pas ma brjod do //
analyzed: gshegs pa'i gnas skabs nam brjod kyang grub pa kho na'o zhes pas ma brjod do //
translated: When it is said that it is accomplished, it is not said that it is not accomplished.

original: de med na phan pa nye bar bstan pa mi nus pa kho na'o zhes de yang de'i gzhan gyi don gyi dor lhan cig byed par gyur par rig par bya'o //🔽de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi ya shes kyi mtshan nyid tshad ma nyid rgyu dang bcas pa mi mthun phyogs spangs pa'i khyad par bcas pa bya ba'i khyad par dang bcas pa /
analyzed: de med na phan pa nye bar bstan pa mi nus pa kho na'o zhes de yang de'i gzhan gyi don gyi dor lhan cig byed par gyur par rig par bya'o // de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi ya shes kyi mtshan nyid tshad ma nyid rgyu dang bcas pa mi mthun phyogs spangs pa'i khyad par bcas pa bya ba'i khyad par dang bcas pa /
translated: If it did not exist, it would be impossible to demonstrate the benefit. Therefore, it should be understood that it is the cooperative condition for the benefit of others.🔽Thus, the Blessed One has clarified the valid knowledge that has the characteristic of exalted wisdom, along with its cause, its distinction that abandons the opposing factors, and its distinction of activity.

original: rgyur gyur pa'i khyad par bcas pa gsal bar byas so zhes pa 'di ni re zhig rim pa bzhin bshad pa ste /
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa'i khyad par bcas pa gsal bar byas so zhes pa 'di ni re zhig rim pa bzhin bshad pa ste /
translated: This is the explanation in order.

original: gang du brtse ba la sogs pa rnams kyis ston pa nyid la sogs pa rnams srid par rjes su dpog pa'o //
analyzed: gang du brtse ba la sogs pa rnams kyis ston pa nyid la sogs pa rnams srid par rjes su dpog pa'o //
translated: Where compassion and so on are inferred to exist in the Teacher and so on,

original: da ni rim pa bzlog pas bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni rim pa bzlog pas bshad par bya ste /
translated: now it will be explained in reverse order.

original: yang na skyob pa ni phyin ci ma log pa'i bden pa nye bar ston pa ste /
analyzed: yang na skyob pa ni phyin ci ma log pa'i bden pa nye bar ston pa ste /
translated: Or, “protection” means teaching the truth without error.🔽The Bhagavat taught to sentient beings the cause of the pacification of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba'i rgyu de bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can rnams la bstan to zhes de ni de don du gnyer ba de rnams kyi de la tshad ma'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba'i rgyu de bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can rnams la bstan to zhes de ni de don du gnyer ba de rnams kyi de la tshad ma'o //
translated: That is the valid cognition of those who seek that goal.

original: gang zhig gang sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba don du gnyer ba gang la /
analyzed: gang zhig gang sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba don du gnyer ba gang la /
translated: The one who seeks the pacification of suffering is the valid cognition of that.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin da dang / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu de dang / de'i sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba dang / sdug bsngal de rab tu zhi ba'i thabs ji lta ba bzhin 'chad pa de de'i de la tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin da dang / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu de dang / de'i sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba dang / sdug bsngal de rab tu zhi ba'i thabs ji lta ba bzhin 'chad pa de de'i de la tshad ma yin te /
translated: The one who explains the nature of suffering, the cause of suffering, the pacification of suffering, and the method of pacifying suffering, as they are, is the valid cognition of that.

original: dper na nad pa nad kyi sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba don du gnyer ba la nad kyi sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin la sogs pa ji ltar gyur pa 'chad pa'i sman pa ni de'i de la bzhin /
analyzed: dper na nad pa nad kyi sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba don du gnyer ba la nad kyi sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin la sogs pa ji ltar gyur pa 'chad pa'i sman pa ni de'i de la bzhin /
translated: For example, a physician who explains the nature of the suffering of a patient’s illness and so on, as they are, is the valid cognition of that patient who seeks the pacification of the suffering of illness.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba'i don du gnyer ba'i skyes bu la 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba'i don du gnyer ba'i skyes bu la 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin bshad pa yin no //
translated: The Lord also explained the nature of the suffering of cyclic existence, etc. to those persons who seek the pacification of the suffering of cyclic existence, just as it is.

original: rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin no //
translated: Nature

original: bden pa de rnams kyang shas kyis bstan zin to //
analyzed: bden pa de rnams kyang shas kyis bstan zin to //
translated: Those truths have been taught in part.

original: ji ltar sdug bsngal ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ji ltar sdug bsngal ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: How is suffering? It is characterized by the five appropriative aggregates.

original: de'i kun 'byung ba ni sred pa ste /
analyzed: de'i kun 'byung ba ni sred pa ste /
translated: Its origination is craving,

original: de las sdug bsngal ji ltar rigs par 'byung ba'o //🔽'gog pa ni lam de'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu snga ma 'gags par gyur na /
analyzed: de las sdug bsngal ji ltar rigs par 'byung ba'o // 'gog pa ni lam de'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu snga ma 'gags par gyur na /
translated: from which suffering arises in a suitable way.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu phyi ma mi skye ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu phyi ma mi skye ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par ro //
translated: Cessation is a special state characterized by the non-arising of future causes of suffering when the former causes of suffering that exist in the nature of the path are ceased.

original: lam ni bdag med pa mthong ba goms par byed pa ste /
analyzed: lam ni bdag med pa mthong ba goms par byed pa ste /
translated: The path is the cultivation of the vision of selflessness,

original: ji ltar de las 'gog pa thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar de las 'gog pa thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: by which one attains cessation.

original: 'di thams cad @9b sngar kho nar bsdus pas bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'di thams cad @9b sngar kho nar bsdus pas bstan zin to //
translated: All of this has already been included in the above and so has been explained.

original: de'i phyir bden pa bzhi mthong ba las grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bden pa bzhi mthong ba las grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, one becomes liberated through seeing the four noble truths.

original: de'i phyir de nye bar ston pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nye bar ston pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the teaching of that is

original: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las grol ba sgrub par byed pa nyid kyi phyir skyob pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las grol ba sgrub par byed pa nyid kyi phyir skyob pa'o //
translated: the refuge because it is the means of liberation from the ocean of cyclic existence.

original: 'di tsam nyid kyang gzhan la phan par 'dod pas bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di tsam nyid kyang gzhan la phan par 'dod pas bya ba yin te /
translated: This alone is what should be done by one who desires to benefit others,

original: 'di lta ste spang bya dang / blang bya'i de kho na nyid thabs dang bcas pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste spang bya dang / blang bya'i de kho na nyid thabs dang bcas pa ston pa'o //
translated: namely, the teaching of the reality of what is to be abandoned and what is to be adopted, along with the means.

original: da yang bcom ldan 'das kyis mdzad do //
analyzed: da yang bcom ldan 'das kyis mdzad do //
translated: The Blessed One has done just that.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu 'di las lags pa la sogs pa khyad par gsum gyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i ye shes rjes su dpag ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu 'di las lags pa la sogs pa khyad par gsum gyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i ye shes rjes su dpag ste /
translated: Therefore, one infers that his gnosis is superior through three distinctions: its result, its object, and its basis.

original: 'dar gshegs pa rtogs pa'i don can la brten pa las so //
analyzed: 'dar gshegs pa rtogs pa'i don can la brten pa las so //
translated: Here, “gone” has the sense of realization, and it is based on that.

original: sngar ni gshegs pa thob pa'i don can la brten nas spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i 'bras bur brjod la /
analyzed: sngar ni gshegs pa thob pa'i don can la brten nas spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i 'bras bur brjod la /
translated: Previously, “gone” had the sense of attainment, and it was said to be the result of the perfection of abandonment.

original: da lta ni ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i ste legs par rtogs pa nas ma lus par rtogs pa zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: da lta ni ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i ste legs par rtogs pa nas ma lus par rtogs pa zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Now, it is the perfect knowledge, i.e., from the complete understanding of the knowledge up to the complete understanding of the knowledge.

original: de ltar bde bar gshegs pa nyid rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bde bar gshegs pa nyid rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the state of the Sugata should be known.

original: de la legs pa nyid ni ye shes de'i yul de kho na nyid yin pa nyid kyi phyir la /
analyzed: de la legs pa nyid ni ye shes de'i yul de kho na nyid yin pa nyid kyi phyir la /
translated: There, the excellence is due to the fact that the object of that knowledge is reality itself.

original: de yang des bstan pa'i lam tshad mas mi bslu ba las rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: de yang des bstan pa'i lam tshad mas mi bslu ba las rjes su dpag go //
translated: And that is inferred from the path taught by him, which is not deceptive because of valid cognition.

original: slar mi ldog pa nyid ni brten pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: slar mi ldog pa nyid ni brten pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: The irreversibility is due to the fact that it is firm.

original: de yang des nges pa'i lam la tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod pa med pa las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang des nges pa'i lam la tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod pa med pa las shes par bya'o //
translated: And that is to be known from the path ascertained by him, which is not invalidated by another valid cognition.

original: yang na rnam par g-yo ba med pa'i ste snga ma dang phyi ma'i gsung gzhom du med pa ste /
analyzed: yang na rnam par g-yo ba med pa'i ste snga ma dang phyi ma'i gsung gzhom du med pa ste /
translated: Or else, it is the absence of movement, i.e., the indestructibility of the former and latter speech,

original: gsung rab thams cad la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ston pa la gsung ngag gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gsung rab thams cad la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ston pa la gsung ngag gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because there is only one speech in all the scriptures that teaches the four noble truths.

original: lus pa yang 'dir 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rtogs pa rnams la yang /
analyzed: lus pa yang 'dir 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rtogs pa rnams la yang /
translated: And the remainder is for those who have realized the four noble truths here.

original: ye shes sgrub pa la mi mkhas pa yin la /
analyzed: ye shes sgrub pa la mi mkhas pa yin la /
translated: He is not skilled in the realization of knowledge.

original: de med pa las ma lus pa'i ye shes rjes su dpag ste /
analyzed: de med pa las ma lus pa'i ye shes rjes su dpag ste /
translated: From the absence of that, he infers the knowledge of all things.

original: thabs sna tshogs pa rnams kyis bden pa ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs sna tshogs pa rnams kyis bden pa ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He teaches the truth by various means.

original: nyan thos rnams kyi mkhas pa ni cung zad tsam ste /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi mkhas pa ni cung zad tsam ste /
translated: The knowledge of the Sravakas is slight.

original: de yang de'i rjes su bslab pa las so//
analyzed: de yang de'i rjes su bslab pa las so//
translated: And that is from training in that.

original: de'i byir de kho na nyid dang bstan pa nyid dang ma lus pa nyid kyi khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis /
analyzed: de'i byir de kho na nyid dang bstan pa nyid dang ma lus pa nyid kyi khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis /
translated: By the superiority of his knowledge, which is distinguished by reality, teaching, and totality,

original: bcom ldan 'das phyi rol pa dang slob pa dang mi slob pa rnams las lhag pa yin no //🔽de kho na nyid kyi khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis ni phyi @10a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das phyi rol pa dang slob pa dang mi slob pa rnams las lhag pa yin no // de kho na nyid kyi khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis ni phyi @10a * //
translated: the Lord is superior to the outsiders, the trainees, and the adepts.

original: rol pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams las lhag ste /
analyzed: rol pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams las lhag ste /
translated: By the superiority of his knowledge of reality, he is superior to the outsiders who are free from passion.🔽By the superiority of his knowledge of teaching, he is superior to the trainees.

original: de ltar ni de rnams kyi shes pa ni tshad mas mi bslu ba'i spang bya dang blang bya'i yul can ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ni de rnams kyi shes pa ni tshad mas mi bslu ba'i spang bya dang blang bya'i yul can ma yin no //
translated: Thus, their knowledge is not a valid cognition that is undeceiving with regard to objects to be adopted or to be rejected.

original: brtan pa nyid kyi khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa ni slob pa rnams las te /
analyzed: brtan pa nyid kyi khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa ni slob pa rnams las te /
translated: They are superior by the distinction of stability to those in training,

original: de rnams kyis mngon par 'du byed pa can ma yin pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyis mngon par 'du byed pa can ma yin pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have not abandoned the view of the transitory collection that is not accompanied by thorough conditioning.

original: de kun du dpyod pa'i dus na slar yang ldog pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kun du dpyod pa'i dus na slar yang ldog pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is possible that they will again turn back when they thoroughly investigate that view.

original: ma lus pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa ni mi slob pa rnams las te /
analyzed: ma lus pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa ni mi slob pa rnams las te /
translated: They are superior by the distinction of being without remainder to those beyond training,

original: de rnams la ji skad bshad pa'i lus pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams la ji skad bshad pa'i lus pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible that they have a remainder of the aforementioned.

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i ye shes las gzhan don du lam goms ba rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i ye shes las gzhan don du lam goms ba rtogs par bya ste /
translated: The path that is cultivated for the sake of others should be understood to be different from this kind of knowledge.

original: gang gi phyir de rtogs nas kyang rang sangs rgyas bzhin du bya ba spangs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de rtogs nas kyang rang sangs rgyas bzhin du bya ba spangs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: For, even though they have realized that, they do not abandon activity, unlike the pratyekabuddhas.

original: 'o na ci zhe na ji ltar rtogs pa'i lam 'chad pa lhur len pa kho nar gyur pas so //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na ji ltar rtogs pa'i lam 'chad pa lhur len pa kho nar gyur pas so //
translated: What then? He is intent on teaching the path as it is realized.

original: gang gang rtogs na yang bya ba las mi ldog pa de de tsam gyi 'bras bu mngon par 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gang rtogs na yang bya ba las mi ldog pa de de tsam gyi 'bras bu mngon par 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: And when one realizes something, one does not desist from activity,

original: dper na zas thob na yang zas kyi ched du bya ba la mi ldog par 'jug pa bzhin /
analyzed: dper na zas thob na yang zas kyi ched du bya ba la mi ldog par 'jug pa bzhin /
translated: just as when one obtains food, one does not desist from the activity of obtaining food.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang ji skad bshad pa'i ye shes kyi khyad par rtogs na yang de tsam gyi bya ba las log par gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang ji skad bshad pa'i ye shes kyi khyad par rtogs na yang de tsam gyi bya ba las log par gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: And the Lord, when he realizes the special knowledge as it has been explained, does not desist from activity just because of that.

original: khyab byed dang 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: khyab byed dang 'gal ba'o //
translated: The contradiction with the pervasion is the second reason.

original: lam goms par byed pa de kho na ston pa nyid de nye bar btags pa las so zhes pa 'di ni brjod zin to //
analyzed: lam goms par byed pa de kho na ston pa nyid de nye bar btags pa las so zhes pa 'di ni brjod zin to //
translated: The teaching of just that which is cultivated in the path is a mere designation, as has already been said.

original: de las kyang brtse ba rjes su dpag ste /
analyzed: de las kyang brtse ba rjes su dpag ste /
translated: And from that, compassion is inferred,

original: gang gi phyir brtse ba dang ldan pa gzhan don la rab tu sbyor gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir brtse ba dang ldan pa gzhan don la rab tu sbyor gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: because one who has compassion is engaged in the welfare of others, but not one who does not.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa 'di lta bu'i rgyu dang 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pas bcom ldan 'das tshad ma'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa 'di lta bu'i rgyu dang 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pas bcom ldan 'das tshad ma'o //
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One is a valid cognizer due to the perfection of such causes and effects.

original: de ltar ni brtse bas don kho na nye par ston par 'dod cing /
analyzed: de ltar ni brtse bas don kho na nye par ston par 'dod cing /
translated: Thus, he wishes to teach only the meaning out of compassion,

original: brtse ba med pa ni shes kyang rnam pa gzhan du 'chad par byed do zhes brtse ba ni tshad ma nyid la yan lag gi dngos po'o //
analyzed: brtse ba med pa ni shes kyang rnam pa gzhan du 'chad par byed do zhes brtse ba ni tshad ma nyid la yan lag gi dngos po'o //
translated: and the non-compassionate one, even if he knows, explains in a different way. Thus, compassion is a factor of validity itself.

original: brtse ba dang ldan kyang mi shes pa las de kho na nyid bstan par mi nus la /
analyzed: brtse ba dang ldan kyang mi shes pa las de kho na nyid bstan par mi nus la /
translated: Even if one has compassion, one cannot teach reality without knowledge.

original: ye shes las ni yang dag pa kho na ston par byed do zhes pas ye shes kyang tshad ma nyid kyi ngor sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: ye shes las ni yang dag pa kho na ston par byed do zhes pas ye shes kyang tshad ma nyid kyi ngor sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: And knowledge alone teaches the truth. Thus, knowledge is also a factor establishing validity itself.

original: tshad ma nyid de yang rgyu dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: tshad ma nyid de yang rgyu dang bcas pa ste /
translated: That validity itself is also with cause.

original: de las 'di 'byung bar rigs so zhes pas rgyu phun sum tshogs pa brjod do //
analyzed: de las 'di 'byung bar rigs so zhes pas rgyu phun sum tshogs pa brjod do //
translated: Since it is reasonable that this arises from that, the perfection of cause is stated.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i 'bras @10b bu phun sum tshogs pa yod pa na de'i nye bar sbyor ba 'ga' zhig med na ni /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i 'bras @10b bu phun sum tshogs pa yod pa na de'i nye bar sbyor ba 'ga' zhig med na ni /
translated: If the perfect effect of that kind exists, and if some of its conditions are absent,

original: gal te rgyu phun sum tshogs pa med kyang 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa tshad ma nyid de 'gyur ba kho nar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu phun sum tshogs pa med kyang 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa tshad ma nyid de 'gyur ba kho nar 'gyur na /
translated: then if the perfect effect were to occur even in the absence of the perfect cause,

original: de ni de med par mi srid do zhes pa de nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: de ni de med par mi srid do zhes pa de nye bar len pa'o //
translated: it would be impossible for it not to exist in the absence of that cause. This is the appropriation.🔽By the word “only,” the Blessed One indicates that the perfect effect is only due to the perfect cause.🔽By the word “surely,” he indicates that the perfect effect is not due to any other cause.🔽By the word “necessarily,” he indicates that the perfect effect is not due to a cause that is not perfect.🔽By the word “indeed,” he indicates that the perfect effect is not due to a cause that is not perfect.🔽By the word “without doubt,” he indicates that the perfect effect is not due to a cause that is not perfect.

original: skyob pa nyid kyis ni gzhan rtogs par byed pa'i ngor gdon mi za bar mngon bar sbyor ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di bstan to //
analyzed: skyob pa nyid kyis ni gzhan rtogs par byed pa'i ngor gdon mi za bar mngon bar sbyor ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di bstan to //
translated: By the word “protection,” he indicates that the perfect effect is not due to a cause that is not perfect.🔽By the word “only,” he indicates that the perfect effect is not due to a cause that is not perfect.🔽By the word “surely,” he indicates that the perfect effect is not due to a cause that is not perfect.🔽By the word “necessarily,” he indicates that the perfect effect is not due to a cause that is not perfect.🔽By the word “indeed,” he indicates that the perfect effect is not due to a cause that is not perfect.🔽By the word “without doubt,” he indicates that the perfect effect is not due to a cause that is not perfect.🔽By the word “protection,” he indicates that the perfect effect is not due to a cause that is not perfect.🔽By the word “only,” he indicates that the perfect effect is not due to a cause that is not perfect.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar dge legs dang yang dag pa 'chad cing de 'chad pa la 'bad pa dang ldan pa de'i phyir tshad ma'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar dge legs dang yang dag pa 'chad cing de 'chad pa la 'bad pa dang ldan pa de'i phyir tshad ma'o //
translated: By the word “surely,” he indicates that the perfect effect is not due to a cause that is not perfect.🔽By the word “necessarily,” he indicates that the perfect effect is not due to a cause that is not perfect.🔽By the word “indeed,” he indicates that the perfect effect is not due to a cause that is not perfect.🔽By the word “without doubt,” he indicates that the perfect effect is not due to a cause that is not perfect.🔽By the word “protection,” he indicates that the perfect effect is not due to a cause that is not perfect.

original: gang gang gi ched du legs pa yang dag pa 'chad cing de 'chad pa la 'bad pa dang ldan pa de /🔽shes ldan des tshad mar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gang gi ched du legs pa yang dag pa 'chad cing de 'chad pa la 'bad pa dang ldan pa de /🔽shes ldan des tshad mar bya ba yin te /
translated: By the word “only,” he indicates that the perfect effect is not due to a cause that

original: dper na ji skad bshad pa'i yon tan rnams kyis slob ma'i ched du nye bar ston pa'i mkhan po ni slob ma shes ldan gyis bzhin /
analyzed: dper na ji skad bshad pa'i yon tan rnams kyis slob ma'i ched du nye bar ston pa'i mkhan po ni slob ma shes ldan gyis bzhin /
translated: For example, a preceptor who teaches for the sake of disciples, possessing the qualities explained above, is like a teacher for the wise disciples.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang sems can rnams kyi ched du legs pa yang dag pa 'chad cing de 'chad pa la yang 'bad pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang sems can rnams kyi ched du legs pa yang dag pa 'chad cing de 'chad pa la yang 'bad pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The Bhagavān also explains what is good for sentient beings and is diligent in teaching it.

original: rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin no //
translated: Nature

original: 'dir bshad pa'i rnam pa la brtson par byed do //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa'i rnam pa la brtson par byed do //
translated: Here, he is diligent in the aspects that are explained.

original: gal te shes pa yang tshad ma nyid kyi sgrub par byad pa nyid du rnam par gzhag par bya na snying rje la sogs pa gang gi sgrub par byed par bya ba tshad ma nyid de ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te shes pa yang tshad ma nyid kyi sgrub par byad pa nyid du rnam par gzhag par bya na snying rje la sogs pa gang gi sgrub par byed par bya ba tshad ma nyid de ci yin zhe na /
translated: If knowledge is also posited as a means of valid cognition, what is the means of valid cognition of compassion and so on?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: It is said:

original: nus pa'i khyad par te /
analyzed: nus pa'i khyad par te /
translated: The special ability.

original: gang yod na bcom ldan 'das kyis ma rtogs pa'i don rtogs par byed cing de la yang mi bslu bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang yod na bcom ldan 'das kyis ma rtogs pa'i don rtogs par byed cing de la yang mi bslu bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When it exists, the Bhagavān realizes the meaning that was not realized and is also undeceiving with regard to that.

original: nus pa'i khyad par de ni brtse ba la sogs pa rnams dang ldan par 'gyur gyi cig shos la ma yin no zhes de'i sgrub par byed pa nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: nus pa'i khyad par de ni brtse ba la sogs pa rnams dang ldan par 'gyur gyi cig shos la ma yin no zhes de'i sgrub par byed pa nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The difference in ability is that the former is endowed with love, etc., and the latter is not. This is the way to establish the proof.

original: rang gi rab tu byed pa rnams las zhes pa 'di ni rang gzhung zhes pa 'di'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rab tu byed pa rnams las zhes pa 'di ni rang gzhung zhes pa 'di'i bshad pa'o //
translated: The phrase in our own treatises explains the word ourselves.

original: sgo yi sgra kho nas kyang lngar bshad pa'i 'thor ba'i sgra'i don gsal ba kho nar rtogs par bya'o zhes pa rnam dbye med pa'o //
analyzed: sgo yi sgra kho nas kyang lngar bshad pa'i 'thor ba'i sgra'i don gsal ba kho nar rtogs par bya'o zhes pa rnam dbye med pa'o //
translated: The word only in the phrase only from the words of the gate should be understood to clarify the meaning of the word scattered in the explanation of the five. This is the absence of a case ending.

original: sgo ni dv'ar ra ste phyogs tsam ston pa mdor bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: sgo ni dv'ar ra ste phyogs tsam ston pa mdor bsdus pa ste /
translated: The word gate means door, which indicates a mere direction, a brief summary.

original: de rgyas par rtogs par bya ba rnams kyis gtan la 'bebs par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa 'di ni rab tu grags pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de rgyas par rtogs par bya ba rnams kyis gtan la 'bebs par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa 'di ni rab tu grags pa kho na'o //
translated: Those who wish to understand it in detail should determine it for themselves. This is well known.

original: mang po rnams la yang gzhung du mtshungs pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rang gzhung zhes gcig gi tshig go //
analyzed: mang po rnams la yang gzhung du mtshungs pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rang gzhung zhes gcig gi tshig go //
translated: Since there are many treatises, the word verse in the phrase verse of our own treatise is singular.

original: 'grel par ni dbye ba brjod par 'dod pa na rang gi rab tu byed pa rnams las zhes mang po'i tshig go //
analyzed: 'grel par ni dbye ba brjod par 'dod pa na rang gi rab tu byed pa rnams las zhes mang po'i tshig go //
translated: In the commentary, when it is desired to state the divisions, the plural particle is used, “in our treatises.

original: @11a * // btus nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: @11a * // btus nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ” “Having collected” and so on.

original: sngar byas pa dang gzhan cung zad sngar med pa ba'o la gnas pa yang /
analyzed: sngar byas pa dang gzhan cung zad sngar med pa ba'o la gnas pa yang /
translated: Having collected the previously composed and the slightly different new ones,

original: yang dag par blangs nas /
analyzed: yang dag par blangs nas /
translated: having taken them up,

original: tshad ma rnams kyi kun las btus pa yang dag par bsdus par bya'o //
analyzed: tshad ma rnams kyi kun las btus pa yang dag par bsdus par bya'o //
translated: they should be collected in a compendium of valid cognitions.

original: 'dir yang tshad ma dang gzhal bya dang der snang ba la sogs pa rgyu mtshan yang dag par bsgribs pa rnams thams cad tshad ma'i zhar la 'ongs pa nyid kyi phyir tshad ma'i sgras brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir yang tshad ma dang gzhal bya dang der snang ba la sogs pa rgyu mtshan yang dag par bsgribs pa rnams thams cad tshad ma'i zhar la 'ongs pa nyid kyi phyir tshad ma'i sgras brjod do //
translated: Here also, valid cognitions, objects of comprehension, and their appearances and so on, all the correct reasons, are expressed by the word “valid cognition” because they are merely ancillary to valid cognition.

original: gzhan gyi tshad ma dgag pa'i ched dang zhes pa la sogs pas tshad ma sgrub pa'i sgra'i don gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshad ma dgag pa'i ched dang zhes pa la sogs pas tshad ma sgrub pa'i sgra'i don gsungs so //
translated: The meaning of the word “valid cognition” is stated by “for the purpose of refuting the valid cognitions of others” and so on.

original: rang gi tshad ma ni 'dir dngos so //
analyzed: rang gi tshad ma ni 'dir dngos so //
translated: One’s own valid cognition is the main topic here.

original: gzhan gyi tshad ma ni gzhan rnams kyis de la tshad mar mngon par zhen pas tshad ma zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshad ma ni gzhan rnams kyis de la tshad mar mngon par zhen pas tshad ma zhes brjod do //
translated: The valid cognition of others is called valid cognition because others are manifestly attached to it as valid cognition.

original: de dag gi rang rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes pa ni tshad ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rang rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes pa ni tshad ma grub pa'o //
translated: The establishment of valid cognition is the thorough understanding of their individual natures just as they are.

original: de la gzhan gyi tshad ma tshad ma ma yin pa la dam par sgro btags pa'i tshad ma'i rang bzhin la 'di ni tshad ma'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes gang gtan la 'bebs ba de dgag ba ste /
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi tshad ma tshad ma ma yin pa la dam par sgro btags pa'i tshad ma'i rang bzhin la 'di ni tshad ma'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes gang gtan la 'bebs ba de dgag ba ste /
translated: In that regard, the refutation is the determination of the nature of valid cognition that is falsely imagined to be valid cognition when it is not valid cognition, saying, “This is not the nature of valid cognition.”

original: de kho na ni de grub pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na ni de grub pa'o //
translated: The establishment of that is the establishment of reality.

original: rang gi tshad ma kho na yon tan te /
analyzed: rang gi tshad ma kho na yon tan te /
translated: One’s own valid cognition is the quality,🔽and it is to be counted by those who desire the goal.

original: don 'dod pa rnams kyis bgrang bar bya ba'o zhes byas nas dang / don thob par byed pa nyid kyi phyir yang ngo //
analyzed: don 'dod pa rnams kyis bgrang bar bya ba'o zhes byas nas dang / don thob par byed pa nyid kyi phyir yang ngo //
translated: Having said that, it is also because it causes the attainment of the goal.

original: de brjod par bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i mtshan nyid mngon bar brjod pas gtan la 'bebs pa'o //
analyzed: de brjod par bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i mtshan nyid mngon bar brjod pas gtan la 'bebs pa'o //
translated: The expression of that is the determination through the expression of the characteristic of non-error.

original: de kho na yang de grub pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na yang de grub pa'o //
translated: The establishment of that is the establishment of reality.

original: gang gi phyir zhes pa la sogs pas tshad ma skyes bu'i don la nye bar mkho ba nyid du ston to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes pa la sogs pas tshad ma skyes bu'i don la nye bar mkho ba nyid du ston to //
translated: The verse beginning with “because” shows that a means of valid cognition is necessary for the purpose of a person.

original: gzhan du na de la nye bar mkho ba med pa gtan la 'bebs pa don med pa'o zhes pas bya ba min par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na de la nye bar mkho ba med pa gtan la 'bebs pa don med pa'o zhes pas bya ba min par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be pointless to determine that it is not necessary for that, and it would not be the case that it is not.

original: gzhal byar yang 'dir dor bar bya ba dang blang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhal byar yang 'dir dor bar bya ba dang blang bar bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the object of valid cognition is that which is to be rejected and that which is to be accepted.

original: gang gi phyir de rtogs pa ni tshad ma la rag las pa de'i phyir tshad ma grub pa'i ched du 'bad pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa'o zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de rtogs pa ni tshad ma la rag las pa de'i phyir tshad ma grub pa'i ched du 'bad pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa'o zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
translated: Because the understanding of that depends on a means of valid cognition, therefore the effort to establish a means of valid cognition is fruitful. This is the intended meaning.

original: 'dir kha cig smra ste /
analyzed: 'dir kha cig smra ste /
translated: Here, someone says:

original: tshad ma rnams ni rang kho na las grub pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: tshad ma rnams ni rang kho na las grub pa'o zhes so //
translated: The means of valid cognition are established from themselves alone.

original: de'i lugs kyi rjes su 'phrangs  pa gzhan rnams tshigs su bcad pa klog par byed de /🔽tshad ma rnams dang des byas pa'i //
analyzed: de'i lugs kyi rjes su 'phrangs  pa gzhan rnams tshigs su bcad pa klog par byed de / tshad ma rnams dang des byas pa'i //
translated: Following that system, others recite the verse:🔽The means of valid cognition and

original: tha snyad kyang ni rab grags na //
analyzed: tha snyad kyang ni rab grags na //
translated: the conventions produced by them are well known.

original: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid brjod pa la //
analyzed: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid brjod pa la //
translated: In the statement of the definition of a means of valid cognition,

original: dgos pa shes par bya ba min //
analyzed: dgos pa shes par bya ba min //
translated: It is not to be known by the purpose.

original: zhes so // de'i phyir de bsal ba'i ched du gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // de'i phyir de bsal ba'i ched du gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said in order to remove that:

original: 'di la yang log bar @11b rtogs pa mang bas na'o zhes te /
analyzed: 'di la yang log bar @11b rtogs pa mang bas na'o zhes te /
translated: Here, too, it is because there are many misconceptions.

original: yang gi sgras gang gi phyir zhes pa 'di rjes su 'gugs par byad do //🔽'gal ba'i rtogs pa ni log par rtogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: yang gi sgras gang gi phyir zhes pa 'di rjes su 'gugs par byad do // 'gal ba'i rtogs pa ni log par rtogs pa rnams te /
translated: The word “too” in the verse is to be construed with “because.”

original: phan tshun 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Misconceptions are contradictory because they function with mutually contradictory characteristics.

original: gal te 'di tshad ma'o zhes mtshan nyid nges pa ma grub par rang nyid las tshad mar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'di tshad ma'o zhes mtshan nyid nges pa ma grub par rang nyid las tshad mar 'gyur na /
translated: If it is not established that this is valid knowledge, then it would be valid knowledge by itself.

original: mtshan nyid byed pa rnams kyis phan tshun 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid byed bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: mtshan nyid byed pa rnams kyis phan tshun 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid byed bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: Those who function with characteristics would not function with mutually contradictory characteristics.

original: tshad ma skyes pa nyid na tshad ma'i rang gi ngo bo 'grub pa'i phyir mtshan nyid byed pa rnam pa gcig kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshad ma skyes pa nyid na tshad ma'i rang gi ngo bo 'grub pa'i phyir mtshan nyid byed pa rnam pa gcig kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: And because the nature of valid knowledge is established when valid knowledge itself arises, it would function as a characteristic in only one way.

original: tha snyad byed ba po rnams kyang log par rtogs te /
analyzed: tha snyad byed ba po rnams kyang log par rtogs te /
translated: Those who make conventional expressions also have misconceptions.

original: phyin ci log tu rtogs pa rnams te tshad ma ma yin pa la tshad ma nyid du lhag par zhen pa rnams so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu rtogs pa rnams te tshad ma ma yin pa la tshad ma nyid du lhag par zhen pa rnams so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: They are the ones who have the wrong understanding, who are attached to the idea that what is not a valid cognition is a valid cognition.

original: de ltar ni tshad ma ltar snang bas zhugs pa rnams 'ga' zhig slu bzhin pa mthong la /
analyzed: de ltar ni tshad ma ltar snang bas zhugs pa rnams 'ga' zhig slu bzhin pa mthong la /
translated: This is because those who engage in things through the appearance of a valid cognition see that some are deceived.

original: gal te thams cad tshad ma rnams su grub pa kho nar gyur na /
analyzed: gal te thams cad tshad ma rnams su grub pa kho nar gyur na /
translated: If all were established as valid cognitions,

original: 'ga' yang slu bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ga' yang slu bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then none would be deceived.

original: de'i phyir rang las te tshad ma'i rang rig las rang gi ngo bo grub pa tsam du 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang las te tshad ma'i rang rig las rang gi ngo bo grub pa tsam du 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, it would be merely established from itself, from the reflexive awareness of the valid cognition, that it is established by its own nature.

original: 'dod pa'i don bya ba nus pa'i dngos po thob par nus pa'i mtshan nyid can ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don bya ba nus pa'i dngos po thob par nus pa'i mtshan nyid can ni /
translated: The object that is capable of performing the desired function is capable of obtaining the characteristic of being a thing.

original: gang tshad ma nyid yin pa de yod pa kho na las tshad mas yongs su mthong ba'i dngos po bsgrub par bya ba'i don byed pa'i yul can tshad ma gzhan gyi 'jug pas dang por nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang tshad ma nyid yin pa de yod pa kho na las tshad mas yongs su mthong ba'i dngos po bsgrub par bya ba'i don byed pa'i yul can tshad ma gzhan gyi 'jug pas dang por nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: When that is a valid cognition, it is only from the existence of the object that is seen by the valid cognition that the object to be established is capable of performing a function. The valid cognition that is the subject is engaged by another valid cognition. In the beginning, it is ascertained.

original: phyi ma'i dus na na yang yang du tshad ma phyi ma'i 'jug pas shes pa'i gsal ba 'ga' zhig rnams tshad ma nyid du nges par byed cing goms par byed pa las shes rab can ni tshad ma phyi ma'i 'jug pa med par yang rnam pa de lta
analyzed: phyi ma'i dus na na yang yang du tshad ma phyi ma'i 'jug pas shes pa'i gsal ba 'ga' zhig rnams tshad ma nyid du nges par byed cing goms par byed pa las shes rab can ni tshad ma phyi ma'i 'jug pa med par yang rnam pa de lta
translated: In the future, by the engagement of subsequent valid knowledge, some instances of consciousness are ascertained as valid knowledge and are cultivated.

original: bu gzhan rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo yang dag par rig pa tsam kho na las tshad ma nyid du nges par byed do //
analyzed: bu gzhan rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo yang dag par rig pa tsam kho na las tshad ma nyid du nges par byed do //
translated: From that, the wise ascertain the nature of other such instances as valid knowledge merely through correct knowledge of their nature, even without the engagement of subsequent valid knowledge.

original: goms pas nor bu la sogs pa rnams kyi bcom pa ma yin pa la sogs pa'i khyad par bzhin no //
analyzed: goms pas nor bu la sogs pa rnams kyi bcom pa ma yin pa la sogs pa'i khyad par bzhin no //
translated: Through cultivation, they are like the distinctions of indestructibility and so on of jewels and so forth.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir tshad ma la log par rtogs pa rnams mang pa de'i phyir de rnams kyi log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i tshad du bstan bcos so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir tshad ma la log par rtogs pa rnams mang pa de'i phyir de rnams kyi log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i tshad du bstan bcos so zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, because there are many misconceptions about valid knowledge, the treatise is taught as the valid knowledge that eliminates those misconceptions.

original: de la 'bras bu dang rang gi ngo bo dang yul dang grangs la log par rtogs pa bzhi rnams te /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu dang rang gi ngo bo dang yul dang grangs la log par rtogs pa bzhi rnams te /
translated: There are four misconceptions about the result, nature, object, and number of valid knowledge.

original: da rnams las grangs la log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i don du gsungs pa /
analyzed: da rnams las grangs la log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i don du gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to eliminate the erroneous conception that there are more than these, he says:

original: mngon sum dang ni rjes su dpag / ces pa la sogs pa'o//
analyzed: mngon sum dang ni rjes su dpag / ces pa la sogs pa'o//
translated: Perception and inference, etc.

original: @12a * // gal te tshad ma gtan la dbab par bya ba la grangs la sogs pa gtan la 'bebs pa don med pa don med do zhe na /
analyzed: @12a * // gal te tshad ma gtan la dbab par bya ba la grangs la sogs pa gtan la 'bebs pa don med pa don med do zhe na /
translated: If it is objected that the determination of the number of the means of valid knowledge is pointless in the determination of the means of valid knowledge,

original: ma yin te rab tu byed pa ni tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin par log par rtogs pa bzlog pa lhur len pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te rab tu byed pa ni tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin par log par rtogs pa bzlog pa lhur len pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: [we reply that] it is not so, because the chapter is intent on the refutation of the erroneous conception that there is a means of valid knowledge which is not perception or inference.

original: de la gal te grangs la log par rtogs pa mi sel bar mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gi rang gi ngo bo 'ba' zhig gtan la 'bebs pa de'i tshe pha rol po rnams kyi 'di ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la gal te grangs la log par rtogs pa mi sel bar mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gi rang gi ngo bo 'ba' zhig gtan la 'bebs pa de'i tshe pha rol po rnams kyi 'di ltar 'gyur te /
translated: If perception and inference are determined as the only two means of valid knowledge, without eliminating the erroneous conception that there are more than two, then the opponents might think:

original: 'di'i yul kho na la nges par bdag cag rnams kyi log par rtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di'i yul kho na la nges par bdag cag rnams kyi log par rtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: “Our erroneous conception is only with regard to the object of these two means of valid knowledge.

original: gang tshad ma gzhan rnams bdag cag rnams kyis khas blangs pa de'i yul ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: gang tshad ma gzhan rnams bdag cag rnams kyis khas blangs pa de'i yul ma yin no zhes so //
translated: But the object of those other valid cognitions is not accepted by us.

original: 'o na de rnams kyi yang skyon brjod pa'i phyir gang las dgos pa 'di yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de rnams kyi yang skyon brjod pa'i phyir gang las dgos pa 'di yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, since they are also faulted, what is the point of this?

original: 'o na de ltar na /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar na /
translated: Well then, in that case,

original: ji ltar mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gi rang gi ngo bo bdag cag 'dod pa'i rang gi ngo bo las gzhan pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du de rnams kyi yang yod pa kho na nyid na de ni 'dis gtan la dbab pa ma🔽byas so zhes dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gi rang gi ngo bo bdag cag 'dod pa'i rang gi ngo bo las gzhan pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du de rnams kyi yang yod pa kho na nyid na de ni 'dis gtan la dbab pa ma byas so zhes dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: just as we accept the nature of direct perception and inference to be different from the nature of the other, in the same way, if they exist, then this ascertainment of them by that is not established.

original: de'i phyir grangs gtan la dbab pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir grangs gtan la dbab pa'o //
translated: Thus, there is the ascertainment of the number.

original: spyod yul gtan la ma phab na ni gang gi tshe yul ma yin pa la bzung ba tshad mar 'gyur na /
analyzed: spyod yul gtan la ma phab na ni gang gi tshe yul ma yin pa la bzung ba tshad mar 'gyur na /
translated: If the domain is not ascertained, then when it is apprehended as not being the object, it becomes a valid cognition.

original: de'i tshe de la de bslu la de bzhin du rang gi yul la yang tshad ma ma yin par rtogs pa pos khong du chud par 'gyur ro zhes yul gtan la 'bebs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe de la de bslu la de bzhin du rang gi yul la yang tshad ma ma yin par rtogs pa pos khong du chud par 'gyur ro zhes yul gtan la 'bebs pa'o //
translated: At that time, it would be understood by the one who realizes that it is not a valid cognition with regard to its object, just as it is deceived with regard to that.

original: tshad ma las 'bras bu gzhan ma yin no zhes gang gi tshe gtan la dbab par mi bya ba de'i tshe tshad ma ni tshad ma'i rang gi ngo bo nyid nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshad ma las 'bras bu gzhan ma yin no zhes gang gi tshe gtan la dbab par mi bya ba de'i tshe tshad ma ni tshad ma'i rang gi ngo bo nyid nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: When it is not ascertained that the effect is not different from the valid cognition, at that time the valid cognition would lose its nature as valid cognition.

original: de ltar ni 'bras bu ni re zhig don rtogs pa'i ngo bor nges par khas blangs te /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'bras bu ni re zhig don rtogs pa'i ngo bor nges par khas blangs te /
translated: For it is ascertained that the effect is the nature of the realization of the object.

original: gzhan du na 'bras bu nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na 'bras bu nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be reasonable as the effect.

original: de'i phyir rtogs pa'i ngo bo 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtogs pa'i ngo bo 'bras bu'o //
translated: Therefore, the effect is the nature of realization.

original: des na gang gi tshe shes pa'i ngo bo las tha dad pa tshad ma yin pa de'i tshe de shes pa ma yin pa'i ngo bor 'gyur la /
analyzed: des na gang gi tshe shes pa'i ngo bo las tha dad pa tshad ma yin pa de'i tshe de shes pa ma yin pa'i ngo bor 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, when something different from the nature of consciousness is a valid cognition, at that time it would not be the nature of consciousness.

original: shes pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo yang tshad ma'i rang gi ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur te gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no zhes 'bras bu gtan la 'bebs pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo yang tshad ma'i rang gi ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur te gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no zhes 'bras bu gtan la 'bebs pa'o //
translated: The nature of cognition is not the nature of a valid cognition, just as form is not.

original: de'i phyir gangs la sogs pa gtan la dbab pa don med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gangs la sogs pa gtan la dbab pa don med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the determination of snow and so on is not meaningless.

original: dang gi sgra ni gnyis po dag kyang rang gi yul la stobs mtshungs pa nyid du bshad pa'i ched du bsdu ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: dang gi sgra ni gnyis po dag kyang rang gi yul la stobs mtshungs pa nyid du bshad pa'i ched du bsdu ba'i tshig go //
translated: The word “and” in the root text is a conjunctive particle that indicates that both are equal in strength with regard to their objects.

original: ngag 'di'i don ci yin /
analyzed: ngag 'di'i don ci yin /
translated: What is the meaning of this statement?🔽Is it that the two, direct perception and inference, are established as the only two valid cognitions,

original: ci / @12b mngon sum dang ni rjes su dpag / tshad ma dag go zhes pa 'dis mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma dag gnyis nyid du bsgrub par bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci / @12b mngon sum dang ni rjes su dpag / tshad ma dag go zhes pa 'dis mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma dag gnyis nyid du bsgrub par bya ba ste /
translated: because it is said that “direct perception and inference are the valid cognitions”?

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa 'di dag tshad ma dag kho na ste /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa 'di dag tshad ma dag kho na ste /
translated: Or is it that only direct perception and inference are valid cognitions,

original: tshad ma gcig dang tshad ma rnams ni ma yin no zhes pa'am /
analyzed: tshad ma gcig dang tshad ma rnams ni ma yin no zhes pa'am /
translated: not one valid cognition or many valid cognitions?

original: 'on te mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag tshad ma nyid du bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag tshad ma nyid du bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: Or is it that direct perception and inference are established as valid cognitions?

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag tshad ma dag kho na ste tshad ma ma yin pa dag ma yin no zhes pa yin /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag tshad ma dag kho na ste tshad ma ma yin pa dag ma yin no zhes pa yin /
translated: Perception and inference are valid cognitions, not non-valid cognitions.

original: de las cir 'gyur na gal te /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur na gal te /
translated: What is the point of this?

original: rtog pa dang po yin na tshig 'bras bu med pa ste /
analyzed: rtog pa dang po yin na tshig 'bras bu med pa ste /
translated: If the first alternative is accepted, then the words are pointless,

original: de dag gnyis nyid du grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gnyis nyid du grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is already established that they are two.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gnyis nyid kyi ngor /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gnyis nyid kyi ngor /
translated: Perception and inference are already established as two.

original: su'i yang log par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: su'i yang log par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no one who has a misconception about them as being other than two.

original: 'on te gnyis pa yin na ni grangs nges par gzung ba ma byas par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'on te gnyis pa yin na ni grangs nges par gzung ba ma byas par 'gyur la /
translated: But if the second alternative is accepted, then the enumeration would not be grasped,

original: de las kyang rnam pa gnyis kho na tshad ma'o zhes gang sgrub par 'dod pa de ma bsgrubs pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las kyang rnam pa gnyis kho na tshad ma'o zhes gang sgrub par 'dod pa de ma bsgrubs pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: and what is intended to be proven, that only two are valid cognitions, would not be proven.

original: grub pa sgrub pa nyid kyang ste /
analyzed: grub pa sgrub pa nyid kyang ste /
translated: It would also be the proving of what is already established,

original: de dag tshad ma nyid du grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag tshad ma nyid du grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is already established that they are valid cognitions.

original: 'on te ts'ar b'a ka'i ngor 'di brjod par bya na /
analyzed: 'on te ts'ar b'a ka'i ngor 'di brjod par bya na /
translated: But if this is stated from the perspective of the Carvākas,🔽then it is pointless,🔽because the Carvākas are not the opponents here.

original: de lta na yang mngon sum la ltos nas grub pa sgrub par byed pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang mngon sum la ltos nas grub pa sgrub par byed pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: But if that is so, then it is only the establishment of what is already established, in reliance on perception.

original: 'di ni skyon ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni skyon ma yin te /
translated: This is not a fault.

original: 'dir ngag gnyis yin pa na ste /
analyzed: 'dir ngag gnyis yin pa na ste /
translated: Here there are two statements:

original: mngan sum dang ni rjes su dpag / ces pa ngag gcig dang tshad ma dag go zhes pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: mngan sum dang ni rjes su dpag / ces pa ngag gcig dang tshad ma dag go zhes pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: “Perception and inference” is one statement, and “The valid cognitions are two” is the second.

original: 'di ltar yang bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang bshad par bya ste /
translated: This is how it should be explained.

original: tshad ma dag kho na ste tshad ma rnams dang tshad ma gcig ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: tshad ma dag kho na ste tshad ma rnams dang tshad ma gcig ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “The valid cognitions are two” is that there are only two valid cognitions, and there is not a third valid cognition.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'grel bar nges par gzung ba mdzad de gnyis dag kho na'o zhes so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'grel bar nges par gzung ba mdzad de gnyis dag kho na'o zhes so //
translated: That is why the Autocommentary says, “They are definitely two.”

original: ngag gi rnam par gcod pa'i 'bras bu can nyid kyi phyir kho na'i sgra med kyang de'i don 'thob bo //
analyzed: ngag gi rnam par gcod pa'i 'bras bu can nyid kyi phyir kho na'i sgra med kyang de'i don 'thob bo //
translated: Even though the word “only” is not stated, its meaning is obtained because the statement is the result of the exclusion of other statements.

original: de ltar ngag 'dis tshad ma gnyis dag kho na'o zhes bsgrubs so //
analyzed: de ltar ngag 'dis tshad ma gnyis dag kho na'o zhes bsgrubs so //
translated: Thus this statement establishes that there are only two valid cognitions.

original: gnyis po de dag ci zhig dag / ces dogs pa'i dri ba'i skabs la 'di brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis po de dag ci zhig dag / ces dogs pa'i dri ba'i skabs la 'di brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, in response to the question, “What are those two?”

original: mngon sum dang ni rjes su dpag / ces pa'o//
analyzed: mngon sum dang ni rjes su dpag / ces pa'o//
translated: Perception and inference.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag tshad ma gnyis po dag ste /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag tshad ma gnyis po dag ste /
translated: Perception and inference are the two valid cognitions.

original: gzhan 'ga' zhig gnyis dag ma yin pa kho na'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan 'ga' zhig gnyis dag ma yin pa kho na'o zhes pa'o //
translated: There is no third valid cognition.

original: bshad pa 'di la ji skad brjod pa'i skyon gyi skabs mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bshad pa 'di la ji skad brjod pa'i skyon gyi skabs mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The fault mentioned above does not apply to this explanation.

original: ci ste tshad ma gcig nyid dam mang po nyid ma yin no zhes ji ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: ci ste tshad ma gcig nyid dam mang po nyid ma yin no zhes ji ltar rtogs she na /
translated: If valid cognition is neither one nor many, how can it be understood?

original: re zhig @13a * //
analyzed: re zhig @13a * //
translated: First,

original: gcig nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gcig nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: it is not one,

original: rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽gzhan du ni 'di tshad ma'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // gzhan du ni 'di tshad ma'o //
translated: because inference is also a valid cognition.

original: 'di tshad ma yin pa zhes rnam par gzhag pa 'di mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di tshad ma yin pa zhes rnam par gzhag pa 'di mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the distinction between valid cognitions would not be possible.

original: de ltar ni shes pa'i gsal ba 'ga' zhig gi 'jug pa la bslu ba dang mi bslu ba dag dmigs nas /
analyzed: de ltar ni shes pa'i gsal ba 'ga' zhig gi 'jug pa la bslu ba dang mi bslu ba dag dmigs nas /
translated: In this way, some instances of cognition are observed to be deceptive and some are observed to be non-deceptive.

original: de'i rigs can nyid kyis shes pa gzhan la yang mi bslu ba dang cig shos su nges pa las tshad ma dang cig shos su rnam par gzhag par byed kyi gzhan du na ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i rigs can nyid kyis shes pa gzhan la yang mi bslu ba dang cig shos su nges pa las tshad ma dang cig shos su rnam par gzhag par byed kyi gzhan du na ma yin no //
translated: The other is established as valid knowledge, and the other is not.

original: ji ltar mthong ba dang chos mthun pa las de ltar yongs su gcad par bya ba de yang rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid las 'da' ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba dang chos mthun pa las de ltar yongs su gcad par bya ba de yang rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid las 'da' ba ma yin no //
translated: The object that is determined in that way, in accordance with what is seen, is not beyond being an object of inference.

original: gzhan yang rjes su dpag pa tshad ma nyid ma yin na bstan bcos bya bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rjes su dpag pa tshad ma nyid ma yin na bstan bcos bya bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if inference were not valid knowledge, treatises would not be composed,

original: gang gi phyir pha rol gyis khong du chud pa'i don dud bstan bcos bya ba yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir pha rol gyis khong du chud pa'i don dud bstan bcos bya ba yin la /
translated: because treatises are composed for the purpose of causing others to understand.

original: gzhan gyis rtogs pa de yang rjes su dpag pa las gzhan las mi rtog te mngon sum ni lus tsam gyi yul can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis rtogs pa de yang rjes su dpag pa las gzhan las mi rtog te mngon sum ni lus tsam gyi yul can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: And that understanding by others does not occur from anything other than inference, because direct perception has only the body as its object.

original: lus nyid ni blo ma yin te /🔽de grub kyang blo'i rnam par brtag pa la /
analyzed: lus nyid ni blo ma yin te / de grub kyang blo'i rnam par brtag pa la /
translated: The body itself is not the mind,

original: the chom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: the chom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because even if it exists, there is doubt about the mind’s conceptualization.

original: gzhan dang 'brel ba can 'di ni skyes bu tsam gyi mngon sum du mi rtogs so //
analyzed: gzhan dang 'brel ba can 'di ni skyes bu tsam gyi mngon sum du mi rtogs so //
translated: This [cognition] that is related to something else is not understood as the direct perception of a mere person.

original: 'dis rjes su dpag pa la skur ba 'debs par byed cing /
analyzed: 'dis rjes su dpag pa la skur ba 'debs par byed cing /
translated: This [person] denies inference.

original: 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa dgag pa yang mngon sum gyis bya bar 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa dgag pa yang mngon sum gyis bya bar 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: And it is not appropriate to refute [the existence of] another world, etc. by means of direct perception,

original: de ni dngos po'i yul can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dngos po'i yul can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because that [direct perception] has only an existent object.

original: de yang don gyi nus pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang don gyi nus pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that [direct perception] depends on the capacity of the object.

original: ltos pa med na ni bar du chod pa la sogs pa'i dngos po la yang 'byung bar thal lo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ltos pa med na ni bar du chod pa la sogs pa'i dngos po la yang 'byung bar thal lo zhes pa'o //
translated: If it did not depend [on the object], it would follow, absurdly, that it would occur even with respect to an object that is obstructed, etc.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma nyid du khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma nyid du khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, inference should also be accepted as a valid means of cognition.

original: de'i phyir tshad ma gcig kho na ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma gcig kho na ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is not just one valid means of cognition.

original: mang po nyid du ni 'gyur te de yang yul mang po nyid kyi phyir ram /
analyzed: mang po nyid du ni 'gyur te de yang yul mang po nyid kyi phyir ram /
translated: There are many, because there are many objects,

original: yul gcig la yang tshad ma du ma 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: yul gcig la yang tshad ma du ma 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: or because many valid means of cognition operate with respect to a single object.

original: re zhig yul mang po nyid kyi phyir ma yin te 'di la rgyu gsungs pa /
analyzed: re zhig yul mang po nyid kyi phyir ma yin te 'di la rgyu gsungs pa /
translated: It is not that the object is many, because the cause is stated.

original: gang gi phyir mtshan nyid gnyis /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mtshan nyid gnyis /
translated: Because there are two characteristics.

original: gzhal bya zhes so //
analyzed: gzhal bya zhes so //
translated: The object of comprehension.

original: de rnam par 'grel par byed pa med do zhes pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de rnam par 'grel par byed pa med do zhes pa la sogs pas so //
translated: It is explained by “there is no . . .” and so on.
