original: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni gang don gyi bya ba nus pa ste de kho na dngos po'o //
analyzed: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni gang don gyi bya ba nus pa ste de kho na dngos po'o //
translated: There, the specific characteristic is that which is able to perform the function of the object; it is just that which is a thing.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni yang de las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni yang de las bzlog pa'o //
translated: The general characteristic is the opposite of that.

original: gal te de ltar na rab rib can la sogs pa'i nye bar dmigs @13b pa skra shad la sogs pa rnams rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na rab rib can la sogs pa'i nye bar dmigs @13b pa skra shad la sogs pa rnams rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: If that is so, then the appearances of hair nets and so on that are observed by those with eye disease are not specific characteristics,

original: skra shad la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba'i don bya ba la nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skra shad la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba'i don bya ba la nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not able to perform the function of the object to be established as hair nets and so on.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang ma yin te gsal bar so sor snang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang ma yin te gsal bar so sor snang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: They are also not general characteristics, because they appear individually as clear.

original: de rnams gzhal bu gzhan nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams gzhal bu gzhan nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If they are not either of those, they become a different object of comprehension.

original: 'di skyon ma yin te gang gi phyir gang la tha snyad byed pa rnams yul nyid du zhen pa de la dpyad pa 'di yin la /
analyzed: 'di skyon ma yin te gang gi phyir gang la tha snyad byed pa rnams yul nyid du zhen pa de la dpyad pa 'di yin la /
translated: This is not a fault, because this analysis is directed at those who are attached to the objects of conventional expressions.

original: rab rib can la sogs pa rnams kyis dmigs pa skra shad la sogs pa rang gi shes pa'i snang ba rnams kyi de rnams kyis yul nyid du mos pa med do //
analyzed: rab rib can la sogs pa rnams kyis dmigs pa skra shad la sogs pa rang gi shes pa'i snang ba rnams kyi de rnams kyis yul nyid du mos pa med do //
translated: Those who have eye disease, etc., do not conceive the hairs, etc., that are perceived as objects of their consciousnesses.

original: 'o na dngos po med pa spyir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na dngos po med pa spyir mi 'gyur te /
translated: Well, non-entityness will not be a universal,

original: de ni yul nyid du zhen par bya ba ma yin pas so zhe na /
analyzed: de ni yul nyid du zhen par bya ba ma yin pas so zhe na /
translated: because it is not to be conceived as an object.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so,

original: shes bya nyid du lhag par zhen pa'i phyir de la yang yul du lhag par mos pa yod do //
analyzed: shes bya nyid du lhag par zhen pa'i phyir de la yang yul du lhag par mos pa yod do //
translated: because it is conceived as a knowable object, and it is conceived as an object.

original: yang gang gi tshe dngos po med pa bzhin du rab rib can la sogs pas mthong ba skra shad la sogs pa rnams shes pa gzhan gyis shes bya nyid du 'dzin pa de'i tshe spyi'i ngo bo nyid du 'dod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe dngos po med pa bzhin du rab rib can la sogs pas mthong ba skra shad la sogs pa rnams shes pa gzhan gyis shes bya nyid du 'dzin pa de'i tshe spyi'i ngo bo nyid du 'dod pa kho na'o //
translated: Moreover, when those with eye disease, etc., perceive hairs, etc., as non-entities, and other consciousnesses apprehend them as knowable objects, then they are asserted to be universals.

original: shes pa gang la de rnams so sor snang ba des shes bya nyid du de rnams bzung ba ma yin no zhes pas de rnams spyi'i ngo bo ma yin par brjod pa 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: shes pa gang la de rnams so sor snang ba des shes bya nyid du de rnams bzung ba ma yin no zhes pas de rnams spyi'i ngo bo ma yin par brjod pa 'ba' zhig go //
translated: Therefore, they are said to be not the universal nature.

original: gal te de rnams dngos po ma yin na ci ltar gsal bar snang zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de rnams dngos po ma yin na ci ltar gsal bar snang zhe na /
translated: If they are not things, how do they appear clearly?

original: shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the intrinsic identity of cognition.

original: gang gi tshe ngo shes pa'i shes pas skra shad la sogs pa dang 'dra bar skar shad la sogs pa 'di'i zhes yul du bya ba de'i tshe spyi'i rnam pas mi gsal bar snang bzhin pa rnams spyi'i ngo bo nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gang gi tshe ngo shes pa'i shes pas skra shad la sogs pa dang 'dra bar skar shad la sogs pa 'di'i zhes yul du bya ba de'i tshe spyi'i rnam pas mi gsal bar snang bzhin pa rnams spyi'i ngo bo nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: When the cognition of recognition, like the cognition of a hair-net, takes this as its object, then those that appear indistinctly by the aspect of the universal are posited as the universal nature.

original: gal te de rnams shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir dngos po nyid yin na spyi la yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de rnams shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir dngos po nyid yin na spyi la yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If they are things because they are the intrinsic identity of cognition, then it follows that universals are also things.

original: de ltar de yang rang gi mtshan nyid du 'dod do zhes pas skyon med la /
analyzed: de ltar de yang rang gi mtshan nyid du 'dod do zhes pas skyon med la /
translated: Since it is asserted that they are also intrinsic identity, there is no error.

original: de spyi'i ngo bo can nyid du ni yul la ltos nas rnam par gzhag ste /🔽don gzhan las log pa'i dngos po la brten nas skye ba'i ngo shes pa'i blo tha mi dad pa'i rnam pa can gyis de rnams las rnam pa tha mi dad pa bzhin du kho nar mthong ngo zhes pas blos rtogs pa'i rnam pa de don rnams kyi spyir
analyzed: de spyi'i ngo bo can nyid du ni yul la ltos nas rnam par gzhag ste / don gzhan las log pa'i dngos po la brten nas skye ba'i ngo shes pa'i blo tha mi dad pa'i rnam pa can gyis de rnams las rnam pa tha mi dad pa bzhin du kho nar mthong ngo zhes pas blos rtogs pa'i rnam pa de don rnams kyi spyir
translated: It is posited as a universal in dependence on objects.🔽The cognition that arises in dependence on a thing that is the opposite of other things has the same aspect as the cognition that is not different from those things.🔽It is seen as not different from them.

original: rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The aspect that is understood by the mind is posited as the universal of those objects.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di dngos po ma yin pa nyid du yang ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di dngos po ma yin pa nyid du yang ste /
translated: For that very reason, it is not a thing.

original: phyi rol gyi ngo bor zhen pa la de'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽gal te de lta na spyi nus pa @14a * //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ngo bor zhen pa la de'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro // gal te de lta na spyi nus pa @14a * //
translated: It is not the nature of an external object.🔽If that is so, then a universal is devoid of all capacity.

original: thams cad dang bral ba de gzhal bar 'os pa ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur bas gzhal bya ma yin pa nyid na /
analyzed: thams cad dang bral ba de gzhal bar 'os pa ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur bas gzhal bya ma yin pa nyid na /
translated: Since it is not suitable to be an object of comprehension, it is not an object of comprehension.

original: de slob dpon gyis rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag las gzhan pa'i gzhal bya yod pa ma yin no zhes yul rnam pa gnyis nyid du gsungs pa ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de slob dpon gyis rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag las gzhan pa'i gzhal bya yod pa ma yin no zhes yul rnam pa gnyis nyid du gsungs pa ci ltar zhe na /
translated: But how can the master say that there are only two kinds of objects of comprehension, since he says, “There is no object of comprehension other than the particular and the universal”?

original: 'di bden te gang skyes bu'i don la nye bar mkho ba rang gi mtshan nyid kho na gzhal bya'o //
analyzed: 'di bden te gang skyes bu'i don la nye bar mkho ba rang gi mtshan nyid kho na gzhal bya'o //
translated: This is true, but the particular alone is the object of comprehension that is needed for the purpose of a person.

original: gang yang slob dpon gyis yul rnam pa gnyis nyid dud gsungs pa de ni kho na rang gi ngo bo dang gzhan gyi ngo bo dag gis rtogs pa las te /
analyzed: gang yang slob dpon gyis yul rnam pa gnyis nyid dud gsungs pa de ni kho na rang gi ngo bo dang gzhan gyi ngo bo dag gis rtogs pa las te /
translated: And the master’s statement that there are only two kinds of objects of comprehension is from the point of view of the two kinds of understanding, namely, understanding of the nature of the thing itself and understanding of the nature of something else.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po de kho na mngon sum gyis rang gi gi ngo bos rtogs pa las gzhal bya gcig rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po de kho na mngon sum gyis rang gi gi ngo bos rtogs pa las gzhal bya gcig rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Because that thing itself is the one object of comprehension that is understood by the nature of the thing itself through direct perception.

original: de kho na rjes su dpag pas spyi'i rnam pa rjes su chags pa gzung bya'i cha shas kyi bdag nyid gzhan gyi ngo bos de'i dngos por lhag par zhen pa nyid kyis rtogs pa'i phyir gnyis spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de kho na rjes su dpag pas spyi'i rnam pa rjes su chags pa gzung bya'i cha shas kyi bdag nyid gzhan gyi ngo bos de'i dngos por lhag par zhen pa nyid kyis rtogs pa'i phyir gnyis spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Because of the attachment to the nature of the object-aspect, which is the general form that is inferred, as the nature of that [object], it is the understanding of the general characteristic of duality.

original: gzhan gyi ngo bos rang gi mtshan nyid khon rtogs so zhes pa 'di cing ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bos rang gi mtshan nyid khon rtogs so zhes pa 'di cing ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: How is it to be understood that the specific characteristic is understood through the nature of the other?

original: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i phyi rol nyid du so sor snang ba'i cha shas rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid nyid du zhen nas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i phyi rol nyid du so sor snang ba'i cha shas rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid nyid du zhen nas /
translated: Because the aspect that appears externally to the conceptual thought of inference, although not the specific characteristic, is conceived as the specific characteristic itself,

original: don bya ba don dud gnyer ba'i skyes bu rang gi mtshan nyid kho na la 'jug pas so //
analyzed: don bya ba don dud gnyer ba'i skyes bu rang gi mtshan nyid kho na la 'jug pas so //
translated: and because the person who strives for the purpose of the object engages only in the specific characteristic.

original: gzhan du na gal te spyi rjes su dpag pas yongs su spyad par gyur na don bya ba don du gnyer ba po de kho na la 'jug par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gzhan du na gal te spyi rjes su dpag pas yongs su spyad par gyur na don bya ba don du gnyer ba po de kho na la 'jug par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Otherwise, if the universal were engaged by inference, the person who strives for the purpose of the object would engage in that alone.

original: bum pa yongs su bcad nas bum pa rtogs pa la gnas pa de'i don bya ba don du gnyer ba bum pa la 'jug pa ma yin bar 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: bum pa yongs su bcad nas bum pa rtogs pa la gnas pa de'i don bya ba don du gnyer ba bum pa la 'jug pa ma yin bar 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: It would follow that the person who, having ascertained a pot, engages in the activity of a pot for the sake of the object of that knowledge of a pot would not engage in the activity of a pot.

original: mi 'jug pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi 'jug pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: Or else, he would not engage in the activity of a pot at all.

original: spyi ni gang du yang nye bar mkho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi ni gang du yang nye bar mkho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a universal is not needed anywhere.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la des bsgrub par bya ba'i don bya ba thob pa'i rjes su dpag pa las 'jug pa yang yin /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la des bsgrub par bya ba'i don bya ba thob pa'i rjes su dpag pa las 'jug pa yang yin /
translated: And it is also the case that one engages in the activity of an object to be established by that particular by way of inference after attaining the object.

original: des na de'i dngos por lhag par zhen pa'o zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: des na de'i dngos por lhag par zhen pa'o zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that it is the particular that is conceived to be the entity of that.

original: mngon sum gyis kyang gzhan gyi ngo bo kho nas rtogs la /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis kyang gzhan gyi ngo bo kho nas rtogs la /
translated: Also, perception understands by way of the otherness of the object itself.

original: 'di ni khyad par te rjes su dpag pas mthun pas thun mong bar gyur pa'i gzhan gyi ngo bos don 'dzin zhing /
analyzed: 'di ni khyad par te rjes su dpag pas mthun pas thun mong bar gyur pa'i gzhan gyi ngo bos don 'dzin zhing /
translated: This is the difference. Inference apprehends an object by way of a generality that is common to many, that is, by way of the otherness of the object itself that is concordant with the inferential sign.

original: mngon sum gyis ni thun mong ma yin par gyur pas so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni thun mong ma yin par gyur pas so zhes pa'o //
translated: But perception apprehends by way of the uncommon object itself.

original: de'i phyir thun mong dang thun mong ma yin par gyur pa'i gzhan gyi ngo bo dag gis rtogs pa'i phyir gzhal bya gnyis su bshad @14b do //
analyzed: de'i phyir thun mong dang thun mong ma yin par gyur pa'i gzhan gyi ngo bo dag gis rtogs pa'i phyir gzhal bya gnyis su bshad @14b do //
translated: Therefore, because of the understanding of the object by means of its general and specific natures, the object is explained as twofold.

original: rnam par shes pa bzhin du don ni rang nyid las yang dag par rig pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bzhin du don ni rang nyid las yang dag par rig pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The object is not known by itself, as is consciousness.

original: don gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa'i gang kho na rang rig pa de kho na don yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: don gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa'i gang kho na rang rig pa de kho na don yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: That which is the self-awareness of the consciousness having the aspect of the object is the correct knowledge of the object.

original: shes pa la don snang ba nyams su myong ba na don rtogs so zhes sems pas te /
analyzed: shes pa la don snang ba nyams su myong ba na don rtogs so zhes sems pas te /
translated: When the appearance of the object in consciousness is experienced, it is thought that the object is cognized.

original: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don gzhal bya la yang rang rig pa 'bras bu nyid du rnam par 'jog par 'gyur zhes gzhan rnams so //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don gzhal bya la yang rang rig pa 'bras bu nyid du rnam par 'jog par 'gyur zhes gzhan rnams so //
translated: Therefore, others say that self-awareness is posited as the result even in the case of external objects that are objects of knowledge.

original: 'di song ngo //
analyzed: 'di song ngo //
translated: This is gone.

original: 'di ni brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni brjod par bya ste /
translated: This should be stated.

original: gzhal bya gnyis nyid kyi phyir tshad ma gnyis nyid do zhes pa ji ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: gzhal bya gnyis nyid kyi phyir tshad ma gnyis nyid do zhes pa ji ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How is it that there are two valid cognitions because there are two objects of knowledge? It is said:🔽The one having the particular as its object...

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can ni zhes pa la sogs pas te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can ni zhes pa la sogs pas te /
translated: and so on.

original: ni'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don can no //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don can no //
translated: The word “only” has the meaning of restriction.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can mngon sum kho na dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi yul can rjes su dpag pa kho na ste /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can mngon sum kho na dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi yul can rjes su dpag pa kho na ste /
translated: Only perception has particular characteristics as its object, and only inference has universal characteristics as its object.

original: tshad ma gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan ni med do //
translated: There is no other means of valid knowledge.

original: don 'di yang rgyas par /
analyzed: don 'di yang rgyas par /
translated: This point will be understood in detail

original: rang gi mtshan nyid bstan bya min //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid bstan bya min //
translated: in the passage beginning with “Particular characteristics are not taught as objects of operation”🔽and ending with “Because the objects of operation are different.”

original: gzung bya tha dad phyir zhes pa la sogs pas rtogs par byed par 'gyur ro zhes ston pas gsungs pa /🔽rtogs par byed par 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: gzung bya tha dad phyir zhes pa la sogs pas rtogs par byed par 'gyur ro zhes ston pas gsungs pa / rtogs par byed par 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: This is what is taught by the passage.

original: yang na gzhal bya gnyis su bstan pa 'dis ni gcig dang gsum la sogs pa'i tshad ma bsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang na gzhal bya gnyis su bstan pa 'dis ni gcig dang gsum la sogs pa'i tshad ma bsal bar bya ste /
translated: Or, by teaching two objects of comprehension, it eliminates three means of valid knowledge, such as one or three.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid las gzhan pa'ang gzhal byar bstan pas tshad ma mngon sum ma yin pa'ang yod do zhes tshad ma gcig yin pa bsal bar byas la /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid las gzhan pa'ang gzhal byar bstan pas tshad ma mngon sum ma yin pa'ang yod do zhes tshad ma gcig yin pa bsal bar byas la /
translated: Since it teaches that there is an object of comprehension other than particular characteristics, it eliminates the possibility that there is only one means of valid knowledge, namely, perception.

original: gzhal bya gsum po med par bstan pas tshad ma gsum la sogs pa bsal lo //
analyzed: gzhal bya gsum po med par bstan pas tshad ma gsum la sogs pa bsal lo //
translated: And since it teaches that there are not three objects of comprehension, it eliminates the possibility of three means of valid knowledge.

original: de ltan gang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /🔽gal te gzhal bya nges te rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag las gzhan gzhal bya med pa kho na'o zhes khas len pa de ltan sngon po la sogs pa rnams byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i rtags bstan pa las gzugs mi rtag go zhes pa la sogs par
analyzed: de ltan gang zhes pa la sogs pa ste / gal te gzhal bya nges te rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag las gzhan gzhal bya med pa kho na'o zhes khas len pa de ltan sngon po la sogs pa rnams byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i rtags bstan pa las gzugs mi rtag go zhes pa la sogs par
translated: The response to that is If that is so, etc.🔽If it is ascertained that there are no objects of comprehension other than the particular and the universal characteristics, then, in the teaching of the reason because of being produced in regard to the impermanence of form and so on, the statement Form is impermanent would be a nonestablished reason.

original: 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If you accept that the object of comprehension is ascertained, that is, that there is no object of comprehension other than the particular and the universal, then, in the demonstration of the reason that blue and so on are produced, one would not apprehend the subject, such as “form is impermanent.”

original: de ltar ni sngon po la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid spyi yin la 'di dag 'dres pas 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar ni sngon po la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid spyi yin la 'di dag 'dres pas 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because blue and so on are particular and impermanence is a universal, and they are apprehended as mixed.

original: de ci kho na'am /
analyzed: de ci kho na'am /
translated: Is it only that?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na ma yin no //
translated: Or is it not only the particular?

original: de'i phyir 'di ni khyad par dang spyi'i ngo bo gzhal bya gzhan pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni khyad par dang spyi'i ngo bo gzhal bya gzhan pa kho na ste /
translated: Therefore this is a different object of comprehension, which is the nature of a particular and a universal.

original: mi 'jal bar 'gyur na 'jal ba yang yin te de'i phyir gzugs mi rtag ces pa la sogs pa khyad par dang spyi'i yul 'dzin pa tshad ma gzhan no //
analyzed: mi 'jal bar 'gyur na 'jal ba yang yin te de'i phyir gzugs mi rtag ces pa la sogs pa khyad par dang spyi'i yul 'dzin pa tshad ma gzhan no //
translated: If it is not apprehended, it is apprehended, and therefore the apprehension of the subject and the object of a universal, such as “form is impermanent,” is another valid knowledge.

original: de ltar ni de mngon sum ma yin te spyi yang 'dzin @15a * //
analyzed: de ltar ni de mngon sum ma yin te spyi yang 'dzin @15a * //
translated: It is not direct perception because it apprehends a generality.

original: ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not perception, because it apprehends a universal.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te khyad par yang 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / rtags med par yang de ltar rtogs pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te khyad par yang 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / rtags med par yang de ltar rtogs pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it inference, because it apprehends a particular, and because it is possible to have such an understanding without a logical reason.

original: de ci ltar zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de ci ltar zhes pa ste /
translated: How is that?

original: de 'dzin pa ci ltar tshad ma gzhan ma yin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de 'dzin pa ci ltar tshad ma gzhan ma yin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: What is the meaning of the question, “How is the apprehension of that not another valid cognition?”

original: lan cig ma yin par zhes pa ste /
analyzed: lan cig ma yin par zhes pa ste /
translated: It is not a single time.

original: 'dis kyang khyad par mthong ba zhes bya ba gang rjes su dpag pa de tshad ma gzhan no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'dis kyang khyad par mthong ba zhes bya ba gang rjes su dpag pa de tshad ma gzhan no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: This also shows that what is called “seeing a particular” is inference, and that is another valid cognition.

original: 'di lta ste gcig gi tshe mngon sum gyis me dang du ba yongs su bcad pa na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste gcig gi tshe mngon sum gyis me dang du ba yongs su bcad pa na /
translated: For example, when fire and smoke are ascertained by perception at one time,

original: slar yang brgyud pas gang gi tshe du ba de kho nas me de kho na 'di'o zhes yongs su gcod pa de'i tshe khyad par mthong pa zhes bya ba me 'dzin pa ni tshad ma gzhan te /
analyzed: slar yang brgyud pas gang gi tshe du ba de kho nas me de kho na 'di'o zhes yongs su gcod pa de'i tshe khyad par mthong pa zhes bya ba me 'dzin pa ni tshad ma gzhan te /
translated: then later on, when that very smoke ascertains that very fire by implication, at that time, what is called “seeing a particular” is the apprehension of fire, and that is another valid cognition.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni spyi las mthong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni spyi las mthong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because inference is the seeing of a universal through a particular.

original: de kho na yang 'dir rjes su dpag par 'dod la /
analyzed: de kho na yang 'dir rjes su dpag par 'dod la /
translated: And it is that very universal that is to be inferred here.

original: mtshan nyid de yang khyad par mthong ba la mi srid de khyad par dang rtags 'brel pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de yang khyad par mthong ba la mi srid de khyad par dang rtags 'brel pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that definition is not possible in the case of the seeing of a particular, because it is not logical for a particular and a universal to be related.

original: de ltar rnam pa gnyis dag gis tshad ma mang po nyid srid de /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gnyis dag gis tshad ma mang po nyid srid de /
translated: Thus, it is possible for there to be many valid cognitions in two ways:

original: gzhal bya mang po nyid kyi phyir ram /
analyzed: gzhal bya mang po nyid kyi phyir ram /
translated: because there are many objects of comprehension,

original: yul gcig kho na yang tshad ma du ma 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gcig kho na yang tshad ma du ma 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or because many valid cognitions engage a single object.

original: de gnyis ka ltar yang pha rol pos 'o na gang zhes pa la sogs pa'i gzhung gis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis ka ltar yang pha rol pos 'o na gang zhes pa la sogs pa'i gzhung gis bstan pa'o //
translated: Both of these are indicated by the passage beginning with “If that is so, then what?”

original: yang na gzhal bya gnyis ka bstan pa las gang tshad ma gcig dang du ma bsal ba sngar brjod pa de med do zhes bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na gzhal bya gnyis ka bstan pa las gang tshad ma gcig dang du ma bsal ba sngar brjod pa de med do zhes bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: Or, it is established that neither of the two objects of comprehension is the case, because the one valid cognition and many valid cognitions that were mentioned earlier do not exist.

original: re zhig yul des pa'i phyir grangs gcig bsal ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig yul des pa'i phyir grangs gcig bsal ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the number one is eliminated because the object is specific.

original: gang gi tshe rjes su dpag pa spyi'i yul can kho na ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rjes su dpag pa spyi'i yul can kho na ma yin te /
translated: When inference is not only a universal-possessor,

original: 'o na ci zhe na tshad ma gzhan gyi yul la yang 'jug pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na tshad ma gzhan gyi yul la yang 'jug pa de'i tshe /
translated: but also engages the object of another valid cognition,

original: mngon sum yang spyi la 'jug pa mi 'gal pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon sum yang spyi la 'jug pa mi 'gal pa'i phyir /
translated: then it is not contradictory for direct perception to engage a universal.

original: mngon gyur ma yin pa'i phyir yul rtogs par bya ba'i ched du rjes su dpag pa brtag par bya ba ma yin pas tshad ma gcig kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon gyur ma yin pa'i phyir yul rtogs par bya ba'i ched du rjes su dpag pa brtag par bya ba ma yin pas tshad ma gcig kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because it is not manifest, inference is not to be posited for the purpose of comprehending its object. Thus there is only one valid cognition.

original: gsum la sogs pa'i grangs bsal ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gsum la sogs pa'i grangs bsal ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Also, the number of valid cognitions is not eliminated as three and so on,

original: gzhal bya gzhan srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhal bya gzhan srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there exist other objects of comprehension.

original: gang gi phyir gzhal bya gnyis nyid kyis tshad ma gnyis su brjod na gang gi tshe gzhal bya gzhan srid pa de'i tshe de rtogs par byed pa tshad ma gzhan du 'gyur ro zhes pas tshad ma gnyis dag kho rnam yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhal bya gnyis nyid kyis tshad ma gnyis su brjod na gang gi tshe gzhal bya gzhan srid pa de'i tshe de rtogs par byed pa tshad ma gzhan du 'gyur ro zhes pas tshad ma gnyis dag kho rnam yin no zhe na /
translated: If two valid cognitions are stated due to the existence of two objects of comprehension, then when another object of comprehension exists, that which causes one to understand it will be another valid cognition. Thus there are two valid cognitions.🔽It is not to be denied that the apprehension of that exists.

original: de 'dzin pa ni yod kyi zhes pa 'di la bsnyon par bya ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang /
analyzed: de 'dzin pa ni yod kyi zhes pa 'di la bsnyon par bya ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang /
translated: However,

original: de la rab sbyor ba /
analyzed: de la rab sbyor ba /
translated: The reply to that is:

original: tshad ma gzhan @15b pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan @15b pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not another valid cognition.

original: 'di ni re zhig snga ma'i lan te /
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig snga ma'i lan te /
translated: This is the reply to the first.

original: de la zhes pa mi rtag pa la sogs pa dang kha dog la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes pa mi rtag pa la sogs pa dang kha dog la sogs pa la'o //
translated: In that, with regard to impermanence, etc. and color, etc.

original: rab sbyor ba ni sbyor par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab sbyor ba ni sbyor par byed pa'o //
translated: The application is the application.

original: gang de sbyor ba la 'jug pa de'i rgyu mtshan can gyi shes pa de tshad ma gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: gang de sbyor ba la 'jug pa de'i rgyu mtshan can gyi shes pa de tshad ma gzhan ma yin no //
translated: The cognition that has that as its reason is not another valid cognition.

original: de sbyor ba yang ci ltar yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de sbyor ba yang ci ltar yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How is that application? It is said:

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag gis zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag gis zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: By means of the specific and general characteristics, etc.

original: dang por re zhig gzugs la sogs pa ni tha snyad bya ba ma yin pa rang gi mtshan nyid du mngon sum gyis 'dzin no //
analyzed: dang por re zhig gzugs la sogs pa ni tha snyad bya ba ma yin pa rang gi mtshan nyid du mngon sum gyis 'dzin no //
translated: First, one apprehends form, etc. as not being the object of verbal expression by direct perception as the specific characteristic.

original: phyis de kho na'am kha dog nyid la sogs pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid du rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyis rnam par shes pas so //
analyzed: phyis de kho na'am kha dog nyid la sogs pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid du rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyis rnam par shes pas so //
translated: Later, by the conceptual mind consciousness, one apprehends it as the general characteristic of just that or of color, etc.

original: de'i phyir spyi'i mtshan nyid mi rtag pa nyid la sogs par yang gang cung zad byas pa de thams cad mi rtag go zhes pa 'di ltar bzung nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi'i mtshan nyid mi rtag pa nyid la sogs par yang gang cung zad byas pa de thams cad mi rtag go zhes pa 'di ltar bzung nas /
translated: Therefore, one grasps the general characteristics such as impermanence, etc., as “whatever is produced is all impermanent,”

original: de nas kha dog la sogs pa 'di ni byas pa ste de'i phyir mi rtag go zhes yid kyis kha dog nyid la sogs pa'i spyi mi rtag pa nyid spyi nyid dang / sbyor bar byed de ldan par byed do //
analyzed: de nas kha dog la sogs pa 'di ni byas pa ste de'i phyir mi rtag go zhes yid kyis kha dog nyid la sogs pa'i spyi mi rtag pa nyid spyi nyid dang / sbyor bar byed de ldan par byed do //
translated: and then mentally applies the general impermanence to color, etc., by way of the statement, “This color, etc., is produced, and therefore it is impermanent.”

original: de'i phyir tshad ma gzhan ma yin gyi 'on kyang rjes su dpag pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma gzhan ma yin gyi 'on kyang rjes su dpag pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not a separate means of valid cognition, but rather it is just inference.

original: khyad par dang sbyor bar mi byed pa'i rgyu ci zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par dang sbyor bar mi byed pa'i rgyu ci zhe na /
translated: What is the reason for not applying it to a specific case?

original: de des mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de des mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not apprehend that.

original: de ltar 'gyur mod kyi gal te kha dog gi spyis mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pha rnams sbyor bar byed na /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur mod kyi gal te kha dog gi spyis mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pha rnams sbyor bar byed na /
translated: If one applies impermanence, etc., to color by means of the generality of color,

original: de ltar gyur pa na mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa rnams spyi dngos po med pa kho na'i chos rnams su 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa na mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa rnams spyi dngos po med pa kho na'i chos rnams su 'gyur gyi /
translated: then impermanence, etc., would be phenomena that are only the non-entity of a generality.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ni ma yin te de la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ni ma yin te de la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not by way of their own characteristics, because they do not engage those.

original: gang dngos po la mi 'jug pa de rnams dngos bo'i chos ma yin te dper na skye ba med pa la sogs pa rnams bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang dngos po la mi 'jug pa de rnams dngos bo'i chos ma yin te dper na skye ba med pa la sogs pa rnams bzhin no zhe na /
translated: Those that do not engage entities are not the attributes of entities, like non-production and so on.

original: 'di skyon ma yin te dngos po khon mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis de ltar sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di skyon ma yin te dngos po khon mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis de ltar sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not a fault, because it is established that entities are impermanent and so on in that way.

original: gal te yang rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i spyi kho na la de lta bu'i dngos por zhen pas 'dzin pa de lta na yang dngos po de'i skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa yod bzhin pa kho na'i rnam pa rnams rjes su dpag ba'i rnam par🔽rtog ba la snang do //
analyzed: gal te yang rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i spyi kho na la de lta bu'i dngos por zhen pas 'dzin pa de lta na yang dngos po de'i skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa yod bzhin pa kho na'i rnam pa rnams rjes su dpag ba'i rnam par rtog ba la snang do //
translated: Even if one were to apprehend a universal that appears to thought in that way by conceiving it to be an entity, the aspects of the existence of the momentariness of that entity and so on would appear to the inferential thought.🔽The aspect of the existence of the momentariness of that entity and so on would appear to the inferential thought.

original: de ji ltar gnas pa'i dngos po rtogs par byed pa'i rtags la brten nas skyes pa ni dngos po la yod pa'i rnam pa rnams kho nar zhen to //
analyzed: de ji ltar gnas pa'i dngos po rtogs par byed pa'i rtags la brten nas skyes pa ni dngos po la yod pa'i rnam pa rnams kho nar zhen to //
translated: That which arises in dependence on a reason that realizes the entity as it abides conceives the aspects that exist in the entity.

original: de'i phyir kha dog spyi la mi rtag pa nyid la sogs ba @16a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir kha dog spyi la mi rtag pa nyid la sogs ba @16a * //
translated: Therefore, in the proof of the impermanence, etc. of the universal of color,

original: sgrub par byed pa la yang /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa la yang /
translated: the universal of color is the logical object.🔽And in the proof of the impermanence, etc. of the universal of sound, the universal of sound is the logical object.

original: de la de'i rnam pa grub pas dngos po kho na las rnam pa de grub bo zhes rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: de la de'i rnam pa grub pas dngos po kho na las rnam pa de grub bo zhes rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Thus, one should understand that the aspect is established only from the real thing, because the aspect is established in that by the establishment of that in it.

original: tshogs pa'i khyad par las skyes pa'i bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan gyi shes pa'i yul la mtshan ma la sogs pa grub pas bzhin gyi phun sum tshogs pa la sogs pa don las grub pa bzhin no //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i khyad par las skyes pa'i bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan gyi shes pa'i yul la mtshan ma la sogs pa grub pas bzhin gyi phun sum tshogs pa la sogs pa don las grub pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, in the case of the cognition of a reflected image of a face produced from a special collection, the object is established from the real thing, because the object is established from the face, the perfection of the face, etc.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtog pa de ni gal te yang don yang dag par 'byung ba'i rnam pa kho nar lhag par zhen pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtog pa de ni gal te yang don yang dag par 'byung ba'i rnam pa kho nar lhag par zhen pa de lta na yang /
translated: Even though that conceptual cognition produced by inference is only the aspect of the real thing, it is still conceived as the real thing.

original: des rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo ma bzung ba kho na'o //
analyzed: des rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo ma bzung ba kho na'o //
translated: But it does not apprehend the nature of the real thing, because it is not a direct perception.

original: gzhan du na mthong ba bzhin du de la dngos po'i ngo bo gsal bar snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na mthong ba bzhin du de la dngos po'i ngo bo gsal bar snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the nature of the real thing would appear clearly to it, just as it is seen.

original: gang gis mi gsal bar bzung ba cig shos kyis ma yin pa /
analyzed: gang gis mi gsal bar bzung ba cig shos kyis ma yin pa /
translated: It is not the case that one apprehends it unclearly and the other clearly.

original: dngos po gcig la phan tshun mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i rnam pa dag yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po gcig la phan tshun mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i rnam pa dag yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is there a single entity that has aspects with mutually incompatible characteristics.

original: de'i phyir khyad par mi 'dzin pa'i phyir yod pa la mi rtag pa nyid dang sbyor bar byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par mi 'dzin pa'i phyir yod pa la mi rtag pa nyid dang sbyor bar byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, because it does not grasp a distinction, it does not apply impermanence to existence.

original: 'on kyang rang gi yul kha dog gi spyi kho na la ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi yul kha dog gi spyi kho na la ste /
translated: However, it is only the universal of color that is its object.

original: de'i phyir tshad ma gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not another valid cognition.

original: de ltar 'di ni rjes su dpag pas kha dog la sogs pa mi rtag pa nyid du 'dzin pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'di ni rjes su dpag pas kha dog la sogs pa mi rtag pa nyid du 'dzin pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa'o //
translated: Thus, this is explained from the perspective of grasping the impermanence of color and so on through inference.

original: gang gi tshe skad cig ma tha ma mthong bas 'di zhig go zhes nges par 'gyur ba de'i tshe mngon sum gyis mi rtag pa nyid kyi rang bzhin rtogs pa'i phyir bzung zin pa kho na nges par byed do zhes pas 'di tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur
analyzed: gang gi tshe skad cig ma tha ma mthong bas 'di zhig go zhes nges par 'gyur ba de'i tshe mngon sum gyis mi rtag pa nyid kyi rang bzhin rtogs pa'i phyir bzung zin pa kho na nges par byed do zhes pas 'di tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur
translated: When one ascertains through seeing the final moment, “This has ceased,” at that time, because the nature of impermanence is realized through direct perception, it only ascertains what has already been grasped. Therefore, it is not a valid cognition.

original: ro // de'i tshe yang lan cig ma yin par zhes pa 'di'i thun mong gi lan 'chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ro // de'i tshe yang lan cig ma yin par zhes pa 'di'i thun mong gi lan 'chad par 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, it is not just once that the common reply to this is given.🔽

original: thug med 'gyur phyir zhes ba 'dir shes par bya'o //
analyzed: thug med 'gyur phyir zhes ba 'dir shes par bya'o //
translated: The common response to this is that it is not the case that the object is not seen again, and the response to the phrase “not just once” is that it is not the case that the object is not seen again and again.🔽The response to the phrase “an infinite regress would ensue” is that it is not the case that an infinite regress would ensue.

original: yang ci ltar mngon sum gyis sngar bzung ba kho na phyis nges pa'i shes pas 'dzin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci ltar mngon sum gyis sngar bzung ba kho na phyis nges pa'i shes pas 'dzin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the object that was seen by perception is seen later by the ascertaining consciousness?

original: gang gi phyir mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba dngos po g-yo pa las gzhan 'ga' zhig ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba dngos po g-yo pa las gzhan 'ga' zhig ma yin la /
translated: Because impermanence is not something different from the thing that is impermanent.

original: des na skad cig ma tha ma 'dra ba gzhan dang mtshams sbyor ba med pa mngon sum gyis yongs su gcod cing /
analyzed: des na skad cig ma tha ma 'dra ba gzhan dang mtshams sbyor ba med pa mngon sum gyis yongs su gcod cing /
translated: Therefore, the final moment of the thing is ascertained by perception to be without a similar subsequent connection.

original: de'i rang bzhin 'jig pa'i ngang can nyid du yang rtogs so zhes pa dang / de kho na yang mi rtag pa nyid do zhes pas de mngon sum gyis grub bo //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin 'jig pa'i ngang can nyid du yang rtogs so zhes pa dang / de kho na yang mi rtag pa nyid do zhes pas de mngon sum gyis grub bo //
translated: And it is understood that its nature is to be destroyed. And because that is impermanence, it is established by perception.

original: ci ste yang mi rtag pa nyid dngos po las don gzhan yin pa de'i tshe rang bzhin 'jig pa'i ngang can ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste yang mi rtag pa nyid dngos po las don gzhan yin pa de'i tshe rang bzhin 'jig pa'i ngang can ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: But if impermanence is a different object from the thing, then the thing would not be destroyed by nature.

original: gzhan yod pa na gzhan 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni ma yin pas so //
analyzed: gzhan yod pa na gzhan 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni ma yin pas so //
translated: But it is not the case that when something else exists, something else is destroyed.

original: de las dngos po @16b 'jig pa'i ngang can nyid kyi rang bzhin du 'byung ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: de las dngos po @16b 'jig pa'i ngang can nyid kyi rang bzhin du 'byung ba'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the nature of things is to arise and perish.

original: 'di ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di ni mi rigs te /
translated: This is not correct.

original: rang nyid g-yo ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa ni gzhan gyis rang bzhin gzhan skyed par mi nus la /
analyzed: rang nyid g-yo ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa ni gzhan gyis rang bzhin gzhan skyed par mi nus la /
translated: That which is not by nature mobile cannot be caused to have another nature by something else.

original: rang bzhin gyis g-yo ba'i bdag nyid yin na yang mi rtag pa nyid gzhan 'bras bu med pas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis g-yo ba'i bdag nyid yin na yang mi rtag pa nyid gzhan 'bras bu med pas so //
translated: And if it has a mobile nature by itself, then it is impermanent, since another impermanence would be pointless.

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid dag tu brjod du med pa nyid yin na yang /
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid dag tu brjod du med pa nyid yin na yang /
translated: Even if it were inexpressible as either the same as or different from itself,

original: dngos bo ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir de rang bzhin gyi dngos po ma yin no zhes pas kun rdzob dang mi rtag par 'gyur gyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos bo ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir de rang bzhin gyi dngos po ma yin no zhes pas kun rdzob dang mi rtag par 'gyur gyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: it would not be a nature, because it would not be a thing. Thus it would be conventional and impermanent, but not ultimately.

original: de'i phyir dngos po kho na mi rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po kho na mi rtag pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, a thing itself is impermanent.

original: de'i phyir yang chos can gzugs la sogs pa gzung ba na mi rtag ba nyid kyang gzung ba kho na'o zhes bas bzung zin pa 'dzin pa'i phyir 'di tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang chos can gzugs la sogs pa gzung ba na mi rtag ba nyid kyang gzung ba kho na'o zhes bas bzung zin pa 'dzin pa'i phyir 'di tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, when the subject, form, etc., is apprehended, impermanence is also apprehended. Thus, because it apprehends what has already been apprehended, it is not a valid cognition.

original: gal te mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos can las gzhan ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos can las gzhan ma yin na /
translated: If impermanence, etc., are not different from the subject,

original: 'o na de lta na /
analyzed: 'o na de lta na /
translated: then in that case,

original: rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: inference also would not be a valid cognition.

original: de ltar ni chos can ma grub na chos sgrub par mi nus la /
analyzed: de ltar ni chos can ma grub na chos sgrub par mi nus la /
translated: Because if the subject is not established, the property cannot be established,

original: de grub na de'i bdag nyid yin pa nyid kyis chos kyang grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de grub na de'i bdag nyid yin pa nyid kyis chos kyang grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
translated: and if it is established, then the property is also established by the mere fact that it has the same nature as that.

original: ma yin te de ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te de ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because that is not certain.

original: 'dra ba gzhan 'byung bas de kho na 'di'o zhes 'khrul ba bo'i mngon sum ni de la nges pa skyed par byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'dra ba gzhan 'byung bas de kho na 'di'o zhes 'khrul ba bo'i mngon sum ni de la nges pa skyed par byed pa ma yin la /
translated: Direct perception, which is mistaken in thinking that this is just that because of the arising of another similar one, does not produce certainty about that.

original: nges ba med pa'i phyir yang /
analyzed: nges ba med pa'i phyir yang /
translated: And because there is no certainty,

original: de ni tha snyad du rung ba ma yin zhing ma bzung ba dang 'dra ba kho na'o zhes pas na /
analyzed: de ni tha snyad du rung ba ma yin zhing ma bzung ba dang 'dra ba kho na'o zhes pas na /
translated: It is not suitable as a conventional [entity], and is just like something that is not apprehended.

original: de de la tshad ma nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang rnam pa gang la nges pa skyed par byed cing dran pa'i sgo nas rab tu 'jug pa de kho na la'o //
analyzed: de de la tshad ma nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang rnam pa gang la nges pa skyed par byed cing dran pa'i sgo nas rab tu 'jug pa de kho na la'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not a valid cognition with regard to that [object], but rather it is [a valid cognition] with regard to just that aspect in which it generates a definite cognition and engages through memory.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshad ma ni rab tu 'jug pa'i 'bras bu can nyid yin ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma ni rab tu 'jug pa'i 'bras bu can nyid yin ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a valid cognition has the effect of engagement.

original: de'i phyir ma nges pa'i rnam pa rnams la nges pa skyed par byed cing de la rab tu 'jug bar byed pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa tshad ma'o zhes pas mi mtshungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma nges pa'i rnam pa rnams la nges pa skyed par byed cing de la rab tu 'jug bar byed pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa tshad ma'o zhes pas mi mtshungs so //
translated: Therefore, since it generates a definite cognition with regard to indefinite aspects and engages with that, inference is a valid cognition. Thus, it is not similar.

original: 'o na rtog pa gnyis pa la tshad ma gzhan med do zhes pa'i gzhung ci ltar drang bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'o na rtog pa gnyis pa la tshad ma gzhan med do zhes pa'i gzhung ci ltar drang bar bya ste /
translated: Well then, how should one interpret the text that says, “There is no other valid cognition for the second conception”?

original: ji srid kyis 'di tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur bde'i phyir 'di tshad ma ma yin no zhes smra bar rigs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ji srid kyis 'di tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur bde'i phyir 'di tshad ma ma yin no zhes smra bar rigs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: It is reasonable to say that it is not a valid cognition because it is not a valid cognition for as long as it does not become a valid cognition.

original: 'di bden mod 'on kyang pha rol pos tshad ma gzhan no zhes byas nas nye bar bkod pa de'i phyir de kho na ltar bkag pa'o zhes pas skyon ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di bden mod 'on kyang pha rol pos tshad ma gzhan no zhes byas nas nye bar bkod pa de'i phyir de kho na ltar bkag pa'o zhes pas skyon ma yin no //
translated: This is true, but the opponent has stated that it is another valid cognition, and therefore it is refuted just as that is.

original: yang yang ngo shes pa yang ma yin no zhes pa ste ngo shes pa 'bras bur bya ba na gang khyad par mthong ba'i shas pa de tshad ma ma yin no @17a * //
analyzed: yang yang ngo shes pa yang ma yin no zhes pa ste ngo shes pa 'bras bur bya ba na gang khyad par mthong ba'i shas pa de tshad ma ma yin no @17a * //
translated: It is not the case that recognition is not repeated, for when recognition is taken as the effect, the cognition that sees a difference is not a valid cognition.

original: zhes pa'i don to //🔽gal te yang shes pa dang ngo shes pa dag dngos bor na tha dad med pa de lta na yang tshad ma dang 'bras bu ltar tha dad du brtag par bya na ngo shes par bya ba'i don gyis rnam par skye ba'i shes pa ni sngar bzung ba'i
analyzed: zhes pa'i don to // gal te yang shes pa dang ngo shes pa dag dngos bor na tha dad med pa de lta na yang tshad ma dang 'bras bu ltar tha dad du brtag par bya na ngo shes par bya ba'i don gyis rnam par skye ba'i shes pa ni sngar bzung ba'i
translated: This is the meaning.

original: don 'dzin pa'i phyir ngo shes pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: don 'dzin pa'i phyir ngo shes pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: If cognition and recognition are not different in reality, then they should be conceived as different, like valid cognition and its effect. The cognition that arises in the aspect of the object of recognition is the recognition, because it apprehends the object that was previously apprehended.

original: yang gi sgras mngon sum gyis bzung ba kho na la slar yang kha dog la sogs pa mi rtag go zhes gang 'dzin pa de yang tshad ma ma yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: yang gi sgras mngon sum gyis bzung ba kho na la slar yang kha dog la sogs pa mi rtag go zhes gang 'dzin pa de yang tshad ma ma yin no zhes ston to //
translated: The word “also” indicates that it is not a valid cognition that apprehends again, “The color and so on that are apprehended by direct perception are impermanent.”

original: yang yang zhes ba 'dis lan cig ma yin pa zhes pa 'di'i don gsungs so //
analyzed: yang yang zhes ba 'dis lan cig ma yin pa zhes pa 'di'i don gsungs so //
translated: The word “again” indicates that it is not a valid cognition that apprehends repeatedly.

original: 'o na sngar gzung ba'i don lan cig 'dzin pa na yang tshad ma yin na lan cig ma yin par zhes pa de brjod pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na sngar gzung ba'i don lan cig 'dzin pa na yang tshad ma yin na lan cig ma yin par zhes pa de brjod pa ci zhe na /
translated: But if it is a valid cognition when the object that was previously apprehended is apprehended once, then what is the point of saying “repeatedly”?

original: pha rol po'i 'dod pa nye bar bstan pa'i don nyid kyi phyir skyon med de /
analyzed: pha rol po'i 'dod pa nye bar bstan pa'i don nyid kyi phyir skyon med de /
translated: There is no error because it is just the assertion of the opponent that is presented.

original: gang gi phyir grangs can pas khyad par mthong ba rjes su dpag ba'i mtshan nyid du brjod de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir grangs can pas khyad par mthong ba rjes su dpag ba'i mtshan nyid du brjod de /
translated: This is because the Sāṃkhya say that seeing a specific quality is the definition of inference.

original: gang gi tshe du ba de kho nas me de kho na yang yang yod pa nyid du rtogs pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe du ba de kho nas me de kho na yang yang yod pa nyid du rtogs pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: When smoke is seen, fire is inferred.

original: de'i phyir de'i 'dod pa bstan pa'i ched du de skad brjod kyi yang lan cig 'dzin pa las tshad ma'o zhes byas nas ni ma yin no //🔽rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i dngos po rgyu med bar rtogs pa ma yin no zhes pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i 'dod pa bstan pa'i ched du de skad brjod kyi yang lan cig 'dzin pa las tshad ma'o zhes byas nas ni ma yin no // rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i dngos po rgyu med bar rtogs pa ma yin no zhes pa de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate his assertion, he says this, but not that valid knowledge is a single apprehension.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes 'dri bar byed do //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes 'dri bar byed do //
translated: The object that is the basis of dispute is not understood to be without a cause. Therefore, he asks, “Why?”

original: slob dpon gyis yul rtogs zin pa nyid tshad ma nyid ma yin pa la rgyu nye bar ston par 'gyur ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis yul rtogs zin pa nyid tshad ma nyid ma yin pa la rgyu nye bar ston par 'gyur ba gsungs pa /
translated: The master says that the very understanding of the object is not valid knowledge, and he demonstrates the reason:

original: thug med thal phyir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: thug med thal phyir zhes pa'o //
translated: “Because of the absurd consequence of infinite regress.”

original: grangs dang mtshan nyid las tshad ma rnams 'di tsam nyid yongs su gcod pa ni thug pa yin la /
analyzed: grangs dang mtshan nyid las tshad ma rnams 'di tsam nyid yongs su gcod pa ni thug pa yin la /
translated: The number and definition of valid knowledges are determined to be just this many. This is the limit.

original: de med par thal lo zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de med par thal lo zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “Because of the absurd consequence of infinite regress” is that it does not exist.

original: ma rtogs pa'i don rtogs par byed pa po tshad ma'o //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa'i don rtogs par byed pa po tshad ma'o //
translated: Valid knowledge is that which causes the understanding of a previously uncomprehended object.

original: spyir tshad ma'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: spyir tshad ma'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: This is the definition of valid knowledge in general.

original: grangs gnyis gsum rnams zhes pa la sogs pa der mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grangs gnyis gsum rnams zhes pa la sogs pa der mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The number, two or three, and so on, do not apply to that.

original: gal te shes pa thams cad tshad ma nyid du 'dod na zhes pa 'dis ni phyogs snga ma dang 'gal ba gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te shes pa thams cad tshad ma nyid du 'dod na zhes pa 'dis ni phyogs snga ma dang 'gal ba gsungs so //
translated: If you assert that all cognitions are valid cognitions, this is a contradiction of your own tenets.

original: thug pa med bar rnam par gzhag pas sel bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thug pa med bar rnam par gzhag pas sel bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would be an infinite regress.

original: dran sogs ba zhin zhes pa dpe gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dran sogs ba zhin zhes pa dpe gsungs pa'o //
translated: “Like memory, etc.” is the example.

original: yul la yang 'di ltar bstan pa yod do zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: yul la yang 'di ltar bstan pa yod do zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: If you say that the object is also like that, he says:

original: dran pa kho na dran pa'o zhes pa dngos po la kta byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa kho na dran pa'o zhes pa dngos po la kta byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Memory is just memory.” Because the suffix is added to the thing.

original: dper na zhes pa la sogs pas bsgrub par bya bas gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba dpe la ston par byed do //
analyzed: dper na zhes pa la sogs pas bsgrub par bya bas gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba dpe la ston par byed do //
translated: “For example,” etc. shows the example as the pervasion of the reason by the probandum.

original: de bzhin no zhes pa tshad ma'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin no zhes pa tshad ma'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: “Just so” is the result of the valid cognition.

original: gang ltar rtogs @17b zin pa'i don gyi yul can de tshad ma ma yin te dran pa la sogs pa bzhin /
analyzed: gang ltar rtogs @17b zin pa'i don gyi yul can de tshad ma ma yin te dran pa la sogs pa bzhin /
translated: The subject that realizes the object that has already been realized is not a valid cognition, like memory, etc.

original: khyad par mthong ba yang de lta bu'o //
analyzed: khyad par mthong ba yang de lta bu'o //
translated: The perception of a difference is also like that.

original: khyab byed dang 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: khyab byed dang 'gal ba'o //
translated: The contradiction with the pervasion.

original: 'dir 'gyur mod ji ltar mthong ba'i khyad par de kho na des gzung ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir 'gyur mod ji ltar mthong ba'i khyad par de kho na des gzung ba ma yin gyi /
translated: But it is not that the specific thing is apprehended as it is seen.

original: 'on kyang de dang mtshungs pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dang mtshungs pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: But it is similar to that.

original: 'o na rjes su dpag pa de khyad par mthong ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang sngar mthong ba dang mtshungs pa nyid du phyi ma 'dzin pa'i phyir spyi las mthong ba kho na'o //
analyzed: 'o na rjes su dpag pa de khyad par mthong ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang sngar mthong ba dang mtshungs pa nyid du phyi ma 'dzin pa'i phyir spyi las mthong ba kho na'o //
translated: But the inference does not see the specific thing, but it apprehends the subsequent moment as similar to what was previously seen. Therefore, it is only the universal that is seen.

original: 'dir 'gyur mod kyi der yang me'i spyi tsam 'dzin pa 'ba' zhig ma yin te so sor nges pa'i yul la gnas pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir 'gyur mod kyi der yang me'i spyi tsam 'dzin pa 'ba' zhig ma yin te so sor nges pa'i yul la gnas pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: But it is not that it apprehends only the universal of fire, because it apprehends the specific thing that is its object.

original: khyad par la brten pa 'di tsam gyis thun mong ba nyid nyams pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par la brten pa 'di tsam gyis thun mong ba nyid nyams pa ma yin te /
translated: But the commonality is not destroyed by this mere dependence on the specific thing.

original: de ltar ni aa ka ru'i du ba la sogs pas de skyed par byed pa'i me rtogs pas yang me'i spyi kho na rtogs kyi so sor nges pa'i khyad par ni ma yin no zhes pas 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: de ltar ni aa ka ru'i du ba la sogs pas de skyed par byed pa'i me rtogs pas yang me'i spyi kho na rtogs kyi so sor nges pa'i khyad par ni ma yin no zhes pas 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: For example, by the inference of fire that is produced by the smoke of agarwood, only the universal of fire is understood, not the specific thing. Therefore, this is mere quibbling.

original: 'dir 'gyur mod kyi gang du dpe dang dpe can dag tha dad pa der de dag spyis rjes su dpag pa srid do //
analyzed: 'dir 'gyur mod kyi gang du dpe dang dpe can dag tha dad pa der de dag spyis rjes su dpag pa srid do //
translated: Although this is so, it is possible to infer a universal in a case where the example and the exemplified are different.

original: 'dir ni gang dpe de kho na dpe can te de kho na 'di'i zhes rab tu ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir ni gang dpe de kho na dpe can te de kho na 'di'i zhes rab tu ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But here the example is the very same as the exemplified, because it is taught that it is just that.

original: de'i phyir spyi'i rjes su dpag pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi'i rjes su dpag pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is not an inference of a universal.

original: gal te gang kho na bsgrub par bya ba de kho na dpe yin na /
analyzed: gal te gang kho na bsgrub par bya ba de kho na dpe yin na /
translated: If the very same thing that is to be established is the example,

original: de ltar na de'i tshe des bzung zin pa ma brjed pas 'byung bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na de'i tshe des bzung zin pa ma brjed pas 'byung bar bya ste /
translated: then at that time it is already apprehended and not forgotten, so it is not to be established.

original: gzhan du na dper 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: gzhan du na dper 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin pas so //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be suitable to be an example.

original: de'i phyir yang rtogs zin pa'i yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir skyon de kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang rtogs zin pa'i yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir skyon de kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, because it has an already-apprehended object, the fault remains.

original: ci ste 'di rtogs zin pa'i yul can ma yin te gang gi phyir rtogs zin pa'i chos can gyi sngar mthong ba'i don gyis dngos po'i chos ma rtogs ba 'dis rtogs par bya'o zhes sems na /
analyzed: ci ste 'di rtogs zin pa'i yul can ma yin te gang gi phyir rtogs zin pa'i chos can gyi sngar mthong ba'i don gyis dngos po'i chos ma rtogs ba 'dis rtogs par bya'o zhes sems na /
translated: But if you think that it is not a subject that has already been apprehended, because the previously seen object of the subject that has already been apprehended is not apprehended by this, it is to be apprehended,

original: 'di ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di ni mi rigs te /
translated: this is unreasonable.

original: gal te re zhig snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus su mthong ba'i don dag tha dad pa de ltar na gyur na de ma yin pa la de'i dngos por sgro 'dogs pa ni phyin ci log kho na ste tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te re zhig snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus su mthong ba'i don dag tha dad pa de ltar na gyur na de ma yin pa la de'i dngos por sgro 'dogs pa ni phyin ci log kho na ste tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: If the object seen at the prior and subsequent times are different, then the superimposition of the entity of that on that which is not that is just an error; it is not a valid cognition.

original: 'on te tha mi dad pa dag yin na /
analyzed: 'on te tha mi dad pa dag yin na /
translated: But if they are not different,

original: rtogs zin pa'i yul can nyid kyi phyir de ni tshad ma nyid ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rtogs zin pa'i yul can nyid kyi phyir de ni tshad ma nyid ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: then it is not a valid cognition because it has an object that has already been realized.

original: sngar mthong ba'i don gyi dngos po de'i ma rtogs pa rtogs par bya ba'o zhes brjod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: sngar mthong ba'i don gyi dngos po de'i ma rtogs pa rtogs par bya ba'o zhes brjod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn’t it said that the object seen previously is not realized and is to be realized?

original: de ni mi rigs par brjod de /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs par brjod de /
translated: That is said without understanding.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ni don gyi chos cung zad gang sngon ma byung ba ma yin pa phyis 'byung ba ni ma yin no //🔽gal te yin na ni de kho na de dag gi rang bzhin tha dad pa'i rten no zhes pas dngos po @18a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ni don gyi chos cung zad gang sngon ma byung ba ma yin pa phyis 'byung ba ni ma yin no // gal te yin na ni de kho na de dag gi rang bzhin tha dad pa'i rten no zhes pas dngos po @18a * //
translated: Because it is not the case that any property of the object that did not exist previously exists later.

original: tha dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did, then that would be the basis of their different natures, and thus they would be different things.

original: de la yang skyon brjod zin to //
analyzed: de la yang skyon brjod zin to //
translated: The error in that has already been stated.

original: de'i phyir de kho na 'di'o zhes nges pa khyad par du mthong ba nyid du mngon par 'dod pa ni dran pa las tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de kho na 'di'o zhes nges pa khyad par du mthong ba nyid du mngon par 'dod pa ni dran pa las tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the ascertainment “this alone is reality” is not different from memory.

original: 'di ni dran pa'i rang bzhin de 'di lta ste mthong ba'i 'du byed ma yin pa nyams pa la de kho na 'di'o zhes sngar mthong ba'i rnam par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dran pa'i rang bzhin de 'di lta ste mthong ba'i 'du byed ma yin pa nyams pa la de kho na 'di'o zhes sngar mthong ba'i rnam par zhen pa'o //
translated: This is the nature of memory, that is, the grasping of the form of what was previously seen, “this alone is reality,” in the degeneration of the formative forces of seeing.

original: de 'di la yang yod pas dran pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de 'di la yang yod pas dran pa kho na'o //
translated: Since this exists for it, it is memory alone.

original: rang gi ngo bo la log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i ched du gsungs pa /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo la log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i ched du gsungs pa /
translated: In order to remove the misconception about its own nature, he says:

original: mngon sum zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “perception” and so on.

original: dngos po so sor gyur pa ni mngon sum ste pra la sogs pa'i bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po so sor gyur pa ni mngon sum ste pra la sogs pa'i bsdu ba'o //
translated: The individual occurrence of an entity is perception, the inclusion of pra and so on.

original: 'di ni mtshon bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshon bya'o //
translated: This is the object to be illustrated.

original: rtog pa dang bral ba zhes pa mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral ba zhes pa mtshan nyid do //
translated: “Free from conceptual differentiation” is the characteristic.

original: rtog pa dang ldan pa med cing bral ba 'am rtogs pas ldan pa med cing bral ba ni rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang ldan pa med cing bral ba 'am rtogs pas ldan pa med cing bral ba ni rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The absence of, or freedom from, conceptual differentiation, or the absence of, or freedom from, the possession of conceptual differentiation, is freedom from conceptual differentiation.

original: rtog pa dang bral ba nges par bstan pa las kyang /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral ba nges par bstan pa las kyang /
translated: The Teaching Free from Conceptualization also says:

original: de shes pa'i bdag nyid do zhes rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: de shes pa'i bdag nyid do zhes rtogs par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that it is the nature of consciousness.

original: gang gi byir shes pa kho na la rtog pa dang 'dres pa yod la /
analyzed: gang gi byir shes pa kho na la rtog pa dang 'dres pa yod la /
translated: Because only consciousness is mixed with conceptualization,

original: de'i phyir de bkag pas de kho na rtogs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bkag pas de kho na rtogs so //
translated: therefore, by refuting that, reality is realized.

original: dper na bzhon ma be'u med pa khyer la shog ces be'u bkag pas ba lang bzhon ma kho na rtogs par bya'i gzhan ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bzhon ma be'u med pa khyer la shog ces be'u bkag pas ba lang bzhon ma kho na rtogs par bya'i gzhan ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, when one is told to bring a cow without a calf, by refuting the calf, only the cow is realized, not anything else.

original: 'o na rtog pa zhes bya ba 'di ci yin zhe na zhes te /
analyzed: 'o na rtog pa zhes bya ba 'di ci yin zhe na zhes te /
translated: Now, what is this so-called conceptualization?

original: rtog pa rnams mang po nyid kyi phyir 'dir 'chad par 'dod pa'i rtog pa gang yin zhes the tshom za ba'i dri ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa rnams mang po nyid kyi phyir 'dir 'chad par 'dod pa'i rtog pa gang yin zhes the tshom za ba'i dri ba'o //
translated: Since there are many kinds of conceptualization, the question is asked with doubt as to which conceptualization is intended here.

original: ming dang rigs sogs sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: ming dang rigs sogs sbyor ba'o //
translated: It is the application of names, types, and so on.

original: ming ni sogs pa'i sgras bsdus na yang /
analyzed: ming ni sogs pa'i sgras bsdus na yang /
translated: Although “and so on” includes types,

original: rigs la sogs pa rnams dang nus pa mtshungs ba ma yin ba'i phyir logs su byas pa'o //
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa rnams dang nus pa mtshungs ba ma yin ba'i phyir logs su byas pa'o //
translated: since they are not similar in capacity, they are treated separately.

original: nus pa mtshungs pa ma yin pa nyid ni ming la yod pa nyid kyi phyir dang / rigs la sogs pa rnams ni de las bzlog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nus pa mtshungs pa ma yin pa nyid ni ming la yod pa nyid kyi phyir dang / rigs la sogs pa rnams ni de las bzlog pa'i phyir te /
translated: The reason is that the similarity of potency exists in names, but not in universals, etc., because universals, etc., are the opposite of that.

original: rigs la sogs pa rnams yongs su brtags pa yin gyi de kho na nyid du yod pa rnams ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa rnams yongs su brtags pa yin gyi de kho na nyid du yod pa rnams ma yin no //
translated: Universals, etc., are imagined, not real.

original: ming dang rigs la sogs pa rnams kyi sbyor ba ni ming dang rigs sogs sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: ming dang rigs la sogs pa rnams kyi sbyor ba ni ming dang rigs sogs sbyor ba ste /
translated: The compound “application of names, universals, etc.” is a tatpurusa compound.

original: kri ta'i sbyor ba yang drug pa'i bsdu ba'o zhes pa tshig sdud do //
analyzed: kri ta'i sbyor ba yang drug pa'i bsdu ba'o zhes pa tshig sdud do //
translated: The compound “application of kṛtsna” is a sixth case tatpuruṣa compound.

original: kri tas sgrub byed do zhes pa yang na'o //
analyzed: kri tas sgrub byed do zhes pa yang na'o //
translated: The compound “accomplished by kṛtsna” is a third case tatpuruṣa compound.

original: 'di ci yin zhe na ming la sogs pa rnams de dang ldan pa'i don dang gang gis sbyor bar byed yang dag par sre bar byed pa'i shes pa de rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ci yin zhe na ming la sogs pa rnams de dang ldan pa'i don dang gang gis sbyor bar byed yang dag par sre bar byed pa'i shes pa de rtog pa'o //
translated: What is this? Conceptual thought is the cognition that connects names, universals, etc., with the object that possesses them, and that connects them in reality.

original: 'dir yang sbyor bar byas zin ba kho na'i shes pa rtog pa brjod @18b bar 'dod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir yang sbyor bar byas zin ba kho na'i shes pa rtog pa brjod @18b bar 'dod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, conceptual thought is not asserted to be the cognition that connects them after they have already been connected.

original: 'o na ci zhe na gang yang sbyor ba byas zin pa ma yin pa de la yang rung bar snang ba de yang yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na gang yang sbyor ba byas zin pa ma yin pa de la yang rung bar snang ba de yang yin no //
translated: What then? It is also that which appears to be suitable for anything that has not yet been applied.

original: gang gang la rung ba de de la byed bzhin pa ma yin pa la yang des nye bar bstan par 'os te /
analyzed: gang gang la rung ba de de la byed bzhin pa ma yin pa la yang des nye bar bstan par 'os te /
translated: And whatever is suitable for whatever, even if it is not being used, it is proper to indicate it with that.

original: me la 'tshed byed kyis bzhin no //
analyzed: me la 'tshed byed kyis bzhin no //
translated: Like fire with the cooking.

original: des na nu zho 'thung ba la sogs pa rnams la byis pa chung ngu la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ming la sogs pa dang sre ba med na yang rnam bar rtog pa dang bcas bar grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na nu zho 'thung ba la sogs pa rnams la byis pa chung ngu la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ming la sogs pa dang sre ba med na yang rnam bar rtog pa dang bcas bar grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, whatever conceptual cognition there is of infants, etc. with regard to those who are drinking milk, etc., that is established as conceptual even without the mixing of names, etc.

original: 'dod rgyal ba'i sgra rnams la zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod rgyal ba'i sgra rnams la zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: With regard to the words of the wish-granting tree, etc.

original: rigs la sogs pa 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan la mi ltos pa rnams ni 'dod rgyal ba'i sgra rnams so //
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan la mi ltos pa rnams ni 'dod rgyal ba'i sgra rnams so //
translated: The words of the wish-granting tree, etc. are those that do not depend on a reason for engaging in a class, etc.

original: gang gi phyir rtog pa ni shes pa'i chos yin gyi sgra'i chos ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtog pa ni shes pa'i chos yin gyi sgra'i chos ma yin la /
translated: Because conceptualization is a property of cognition, not a property of words.

original: de'i phyir ming gis khyad par du byas pa'i don gzung bar bya zhes smra bar bya ba la rtog pa ni mngon par brjod pa sgra dang yul mtshungs pa nyid du bstan pa'i ched du brjod par bya zhes pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ming gis khyad par du byas pa'i don gzung bar bya zhes smra bar bya ba la rtog pa ni mngon par brjod pa sgra dang yul mtshungs pa nyid du bstan pa'i ched du brjod par bya zhes pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the statement “The object qualified by the name is apprehended” is made in order to demonstrate that the object is the same as the expression, the sound.

original: de yang mngon par brjod pa bzhin du rtog pa'i shes pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can ma yin la /
analyzed: de yang mngon par brjod pa bzhin du rtog pa'i shes pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can ma yin la /
translated: And the conceptual cognition is like the expression, in that it does not have a particular as its object.

original: de'i phyir de mngon sum ma yin pa nyid du mngon par 'dod do zhes shes par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de mngon sum ma yin pa nyid du mngon par 'dod do zhes shes par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not a perception, as is well known.

original: dit tha zhes pa dita tha'i sgra'i rang gi ngo bo'i bdag nyid kyis don de de dang tha mi dad pa'i ngo bor rtogs par bya ba'o zhes grag go //
analyzed: dit tha zhes pa dita tha'i sgra'i rang gi ngo bo'i bdag nyid kyis don de de dang tha mi dad pa'i ngo bor rtogs par bya ba'o zhes grag go //
translated: The word dittha is said to be the name of a person, and the meaning of the word is the object that is understood to be of the same nature as the word dittha.

original: de bzhin du rigs la sogs ba rnams kyis de dang tha mi dad par nye bar btags par gyur pa'i don gyi don de rnams brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rigs la sogs ba rnams kyis de dang tha mi dad par nye bar btags par gyur pa'i don gyi don de rnams brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: In the same way, the meaning of the word is the object that is designated as not different from the class and so on.

original: dbyug pa can rva can zhes pa sbyor ba can dang 'du ba can gyi rdzas kyi dbye bas dper brjod gnyis so //
analyzed: dbyug pa can rva can zhes pa sbyor ba can dang 'du ba can gyi rdzas kyi dbye bas dper brjod gnyis so //
translated: The two examples are the compound “holder of a stick” and the compound “having horns,” which are distinguished by the substances that are combined and conjoined.

original: 'di la zhes pa bya ba dang rdzas kyi sgra rnams la ste /
analyzed: 'di la zhes pa bya ba dang rdzas kyi sgra rnams la ste /
translated: Here, the words “in this” refer to the words for action and substance.

original: bya ba dang rdzas dag dang de dang ldan pa rnams 'brel pa gang yin pa de sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan no //
analyzed: bya ba dang rdzas dag dang de dang ldan pa rnams 'brel pa gang yin pa de sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan no //
translated: The reason for the application of the words is the relation that exists between action and substance and that which possesses them.

original: de ltar ni byed pa nyid dbyug pa can nyid ces pa dngos po'i rkyen ni bya ba dang byed pa la sogs ba 'brel ba la 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar ni byed pa nyid dbyug pa can nyid ces pa dngos po'i rkyen ni bya ba dang byed pa la sogs ba 'brel ba la 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, the condition of an entity is the relation of action and agent, etc.,

original: ji skad du gsungs pa tshig sdud dang krita dang de la phan pa rnams la 'brel pa rjod par byed pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa tshig sdud dang krita dang de la phan pa rnams la 'brel pa rjod par byed pa'o zhes so //
translated: as it is said: “The relation is expressed in the case of a compound, a kṛt formation, and that which is beneficial to it.”

original: sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan la yang dngos po'i rkyen 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan la yang dngos po'i rkyen 'gyur te /
translated: The condition of an entity is also the reason for the application of a word.

original: de skad du yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de skad du yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: yon tan gang gi dngos po las rdzas la sgra nges par de 'jug pa de rjod par byed pa la tva dang ta la dag go zhes so //🔽'tshed pa dbyug @19a * //
analyzed: yon tan gang gi dngos po las rdzas la sgra nges par de 'jug pa de rjod par byed pa la tva dang ta la dag go zhes so // 'tshed pa dbyug @19a * //
