translated: The suffixes tva and ta are used to express the quality from which the substance derives its name.

original: pa can zhes yang krita dang de phan dag go //
analyzed: pa can zhes yang krita dang de phan dag go //
translated: The suffix kṛt is used to express the meaning of “cooker” and “holder.”

original: de'i phyir 'dir 'brel ba la dngos po'i rgyan no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir 'brel ba la dngos po'i rgyan no //
translated: Therefore, in this case, the suffix is a decoration of the substance.

original: gzhan rnams ni don gyis stong pa rnams kyis zhes pa rang gi lugs bzang bo ston te /
analyzed: gzhan rnams ni don gyis stong pa rnams kyis zhes pa rang gi lugs bzang bo ston te /
translated: The others are empty of meaning.

original: don de rigs la sogs pa'i khyad par dang bral ba rnams kyis zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: don de rigs la sogs pa'i khyad par dang bral ba rnams kyis zhes pa'i don no //
translated: The meaning is that they are devoid of the distinctions of class and so on.

original: ji ltar 'dod rgyal ba'i sgra rnams rigs la sogs pa'i khyad par 'jug pa la mi ltos pa kho nar brda'i dbang las rang gi don mngon par rjod par byed pa de ltar ba lang la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyang ste /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod rgyal ba'i sgra rnams rigs la sogs pa'i khyad par 'jug pa la mi ltos pa kho nar brda'i dbang las rang gi don mngon par rjod par byed pa de ltar ba lang la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyang ste /
translated: Just as the words of a madman express their meaning by the power of convention, without depending on the distinctions of class and so on, so too do the words cow and so on.

original: 'dod pa can gyi dbang gis 'jug pa'i sgra de rnams skyes bu rnams kyis 'dod pas gang dang gang du ji lta bur gyur pa la nges par sbyor bar byed pa de dang de'i don de lta bur gyur pa go bar byed pa cis rjod par byed /
analyzed: 'dod pa can gyi dbang gis 'jug pa'i sgra de rnams skyes bu rnams kyis 'dod pas gang dang gang du ji lta bur gyur pa la nges par sbyor bar byed pa de dang de'i don de lta bur gyur pa go bar byed pa cis rjod par byed /
translated: The sounds that occur by the power of desire are applied by people to whatever they desire, and they are understood to have the meaning of just that.

original: rigs la sogs pa rnams ni ma grub pas /
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa rnams ni ma grub pas /
translated: But since the class and so on are not established,

original: de rnams kyi sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po ga la yin zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po ga la yin zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: how could they be the things that are the reasons for the application of those sounds?

original: ci ste ci'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ci ste ci'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: If you say, “Why?”

original: gang yang rung ba med na med pa'i phyir gnyis ka la rag las nas 'jug pa de ci'i phyir gnyis la rag las nas skye ba'i shes pa la dbang po bstan pa kho nas brjod kyi yul gyis ma yin /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba med na med pa'i phyir gnyis ka la rag las nas 'jug pa de ci'i phyir gnyis la rag las nas skye ba'i shes pa la dbang po bstan pa kho nas brjod kyi yul gyis ma yin /
translated: If neither is the case, then since it does not exist without the other, why is it that the consciousness that arises in dependence on both is said to be dependent on the sense faculty alone, and not on the object?

original: snang ba na dbang po'i shes pa thams cad kyi rgyu mtshan ma yin zhing /
analyzed: snang ba na dbang po'i shes pa thams cad kyi rgyu mtshan ma yin zhing /
translated: When it appears, it is not the reason for all sense consciousnesses.

original: 'ga' zhig rnams kyi mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yang ma yin no zhes nye bar ma bkod la /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig rnams kyi mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yang ma yin no zhes nye bar ma bkod la /
translated: Nor is it the visual consciousness of some.

original: yid la byed pa ni 'jig rten na yul bzhin dang mig bzhin du rgyu nyid du rab tu grags pa ma yin pas nye bar ma bkod do //
analyzed: yid la byed pa ni 'jig rten na yul bzhin dang mig bzhin du rgyu nyid du rab tu grags pa ma yin pas nye bar ma bkod do //
translated: Mental activity is not mentioned as a cause, because it is not well known in the world as a cause, like the object and the eye.

original: yang na yul smos pas rgyu gzhan nye bar mtshon pa tsam mo //
analyzed: yang na yul smos pas rgyu gzhan nye bar mtshon pa tsam mo //
translated: Or, by mentioning the object, the other causes are merely indicated.

original: 'dir ji ltar ci zhig lta bar mngon sum gyi sgra bshad nas /
analyzed: 'dir ji ltar ci zhig lta bar mngon sum gyi sgra bshad nas /
translated: Here, how is the term perception explained?

original: de rnam par rtog pa med pa'i yang dag pa'i shes pa thams cad la ming nyid du yongs su bshad par bya ba'o zhes pa slob dpon gyi dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnam par rtog pa med pa'i yang dag pa'i shes pa thams cad la ming nyid du yongs su bshad par bya ba'o zhes pa slob dpon gyi dgongs pa'o //
translated: The master's intention is that it should be explained as the name of all non-conceptual correct knowledge.

original: gzhan gyis de mi shes par dbang bo'i rgyu mtshan can te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis de mi shes par dbang bo'i rgyu mtshan can te /
translated: Others, not knowing that, ask about the sense faculty as the cause.

original: 'di ming gi sgra ma yin zhes bsams nas dris pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ming gi sgra ma yin zhes bsams nas dris pa'o //
translated: Thinking that this is not the sound of the word name, they ask.

original: slob dpon gyis zhal gyis bzhes nas lan gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis zhal gyis bzhes nas lan gsungs pa'o //
translated: The master accepts and answers.

original: thun mong min pa'i rgyu nyid phyir //
analyzed: thun mong min pa'i rgyu nyid phyir //
translated: Because it is the uncommon cause.

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: This is what is said.

original: gang gi phyir dbang po rnams ni rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang dbang po gzhan gyi rnam par shes pa'i rten du mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbang po rnams ni rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang dbang po gzhan gyi rnam par shes pa'i rten du mi 'gyur la /
translated: Because the faculties do not serve as the basis for the mental consciousness and the consciousness of other faculties that are included in one’s own continuum.

original: de'i phyir de rnams kho nas dbang po gzugs can gyi rnam par shes @19b ba bstan pa rigs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de rnams kho nas dbang po gzugs can gyi rnam par shes @19b ba bstan pa rigs te /
translated: Therefore it is reasonable to say that the consciousness of the material faculties is taught by those faculties alone,

original: de thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyud nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyud nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the uncommon cause of that consciousness.

original: de ltar na mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa kho nar rtogs su gzhug par nus shing /
analyzed: de ltar na mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa kho nar rtogs su gzhug par nus shing /
translated: Thus it is possible to induce the understanding that the consciousnesses of the eye and so on are the faculties,

original: yul rnams kyis bstan pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yul rnams kyis bstan pas ni ma yin te /
translated: but not by teaching the objects,

original: de de la rtogs par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de de la rtogs par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: because the objects are not the cause of that understanding,

original: de yang thun mong ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang thun mong ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because they are the common cause of other consciousnesses.

original: de ltar ni yul rnams ni yid kyi rnam bar shes pa dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi rnam par shes pa'i thun mong ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar ni yul rnams ni yid kyi rnam bar shes pa dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi rnam par shes pa'i thun mong ba ste /
translated: The objects are common to the mental consciousness and the consciousnesses of other continua.

original: zla ba gsar ba la sogs pa lta ba rnams la rgyud du ma'i mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir dang / de'i rjes la thob pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zla ba gsar ba la sogs pa lta ba rnams la rgyud du ma'i mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir dang / de'i rjes la thob pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the eye consciousness and so on are the cause of the eye faculty and so on in the new month and so forth, and because the mental consciousness that is obtained subsequently is the cause of the mental faculty.

original: 'di 'dir dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di 'dir dgongs pa ste /
translated: This is the intended meaning here.

original: gang gi phyir 'jig rten gyis sgra 'di brjod par bya ba 'di la rtogs par byed pa'i nus pa yod do zhes go bar byed pa nyid mngon bar mthong nas sgra sbyor la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten gyis sgra 'di brjod par bya ba 'di la rtogs par byed pa'i nus pa yod do zhes go bar byed pa nyid mngon bar mthong nas sgra sbyor la /
translated: Because the world sees that this sound has the ability to cause understanding of this object, it applies the sound.

original: go bar byed pa nyid de yang dbang po'i rnam par shes pa la dbang pos bstan pas na yod kyi yul gyis bstan pa la yod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: go bar byed pa nyid de yang dbang po'i rnam par shes pa la dbang pos bstan pas na yod kyi yul gyis bstan pa la yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: And that ability to cause understanding exists when the object is indicated by the sense faculty to the sense consciousness, but it does not exist when the object is indicated by the sound.

original: go bar byed pa nyid kyis kyang sgra sbyar bar 'os pa nyid la khyab po //
analyzed: go bar byed pa nyid kyis kyang sgra sbyar bar 'os pa nyid la khyab po //
translated: And that ability to cause understanding also pervades the suitability of applying the sound.

original: de'i phyir go bar byed pa nyid de yul gyis bstan pa la ldog pas de sbyar bar 'os pa nyid kyang ldog par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir go bar byed pa nyid de yul gyis bstan pa la ldog pas de sbyar bar 'os pa nyid kyang ldog par byed do //
translated: Therefore, since that ability to cause understanding is absent when the object is indicated by the sound, the suitability of applying the sound is also absent.

original: de'i phyir yul rnams kyis bstan par bya ba ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yul rnams kyis bstan par bya ba ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they are not to be taught by the objects.

original: 'o na 'dod pa'i dbang gis 'jug pa'i sgra rnams don thams cad go bar byed par rung ba'o zhes brjod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'dod pa'i dbang gis 'jug pa'i sgra rnams don thams cad go bar byed par rung ba'o zhes brjod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn’t it said that the sounds that occur by the power of desire are suitable to make known all objects?

original: bden te 'dod pa kho nas 'jig rten pas thun mong ma yin pas ston pa la yod kyi thun mong bas ma yin te /
analyzed: bden te 'dod pa kho nas 'jig rten pas thun mong ma yin pas ston pa la yod kyi thun mong bas ma yin te /
translated: It is so, but the world makes known by desire alone, not by the common [means].

original: de ltar ni 'jig rten thun mong ma yin pa kho nas ston par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar ni 'jig rten thun mong ma yin pa kho nas ston par byed do //
translated: Thus, the world makes known by the uncommon [means] alone.

original: ston par byed pa gang yin pa ni /
analyzed: ston par byed pa gang yin pa ni /
translated: And that which makes known,

original: thun mong ma yin pas tha snyad byed pa yang mthong ste zhes pa la sogs pa'o //🔽tha snyad nyid kyang 'jig rten na des rnam par gzhag pa 'dir bya ba ste /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pas tha snyad byed pa yang mthong ste zhes pa la sogs pa'o // tha snyad nyid kyang 'jig rten na des rnam par gzhag pa 'dir bya ba ste /
translated: is seen to be used by the uncommon [means].

original: de'i go bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes sems so //
analyzed: de'i go bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes sems so //
translated: And the conventional itself is established in the world by that, because it is the means of making that known.🔽Thus, it is thought.

original: 'di 'thad do zhes pa rigs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di 'thad do zhes pa rigs pa ste /
translated: This is reasonable,

original: gang gi phyir mngon sum rtogs pa dang bral bar mngon sum kho nas grub na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon sum rtogs pa dang bral bar mngon sum kho nas grub na /
translated: Why? Because if direct perception were established by direct perception alone, free from conceptual thought,

original: 'dir rigs pa gzhan gyis ci zhig ces dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir rigs pa gzhan gyis ci zhig ces dgongs pa'o //
translated: what would be the use of other principles here?

original: thams cad kyi brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni rang rig pa 'am shes pa gzhan gyis so so rang gis rig par bya ba yin zhing /🔽mngon sum yang rnam @20a * //
analyzed: thams cad kyi brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni rang rig pa 'am shes pa gzhan gyis so so rang gis rig par bya ba yin zhing / mngon sum yang rnam @20a * //
translated: The conceptual thought that is suitable to be mixed with the expression of everything is to be known by oneself through reflexive awareness or another consciousness.

original: par rtog pa dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: par rtog pa dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir te /
translated: And direct perception is also free from being mixed with conceptual thought.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba kho nar bdag nyid yongs su gcod pa skye'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba kho nar bdag nyid yongs su gcod pa skye'o //
translated: Because the ascertainment of the object alone arises free from conceptual thought.

original: de ltar ni yul thams cad las rnam par rtog pa bkug nas rnam par rtog pa ma lus pa nub pa'i yid kyis gnas pa'i srog chags kyis kyang mig gi rnam par shes bas gzugs mthong ste /
analyzed: de ltar ni yul thams cad las rnam par rtog pa bkug nas rnam par rtog pa ma lus pa nub pa'i yid kyis gnas pa'i srog chags kyis kyang mig gi rnam par shes bas gzugs mthong ste /
translated: In this way, even a living being who has withdrawn conceptual thought from all objects and whose mind is free from all conceptual thought sees forms with eye consciousness.

original: de yang rtog pa dang bral ba mngon sum kho na'o //
analyzed: de yang rtog pa dang bral ba mngon sum kho na'o //
translated: And that is direct perception alone, free from conceptual thought.

original: dbang po'i blo rnams rtog par gyur pa kho na ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i blo rnams rtog par gyur pa kho na ste /
translated: The cognitions of the sense faculties are only conceptual.

original: 'on kyang de rnams nye bar mtshon bar bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang de rnams nye bar mtshon bar bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But they are not the object of representation.

original: 'di ni gtam tsam ste /
analyzed: 'di ni gtam tsam ste /
translated: This is mere talk.

original: de ltar na rnam par rtog pa med pa'i skabs las phyis cung zad rnam par rtog ba des bdag gi rnam par rtog pa 'di lta bu dang 'di lta bur gyur to zhes sems kyi rgyun sre bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par rtog pa med pa'i skabs las phyis cung zad rnam par rtog ba des bdag gi rnam par rtog pa 'di lta bu dang 'di lta bur gyur to zhes sems kyi rgyun sre bar byed do //
translated: Thus, after the period of non-conception, the mind is again slightly conceptual, and one remembers the stream of consciousness, thinking, “I had such and such conceptions.”

original: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa 'di ni nye bar mtshon par bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo can kho na ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa 'di ni nye bar mtshon par bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo can kho na ste /
translated: Therefore, this conception is the nature of the object of representation.

original: de gal te dbang po'i rnam par shes pa las 'gyur na sngar yang mtshon par bya bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de gal te dbang po'i rnam par shes pa las 'gyur na sngar yang mtshon par bya bar 'gyur na /
translated: If it arises from a sense consciousness, it would be a representation even before,

original: rnam par rtog pa bsdus pa'i gnas skabs na nye bar mtshon pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bsdus pa'i gnas skabs na nye bar mtshon pa yang ma yin no //
translated: but it is not a representation during the period of the gathering of conceptions.

original: des na de de la med do zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: des na de de la med do zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that it does not exist then.

original: de ni 'gyur mod /
analyzed: de ni 'gyur mod /
translated: That is possible.

original: dbang po'i bya ba can gyi shes pa gang yin pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid du khyed cag mngon par 'dod pa brjod pa dang 'dres pa sbrul lo sprul lo zhes rgyun gyis 'jug pa 'di rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba dag sbyor🔽ba po dang don mthong ba po ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i bya ba can gyi shes pa gang yin pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid du khyed cag mngon par 'dod pa brjod pa dang 'dres pa sbrul lo sprul lo zhes rgyun gyis 'jug pa 'di rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba dag sbyor ba po dang don mthong ba po ste /
translated: It is the one that is engaged in a continuum, such as when one says, “It is a snake,” or “It is a rope,” and it is the one that connects the one who speaks and the one who understands the meaning.

original: de rnam par rtog pa yin yang rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pa bzhin du mngon sum kho nar 'dod par bya ste /
analyzed: de rnam par rtog pa yin yang rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pa bzhin du mngon sum kho nar 'dod par bya ste /
translated: It is a conceptual consciousness, but like a nonconceptual consciousness, it should be asserted to be a direct perceiver.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na mthong ba rnam par chad par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na mthong ba rnam par chad par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Otherwise, seeing would be interrupted.

original: rnam par rtog pa yang ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yang ste /
translated: It would be conceptual.

original: rnam par rtog pas mthong ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang mthong bas rnam par rtog pas byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang de dag lhan cig mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas mthong ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang mthong bas rnam par rtog pas byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang de dag lhan cig mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because seeing is not done by a conceptual consciousness, conceptualization is not done by seeing, and they do not operate simultaneously.

original: rnam par ma chad par mthong ba yang yod do //
analyzed: rnam par ma chad par mthong ba yang yod do //
translated: There is also seeing that is not interrupted.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa 'di kho na dbang po las skyes pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa 'di kho na dbang po las skyes pa'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, this very conceptual cognition is the one that arises from the sense faculties.

original: de'i tshe rnam par rtog pa can mngon sum du smra ba'i yang /
analyzed: de'i tshe rnam par rtog pa can mngon sum du smra ba'i yang /
translated: At that time, even for one who advocates that conceptual cognition is direct perception,

original: ba lang la sogs pa nye bar gyur pa'i yul de la mngon sum 'jug pa na /
analyzed: ba lang la sogs pa nye bar gyur pa'i yul de la mngon sum 'jug pa na /
translated: when direct perception engages the object that is the present cow, etc.,

original: don gzhan gyi ming rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa gzhan mngon du gyur pa yod na /
analyzed: don gzhan gyi ming rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa gzhan mngon du gyur pa yod na /
translated: if another conceptual cognition that recalls the name of another object occurs,

original: so sor nye bar gnas pa'i yul 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa mngon sum nyid du 'dod pa ci ltar chod pa ma yin /
analyzed: so sor nye bar gnas pa'i yul 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa mngon sum nyid du 'dod pa ci ltar chod pa ma yin /
translated: why is it not the case that the conceptual cognition that apprehends the object that is present is direct perception?

original: chod na @20b yang ci ltar mthong bar nam bar ma chad par 'gyur zhes pa brtsad pa mtshungs so //
analyzed: chod na @20b yang ci ltar mthong bar nam bar ma chad par 'gyur zhes pa brtsad pa mtshungs so //
translated: If it is obstructed, then how could it be that it sees without being obstructed? The dispute is the same.

original: 'dir 'gyur mod /
analyzed: 'dir 'gyur mod /
translated: This is possible.

original: rigs mi mthun pa'i rnam par rtog ba'i dus na mthong ba med pa /
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa'i rnam par rtog ba'i dus na mthong ba med pa /
translated: At the time of conceptual cognition of a dissimilar type, there is no seeing.

original: de lta na yang de rnam par chad pa ma yin pa kho nar rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang de rnam par chad pa ma yin pa kho nar rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Even so, it should be understood that it is not interrupted.

original: shin tu myur bar 'jug pas mthong ba gzhan skyed pas na des stong pa'i dus na mtshams sbyor ba nyid kyi phyir mgal me bzhin no //
analyzed: shin tu myur bar 'jug pas mthong ba gzhan skyed pas na des stong pa'i dus na mtshams sbyor ba nyid kyi phyir mgal me bzhin no //
translated: Because it engages its object very quickly, it produces the appearance of another object, and because it is empty of that, it is like a firebrand circle.

original: mgal me ni yul snga ma snga ma spangs nas phyi ma phyi ma'i yul la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: mgal me ni yul snga ma snga ma spangs nas phyi ma phyi ma'i yul la 'jug pa ste /
translated: A firebrand is an object that is relinquished in the past and engages a subsequent object.

original: 'khor lor snang ba'i yul mtha' dag la khyab pa ma yin no zhes pas de la rnam par nges pa'i yul snang ba kho na'i rnam par shes par 'gyur gyi phyogs thams cad du rjes su song ba snang ba ni ma yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'khor lor snang ba'i yul mtha' dag la khyab pa ma yin no zhes pas de la rnam par nges pa'i yul snang ba kho na'i rnam par shes par 'gyur gyi phyogs thams cad du rjes su song ba snang ba ni ma yin par 'gyur na /
translated: Since it does not pervade all objects that appear as a wheel, it is ascertained that consciousness appears in that way, but it does not appear to pervade all directions.

original: 'on kyang 'khor lor snang ba'i mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'khor lor snang ba'i mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: However, it is seen as a wheel.

original: de'i phyir mtshams sbyor ba las ngas 'khor lo mthong ngo snyam pa'i blo yin pa ji lta ba de ltar 'dir yang ngo zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshams sbyor ba las ngas 'khor lo mthong ngo snyam pa'i blo yin pa ji lta ba de ltar 'dir yang ngo zhe na /
translated: Therefore, just as the thought I see a wheel arises from the connection of the firebrand, so too it is in this case.

original: de ni mngon sum rnam par rtog pa med par smra ba la yang mtshungs te /
analyzed: de ni mngon sum rnam par rtog pa med par smra ba la yang mtshungs te /
translated: This is similar to the assertion that direct perception is nonconceptual.

original: gang shin tu myur bar 'jug pas zhes pa la sogs par brjod pa de ni rim gyis 'byung ba'i mthong ba dang rnam bar rtog pa dag la yang rnam par ma chad pa mthong ba zhen ba sgrub par byed pa'i ched du mngon sum rnam par rtog pa
analyzed: gang shin tu myur bar 'jug pas zhes pa la sogs par brjod pa de ni rim gyis 'byung ba'i mthong ba dang rnam bar rtog pa dag la yang rnam par ma chad pa mthong ba zhen ba sgrub par byed pa'i ched du mngon sum rnam par rtog pa
translated: The statement “because it engages its object very quickly” and so on is for the purpose of establishing that the noninterrupted perception of gradual arising of seeing and conception is direct perception, not conceptual.

original: med par smra ba'i yang yongs su rdzogs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: med par smra ba'i yang yongs su rdzogs pa kho na'o //
translated: This is the complete position of the nonconceptualists.

original: yang na rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rnam par rtog pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa gnyis dag cig car du 'jug ste /
analyzed: yang na rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rnam par rtog pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa gnyis dag cig car du 'jug ste /
translated: Or else, conceptual and nonconceptual consciousnesses occur simultaneously.

original: de dag rang bzhin gyi dbye ba nges par ma zin pa'i rtogs pa pos rmongs pa las gcig nyid du lhag par zhen to //
analyzed: de dag rang bzhin gyi dbye ba nges par ma zin pa'i rtogs pa pos rmongs pa las gcig nyid du lhag par zhen to //
translated: Because of the confusion of the cognizer who does not ascertain the difference in their nature, they are conceived to be one.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa 'di ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa 'di ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore this conceptual consciousness is mental consciousness alone.

original: dbang po'i shes pa ni de dang lhan cig 'byung ba 'am rim gyis 'byung yang rung rnam par rtog pa med pa kho na'o zhes pa 'di gnas so //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa ni de dang lhan cig 'byung ba 'am rim gyis 'byung yang rung rnam par rtog pa med pa kho na'o zhes pa 'di gnas so //
translated: This is the position.

original: mngon sum rtog pa dang bral ba //
analyzed: mngon sum rtog pa dang bral ba //
translated: Direct perception is free from conceptual thought.

original: mngon sum kho nas grub pa yin //
analyzed: mngon sum kho nas grub pa yin //
translated: It is established by direct perception itself.

original: zhes so // 'dir kha cig smra ste /
analyzed: zhes so // 'dir kha cig smra ste /
translated: Here, someone might say:

original: gal te mngon sum gyi sgras mngon sum brjod bar bya na /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyi sgras mngon sum brjod bar bya na /
translated: If the word “direct perception” is to be taken as expressing direct perception,

original: de rtog pa dang bral ba ci ltar yin te /
analyzed: de rtog pa dang bral ba ci ltar yin te /
translated: how can it be free from conceptual thought?

original: ci ltar ma brjod pa rtogs she'o //
analyzed: ci ltar ma brjod pa rtogs she'o //
translated: How can it be understood as not being expressed?

original: de ni rtog pa'i rang gi ngo bo yang dag par brjod pa kho nas bsal lo //
analyzed: de ni rtog pa'i rang gi ngo bo yang dag par brjod pa kho nas bsal lo //
translated: This is eliminated by the mere expression of the nature of conceptual thought.

original: gang las brjod bar bya ba'i rtog pa dang bral ba @21a * //
analyzed: gang las brjod bar bya ba'i rtog pa dang bral ba @21a * //
translated: From what is it to be eliminated?

original: ldog par 'gyur ba rtogs par bya ba ma yin gyi /🔽'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: ldog par 'gyur ba rtogs par bya ba ma yin gyi / 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: It is not to be understood as being eliminated from the object of conceptual thought.

original: rtogs pa'i khyad par ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i khyad par ro zhes bshad do //
translated: Rather, it is to be understood as being eliminated from the special object of conceptual thought.

original: mngon sum kho nas rtog pa dang bral ba nyid grub pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi 'on kyang lung gis kyang ngo zhes ston pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: mngon sum kho nas rtog pa dang bral ba nyid grub pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi 'on kyang lung gis kyang ngo zhes ston pa gsungs pa /
translated: Not only is the absence of conceptual thought established by direct perception alone, but also by scriptural authority.

original: chos pa la sogs pa'o//
analyzed: chos pa la sogs pa'o//
translated: The Buddha said, “Monks, I will teach you dharmas, I will teach you the meaning of dharmas, and I will teach you the person furnished with dharmas.”

original: yang dag par ldan pa ni ldan pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag par ldan pa ni ldan pa ste /
translated: “Furnished with” means endowed with.

original: 'grogs pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'grogs pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It means “accompanied by.”

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan te de 'di la yod do zhes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan te de 'di la yod do zhes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: “Endowed with eye consciousness” means that it is endowed with eye consciousness.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang 'grogs pa zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang 'grogs pa zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: It means “accompanied by eye consciousness.”

original: sngon po rnam par shes so zhes pa sngon po'o //
analyzed: sngon po rnam par shes so zhes pa sngon po'o //
translated: “Conscious of blue” means “conscious of blue-ness.”

original: don rang gi ngo bos shes kyi /🔽sngon po'o zhes pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: don rang gi ngo bos shes kyi / sngon po'o zhes pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The object is cognized by its nature.🔽It is not cognized as “blue.”

original: de'i ming gis 'di sngon po'o zhes ni shes par mi byed do //
analyzed: de'i ming gis 'di sngon po'o zhes ni shes par mi byed do //
translated: It is not cognized by its name as “this is blue.”

original: 'di kho na tshig phyi ma gnyis kyis gsal bar byed de /
analyzed: 'di kho na tshig phyi ma gnyis kyis gsal bar byed de /
translated: This is clarified by the next two sentences.

original: don la don du 'du shes kyi zhes pa don rang gi ngo bor 'du shes kyi /
analyzed: don la don du 'du shes kyi zhes pa don rang gi ngo bor 'du shes kyi /
translated: “Conscious of the object as an object” means conscious of the object by its nature.

original: don la chos su 'du shes pa ni ma yin zhes pa don la ming gi 'du shes pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: don la chos su 'du shes pa ni ma yin zhes pa don la ming gi 'du shes pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one does not have the idea of a name in regard to the object.

original: 'o na ci ltar zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: How is this so?

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga rnams ni bsags pa la dmigs pa rnams so zhes pa'i grub pa'i mtha' 'di de ci ltar rigs te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga rnams ni bsags pa la dmigs pa rnams so zhes pa'i grub pa'i mtha' 'di de ci ltar rigs te /
translated: How is this theory of the Vaibhāṣikas tenable, namely, that the five collections of consciousness have as their object a collection?

original: gal te de gcig tu ste gcig nyid du dmigs pa la mi rtog na'o //
analyzed: gal te de gcig tu ste gcig nyid du dmigs pa la mi rtog na'o //
translated: If they do not conceive of a single object as a unity.

original: 'di ltar sems te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems te /
translated: The following is the idea.

original: bsags pa'i sgras tshogs pa brjod do //
analyzed: bsags pa'i sgras tshogs pa brjod do //
translated: The word “collection” means an aggregation.

original: dngos po la nishth'as bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po la nishth'as bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a thing is established by its parts.

original: 'dus pa dang bsags pa dang bsdus pa dang tshogs pa zhes pa ni rnam grangs rnams so //
analyzed: 'dus pa dang bsags pa dang bsdus pa dang tshogs pa zhes pa ni rnam grangs rnams so //
translated: “Aggregation,” “collection,” “combination,” and “aggregate” are synonyms.

original: bsags pa de yang rdul phra rab gcig la med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: bsags pa de yang rdul phra rab gcig la med pa kho na ste /
translated: Moreover, that aggregation does not exist in a single atom,

original: 'on kyang mang po rnams kyi thun mong gi chos yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang mang po rnams kyi thun mong gi chos yin la /
translated: but it is a common property of many.

original: spyi de la gal te dbang po'i blo rab tu 'jug na /
analyzed: spyi de la gal te dbang po'i blo rab tu 'jug na /
translated: If the cognition of a sense faculty engages that generality,

original: de'i tshe 'di rnam par rtog pa can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di rnam par rtog pa can du 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, it would be conceptual,

original: spyi'i blo ni nges par rnam par rtog pa dang rjes su 'brel pas so //
analyzed: spyi'i blo ni nges par rnam par rtog pa dang rjes su 'brel pas so //
translated: because the cognition of a universal is definitely connected with conceptualization.

original: spyi dngos por yod pa'i grub pa'i mtha' 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi dngos por yod pa'i grub pa'i mtha' 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: We do not accept the philosophical position that a universal is a real entity.

original: de'i phyir des de la rnam par rtog pa byed pa kho na'o zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir des de la rnam par rtog pa byed pa kho na'o zhes byas nas so //
translated: Therefore, it is only because of that that it is said to be conceptual.

original: gang yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Also, with regard to what was said, beginning with “the five collections of consciousness,”

original: skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gzung bya nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gzung bya nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: the intrinsic identity of the sense bases is being an object of apprehension of the eye consciousness, and so on.

original: de'i ngor rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po 'di rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can rnams te /
analyzed: de'i ngor rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po 'di rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can rnams te /
translated: From the perspective of that, these five collections of consciousness are said to have a particular intrinsic identity as their object,

original: rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ni ma @21b yin no zhes pa rdzas ni sngon po la sogs pa bye brag rnams so //
analyzed: rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ni ma @21b yin no zhes pa rdzas ni sngon po la sogs pa bye brag rnams so //
translated: but not a substantial intrinsic identity. “ Substantial” refers to the particulars, such as blue and so on.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can nyid bkag pas shugs las de rnams kyi yul ni gang spyi tha dad med pa de yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can nyid bkag pas shugs las de rnams kyi yul ni gang spyi tha dad med pa de yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the existence of a cognition that has as its object the intrinsic identity of a substance such as blue is refuted, it is implied that the object of those [cognitions] is that which is not a different universal.

original: de'i phyir yang rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba nyid 'gal te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba nyid 'gal te /
translated: Therefore, it is contradictory to claim that [the cognition] is free from conceptualization.

original: de'i bstan bcos de rnam pa gzhan du drang bar ci ltar nus zhes pa bsam pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bstan bcos de rnam pa gzhan du drang bar ci ltar nus zhes pa bsam pa'o //
translated: How can that treatise be interpreted in any other way? is the thought.

original: de gnyi ga'i yang lan cig gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i yang lan cig gsungs pa /
translated: The reply to both [objections] is stated:

original: der don du mas bskyed pa'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: der don du mas bskyed pa'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Because it is produced by many meanings there, etc.

original: der zhes pa bstan bcos su'o //🔽gcig min don gyis bskyed bya'i phyir //
analyzed: der zhes pa bstan bcos su'o // gcig min don gyis bskyed bya'i phyir //
translated: There refers to the treatise.🔽Because it is not one and is produced by the meaning,

original: zhes pa rdul phra rab gcig ma yin pas bskyed par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa rdul phra rab gcig ma yin pas bskyed par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: means because it is not produced by a single atom, that is the meaning.

original: rang gi rgyu dang rkyen rnams las rdul phra rab phan tshun thag nye ba'i gnas skabs thob pa kho nar gyur pa so sor rnam par shes pa skyed par nus pa rnams skye ba ni bsags pa'i sgras brjod de /🔽bsags pa bsdus pa'i rnam grangs can 'di rnams la yang dag par skyes pa'o zhes pa bsags pa rnams te /🔽pa la sogs pa rnams las byings las skyes pa'i'o zhes pa tshig phyi ma phyis pa can gyi 'bru mang po ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu dang rkyen rnams las rdul phra rab phan tshun thag nye ba'i gnas skabs thob pa kho nar gyur pa so sor rnam par shes pa skyed par nus pa rnams skye ba ni bsags pa'i sgras brjod de / bsags pa bsdus pa'i rnam grangs can 'di rnams la yang dag par skyes pa'o zhes pa bsags pa rnams te / pa la sogs pa rnams las byings las skyes pa'i'o zhes pa tshig phyi ma phyis pa can gyi 'bru mang po ba'o //
translated: The term “aggregate” refers to the arising of atoms that are capable of producing consciousness when they obtain a state of proximity to one another through their own causes and conditions.🔽The term “aggregate” is a synonym for “collection.”🔽The term “aggregate” is a bahuvrīhi compound that means “those in whom there is a true arising.”

original: dper na rab tu bsdams pa zhes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rab tu bsdams pa zhes pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the term “well-restrained,” in which the term “restrained” is a bahuvrīhi compound.

original: 'dir kta'i rkyen dngos po byas pa'ang ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'dir kta'i rkyen dngos po byas pa'ang ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: In this case, the suffix kta is not used in the sense of an action.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is its sense?

original: las kho na las te /
analyzed: las kho na las te /
translated: It is used in the sense of an action.

original: phan tshun nye bar phan pa'i rkyen rnams kyis de rnams bsags te 'dus par byas pas so //
analyzed: phan tshun nye bar phan pa'i rkyen rnams kyis de rnams bsags te 'dus par byas pas so //
translated: The term “aggregate” means that the atoms are collected and assembled through the mutual assistance of conditions.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i du ma de rnams kyis rang snang ba bskyed do zhes pas bsags pa la dmigs pa rnams zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i du ma de rnams kyis rang snang ba bskyed do zhes pas bsags pa la dmigs pa rnams zhes gsungs so //
translated: The many aspects of that sort generate their own appearance, so it is said that they are called “those that focus on collections.”

original: de rnams thams cad la'ang bsags pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par gyis dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams thams cad la'ang bsags pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par gyis dmigs pa ste /
translated: All of those are called “those that focus on collections” because they are objects.

original: rdzas gcig kho na ni ma yin no zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: rdzas gcig kho na ni ma yin no zhes byas nas so //
translated: They are not just one substance.

original: gang yang skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ngor 'di rnams zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa 'di la yang /
analyzed: gang yang skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ngor 'di rnams zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa 'di la yang /
translated: Also, in the statement “In terms of the intrinsic identity of the sense bases, those . . .”

original: rdul phra rab ji skad brjod pa 'dus pa kho na de rnams kyis mig la sogs pa rnam par shes pa bskyed kyi /
analyzed: rdul phra rab ji skad brjod pa 'dus pa kho na de rnams kyis mig la sogs pa rnam par shes pa bskyed kyi /
translated: The eye consciousness and so on are generated by the mere aggregation of the atoms that are referred to.

original: gcig kho nas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig kho nas ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not generated by one atom alone.🔽Therefore it says:

original: de'i phyir / gcig min don gyis bskyed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gcig min don gyis bskyed pa'i phyir //
translated: Not one, because they generate objects.

original: rang don la spyi'i spyod yul can //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang don la spyi'i spyod yul can // zhes gsungs so //
translated: They have a general object in terms of their own object.

original: 'di'i spyod yul spyi yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di'i spyod yul spyi yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “their object is a general object” is a grammatical construction.

original: 'o na spyi ni tha mi dad pa btags pa yin la /
analyzed: 'o na spyi ni tha mi dad pa btags pa yin la /
translated: Well, a universal is a designation of what is undifferentiated.

original: dbang po'i shes pa'i yul ni rdul phra rab ces bya @22a * //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa'i yul ni rdul phra rab ces bya @22a * //
translated: The object of a sense consciousness is called a “subtle particle.”🔽

original: ba gcig min gyi dngos po ste /
analyzed: ba gcig min gyi dngos po ste /
translated: The object of sense consciousness is not a single subtle particle, but a thing.

original: de ci ltar spyi'i spyod yul can nyid du rtogs par bya /
analyzed: de ci ltar spyi'i spyod yul can nyid du rtogs par bya /
translated: How is it understood to be the domain of a universal?

original: zhe na / skyon 'di ni med de /
analyzed: zhe na / skyon 'di ni med de /
translated: This fault does not exist,

original: gang de bsags pa'i sgra dang skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi sgras gsungs pa rdul pra rab gcig min gyi dngos po de khon so sor nges pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed par nus pas chos mthun pas na phan tshun ltos pas thun mong
analyzed: gang de bsags pa'i sgra dang skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi sgras gsungs pa rdul pra rab gcig min gyi dngos po de khon so sor nges pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed par nus pas chos mthun pas na phan tshun ltos pas thun mong
translated: because that which is said to be the object of accumulation and the object of the intrinsic identity of the sense base is not a single subtle particle, but that very thing is able to generate a consciousness that is individually ascertained.🔽Therefore, by similarity, they are mutually dependent and common.

original: bas te / thun mong ba kho na'ang spyi'o //
analyzed: bas te / thun mong ba kho na'ang spyi'o //
translated: The common alone is a universal.

original: rang gi don la de phan gyis sgrub pa'i phyir rigs bzhi nyid ces pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rang gi don la de phan gyis sgrub pa'i phyir rigs bzhi nyid ces pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it is established by the benefit of its own object, it is like the four types.

original: des na 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, this is explained:

original: bsags pa'i spyod yul can dang skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi spyod yul can du gsungs so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bsags pa'i spyod yul can dang skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi spyod yul can du gsungs so zhes pa'o //
translated: It is said to be the object of accumulation and the object of the intrinsic identity of the sense base.

original: tha dad pa rnams la tha mi dad par rtog pa las ni ma yin no zhes pa /
analyzed: tha dad pa rnams la tha mi dad par rtog pa las ni ma yin no zhes pa /
translated: But it is not from the conception of the undifferentiated in the differentiated.

original: spyi'i yul can du gsungs pa zhes pa 'di dang sbrel lo //
analyzed: spyi'i yul can du gsungs pa zhes pa 'di dang sbrel lo //
translated: This is connected with the statement that it has a universal for its object.

original: tha dad pa rnams la tha dad pa med par rtog pas na bsags pa'i yul can dang skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can du gsungs pa ni ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: tha dad pa rnams la tha dad pa med par rtog pas na bsags pa'i yul can dang skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can du gsungs pa ni ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is not from the conception of the undifferentiated in the differentiated that it is said to have a composite for its object or to have the sense-sphere of the specific characteristics for its object.

original: rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ma yin no zhes pa 'dis kyang rdul phra rab gcig gi rdzas la nges pa bsal ba bstan bcos su mdzad par blta bar bya'i /
analyzed: rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ma yin no zhes pa 'dis kyang rdul phra rab gcig gi rdzas la nges pa bsal ba bstan bcos su mdzad par blta bar bya'i /
translated: This also shows that the treatise has eliminated the determination of a substance in a single atom, by the statement that it is not the specific characteristic of a substance.

original: shugs kyis 'phangs pa'i spyi'i yul nyid ni ma yin no zhes pa 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: shugs kyis 'phangs pa'i spyi'i yul nyid ni ma yin no zhes pa 'gal ba med do //
translated: But it is not contradictory that it is not the universal that is indirectly implied.

original: gang rnams dbang po'i rnam par shes pa gcig gi 'bras bu can nyid kyis gzugs kyi skye mched la sogs pa gcig tu bsdus na yang /
analyzed: gang rnams dbang po'i rnam par shes pa gcig gi 'bras bu can nyid kyis gzugs kyi skye mched la sogs pa gcig tu bsdus na yang /
translated: Those that are included in a single sense-sphere of form, etc., because they are the effect of a single sense-perception,

original: rdzas du ma cig car gzung bar bya ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang rim pa kho nas so zhes smra'o //
analyzed: rdzas du ma cig car gzung bar bya ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang rim pa kho nas so zhes smra'o //
translated: But they are apprehended only sequentially, not simultaneously.

original: de rnams la 'di brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams la 'di brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: gal te cig car rdzas mang po rnams 'dzin pa med na /
analyzed: gal te cig car rdzas mang po rnams 'dzin pa med na /
translated: If many substances are not apprehended simultaneously,

original: 'o na ci ltar til dang ma shal sogs pa rnam par chad pa'i yul na gnas pa rnams lan cig la 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar til dang ma shal sogs pa rnam par chad pa'i yul na gnas pa rnams lan cig la 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: then how is it that sesame seeds, beans, etc., which are located in a place that is divided, are apprehended at one time?

original: de rnams kyis ldan pa med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / rigs mi mthun pa nyid kyi phyir gang 'dzin par 'gyur ba rdzas gzhan gcig pa rtsom pa ni med do //
analyzed: de rnams kyis ldan pa med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / rigs mi mthun pa nyid kyi phyir gang 'dzin par 'gyur ba rdzas gzhan gcig pa rtsom pa ni med do //
translated: Because they are not conjoined, and because they are not of a homogeneous type, there is no single substance that is apprehended.

original: gal te mthong ba myur du 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir 'khrul pas rim pa ldan pa yang der rim pa med par lhag par zhen pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mthong ba myur du 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir 'khrul pas rim pa ldan pa yang der rim pa med par lhag par zhen pa'o zhe na /
translated: If you think that it is because the visual sense faculty engages its object quickly that there is the illusion of a sequence, and that therefore there is no sequence,

original: de'i tshe rim gyis lhung ba de rnams la'ang myur ba nyid mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir lan cig kho na la 'dzin no zhes lhag par zhen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe rim gyis lhung ba de rnams la'ang myur ba nyid mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir lan cig kho na la 'dzin no zhes lhag par zhen par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, because the speed of the falling of those [letters] is the same, one apprehends them as if all at once.

original: gzhan yang ra yig dang sa yig la @22b sogs pa'i yi ge rnams la myur bar 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir mthong ba rim pa min par 'dzin pa dang lhag par zhen par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gzhan yang ra yig dang sa yig la @22b sogs pa'i yi ge rnams la myur bar 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir mthong ba rim pa min par 'dzin pa dang lhag par zhen par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Moreover, because of the quick engagement of the letters such as ra and sa, one apprehends and conceives of the order of the appearance as not being sequential.

original: de las kyang ra sa dang sa ra zhes pa 'di lta bu la sogs pa'i sgra rnams la rim pa tha dad pa las mnyan pa tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las kyang ra sa dang sa ra zhes pa 'di lta bu la sogs pa'i sgra rnams la rim pa tha dad pa las mnyan pa tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And from that, in the case of sounds such as rasā and saras, the order is different, but the hearing is not different.

original: myur du 'khor ba'i chu'i thigs pa lhung ba la sogs pa rnams la yang mthong ba myur ba nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: myur du 'khor ba'i chu'i thigs pa lhung ba la sogs pa rnams la yang mthong ba myur ba nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Also, in the case of quickly falling drops of water and so on, because the seeing is quick,

original: rim gyis 'dzin zhes pa'i bsam pas 'dzin par lhag par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rim gyis 'dzin zhes pa'i bsam pas 'dzin par lhag par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: one does not conceive of apprehending them sequentially.

original: de'i phyir ji srid spyod yul du gyur ba de thams cad cig car kho nar rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji srid spyod yul du gyur ba de thams cad cig car kho nar rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, all that becomes the sphere of activity is realized simultaneously.

original: smras pa yang zhes pa /
analyzed: smras pa yang zhes pa /
translated: The word “also”

original: spyod yul las log par rtogs pa sel zhing rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid de kho na gzhung 'dzugs te /
analyzed: spyod yul las log par rtogs pa sel zhing rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid de kho na gzhung 'dzugs te /
translated: refutes the realization that turns away from the sphere of activity and establishes the very absence of conceptual thought as the text.

original: chos can gcig min ngo bo ni //
analyzed: chos can gcig min ngo bo ni //
translated: The nature of a single phenomenon is not🔽.

original: zhes so // don gzhan las log pa la brten pas gang chos kyi bye brag tha dad brtags pa spyi'i ngo bo shes bya nyid la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: zhes so // don gzhan las log pa la brten pas gang chos kyi bye brag tha dad brtags pa spyi'i ngo bo shes bya nyid la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: The nature of a universal, which is imagined to be a different category of phenomena, is based on the exclusion of other objects, such as the knowable itself.

original: de la ltos pas du ma'i ngo bo zhes brjod kyi /
analyzed: de la ltos pas du ma'i ngo bo zhes brjod kyi /
translated: It is called “the nature of the many” because it depends on that.

original: yang dngos por na gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos can 'di ni cha dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dngos por na gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos can 'di ni cha dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: However, in reality, this phenomenon, which has the characteristics of form and so on, does not have parts.🔽The divisions that are imagined in it are the objects of conceptual consciousnesses only, not of the other.

original: de'i brtags pa'i dbye ba de rnams rtog pa'i shes pa kho na'i yul yin gyi cig shos kyi yul ma yin no zhes ston pa gsungs /
analyzed: de'i brtags pa'i dbye ba de rnams rtog pa'i shes pa kho na'i yul yin gyi cig shos kyi yul ma yin no zhes ston pa gsungs /
translated: The statement that teaches this is:

original: dbang po las rtogs kun du min //
analyzed: dbang po las rtogs kun du min //
translated: All that is realized from the sense faculties is not universal.

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: Thus.🔽From the sense faculty means from the cause.

original: dbang po las zhes pa la rgyu la lnga pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po las zhes pa la rgyu la lnga pa'o //
translated: The fifth case is used for the cause.

original: lag pa phyis pa la yang na'o //
analyzed: lag pa phyis pa la yang na'o //
translated: The fifth case is also used for the object of the action of the hand.

original: dbang po'i rgyu las sam yang na dbang po thob par byas nas rnam pa thams cad du rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag gis 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dbang po'i rgyu las sam yang na dbang po thob par byas nas rnam pa thams cad du rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag gis 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It means that one does not apprehend in any way the universal and particular characteristics of the object, either from the cause of the sense faculty or from having obtained the sense faculty.🔽What is the object of that like?🔽It is said:🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.

original: 'o na de'i dmigs pa ci 'dra ba yin zhe na gsungs pa /🔽rang gis rig bya zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na de'i dmigs pa ci 'dra ba yin zhe na gsungs pa / rang gis rig bya zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.

original: rang gis rig par bya ba ni kun du 'gro ba can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rang gis rig par bya ba ni kun du 'gro ba can ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.

original: bstan bya min na brjod bya ma yin pa'o //🔽yang na rang gis rig bya zhes brjod pa la /🔽de'i rang bzhin ni ci yin ba brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: bstan bya min na brjod bya ma yin pa'o // yang na rang gis rig bya zhes brjod pa la / de'i rang bzhin ni ci yin ba brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an object of instruction, etc.

original: bstan bya min pa zhes pa ste /🔽bstan bya min pa nyid ni de'i shes pa dag ngo bo tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes sems so //
analyzed: bstan bya min pa zhes pa ste /🔽bstan bya min pa nyid ni de'i shes pa dag ngo bo tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes sems so //
translated: It is not an object of instruction, etc.🔽It is not an

original: de ltar ni gang sgra las byung ba'i shes ba dang gang dbang po las byung ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar ni gang sgra las byung ba'i shes ba dang gang dbang po las byung ba ste /
translated: The cognition that arises from the word and the cognition that arises from the sense faculty are different,

original: 'di dag gi so sor snang ba ni tha dad de gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽ji ltar dbang po'i bya ba @23a * //
analyzed: 'di dag gi so sor snang ba ni tha dad de gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid kyi phyir ro // ji ltar dbang po'i bya ba @23a * //
translated: because the first is clear and the second is not.

original: can la don gyi ngo bo dbang po'i shes pa la gsal ba'i rnam pas so sor snang ba de ltar ni sgra las byung ba la med de /
analyzed: can la don gyi ngo bo dbang po'i shes pa la gsal ba'i rnam pas so sor snang ba de ltar ni sgra las byung ba la med de /
translated: The object is not perceived in the same way by the cognition that arises from the word as it is perceived by the cognition that arises from the sense faculty.🔽The object is perceived by the cognition that arises from the sense faculty in the form in which it presents itself, that is, in the form of a clear image.🔽But this is not the case for the cognition that arises from the word.

original: gal te dbang po'i spyod yul kho na bstan par bya bar 'gyur na sgra las byung ba la yang de lta kho nar so sor snang bar 'gyur na de ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te dbang po'i spyod yul kho na bstan par bya bar 'gyur na sgra las byung ba la yang de lta kho nar so sor snang bar 'gyur na de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: If the object of the sense faculty were to be indicated, then the cognition that arises from the word would perceive it in the same way as the cognition that arises from the sense faculty.🔽But this is not the case.

original: gang sgra las byung ba la snang ba ma yin pa de ni sgra don yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang sgra las byung ba la snang ba ma yin pa de ni sgra don yang ma yin no //
translated: What is not perceived by the cognition that arises from the word is not the meaning of the word.

original: de'i phyir tshul tha dad pa'i shes pa'i gzung bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir dkar po nyid la sogs pa tha snyad kyis bstan bya ni dbang po'i yul ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshul tha dad pa'i shes pa'i gzung bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir dkar po nyid la sogs pa tha snyad kyis bstan bya ni dbang po'i yul ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, because of being the object of a consciousness that has a different mode of apprehension, white color and so on are not objects of the sense faculties, as they are conventionally taught.

original: gang gang las tha dad pa'i tshul can gyi shes pa'i gzung bya de ni de ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gang gang las tha dad pa'i tshul can gyi shes pa'i gzung bya de ni de ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: Whatever is the object of a consciousness that has a different mode of apprehension is not that.

original: dper na rta las tha dad pa'i shes pa'i gzung bar bya ba ma he bzhin /
analyzed: dper na rta las tha dad pa'i shes pa'i gzung bar bya ba ma he bzhin /
translated: For example, like a buffalo, which is the object of a consciousness that has a different mode of apprehension from a horse.

original: sgra'i yul dkar po nyid la sogs pa la'ang /
analyzed: sgra'i yul dkar po nyid la sogs pa la'ang /
translated: With respect to the object of sound, white color and so on,

original: dbang po'i yul las tha dad pa'i tshul can gyi shes pa'i gzung bya yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i yul las tha dad pa'i tshul can gyi shes pa'i gzung bya yin no //
translated: it is the object of a consciousness that has a different mode of apprehension from the object of the sense faculties.

original: khyab byed dang 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: khyab byed dang 'gal ba'o //
translated: The pervasion and the contradictory

original: de ltar 'gyur mod kyi dbang po'i shes pa'i rten ni mig la sogs pa dang / sgra las byung ba'i ni yin te /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur mod kyi dbang po'i shes pa'i rten ni mig la sogs pa dang / sgra las byung ba'i ni yin te /
translated: . It may be so, but the basis of the sense consciousnesses is the eye and so on, and the basis of the consciousness arisen from sound is the ear.

original: de'i phyir rten tha dad pa las yul gcig pa nyid na yang /
analyzed: de'i phyir rten tha dad pa las yul gcig pa nyid na yang /
translated: Therefore, even though the basis is different and the object is the same,

original: de dag gi snang ba tha dad pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi snang ba tha dad pa'o zhe na /
translated: their appearance is different.

original: gal te de lta na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na /
translated: If that is so,🔽then the object of the sense consciousnesses and the object of the consciousness arisen from sound would be different.

original: ci ltar da ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams don tha dad pa zhes khyed cag la nges /
analyzed: ci ltar da ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams don tha dad pa zhes khyed cag la nges /
translated: How do you know that eye consciousness and so on have different objects?

original: der yang de rnams kyi yul gcig kho na yin la snang ba tha dad pa ni rten gyi dbye ba las so zhes brjod par nus pas so //
analyzed: der yang de rnams kyi yul gcig kho na yin la snang ba tha dad pa ni rten gyi dbye ba las so zhes brjod par nus pas so //
translated: You can say that they have the same object, but their appearance is different because of the difference in their supports.

original: gal te don gyi rnam pa 'ga' zhig gi rjes su byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te don gyi rnam pa 'ga' zhig gi rjes su byed pa'i phyir /
translated: If you say that because they conform to the aspect of some object,

original: sgra las byung ba kho na'i yul gcig nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: sgra las byung ba kho na'i yul gcig nyid yin zhing /
translated: the object of auditory consciousness alone is one,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
translated: but the object of eye consciousness and so on is not,

original: de rnams ni phan tshun don gyi rnam pa ci'i yang rjes su byed pa med pas so zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams ni phan tshun don gyi rnam pa ci'i yang rjes su byed pa med pas so zhe na /
translated: because they do not conform to the aspect of any object.

original: ma yin te de la yang shes bya nyid la sogs pa rjes su byed pa nyid yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ma yin te de la yang shes bya nyid la sogs pa rjes su byed pa nyid yod pa kho na'o //
translated: That is not so, because they also conform to the object of knowledge and so on.

original: gal te sgra las byung ba dang dbang po'i shes pa dag yul gcig ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te sgra las byung ba dang dbang po'i shes pa dag yul gcig ma yin na /
translated: If auditory consciousness and sense consciousnesses do not have the same object,

original: gang lkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa de ba lang ngo zhes nye bar bstan pa las ba las rtogs nas phyis gsal ba'i khyad par mthong ba pos /🔽gang 'di ni bdag gis thos pa'o //
analyzed: gang lkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa de ba lang ngo zhes nye bar bstan pa las ba las rtogs nas phyis gsal ba'i khyad par mthong ba pos / gang 'di ni bdag gis thos pa'o //
translated: One who has understood a cow through the words “that which possesses a dewlap and so on” later sees the specific features of a cow and thinks, “This is a cow.”🔽But how could one think, “This is what I heard,”

original: 'di ni 'di'o zhes pa 'di lta bur ci ltar rtogs /
analyzed: 'di ni 'di'o zhes pa 'di lta bur ci ltar rtogs /
translated: or “This is that”?🔽When one says “Bring the cow,” how could one engage the object of the sense faculty?

original: ba lang 'on cig ces brjod pa na dbang po'i yul kho na la yang ci ltar 'jug / gzhan nye bar dmigs pa dang ldan @23b pas gzhan la de kho na 'di'o zhes rtogs par 'gyur ba ni med cing /
analyzed: ba lang 'on cig ces brjod pa na dbang po'i yul kho na la yang ci ltar 'jug / gzhan nye bar dmigs pa dang ldan @23b pas gzhan la de kho na 'di'o zhes rtogs par 'gyur ba ni med cing /
translated: It is not that one understands another object through apprehending another object.

original: gzhan la skul ba na gzhan du 'jug pa rigs pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan la skul ba na gzhan du 'jug pa rigs pa yang ma yin la /
translated: It is also illogical to engage another object when one is urged to bring another object.

original: sgra las dbang po'i yul la de ltar rtog pa dang 'jug par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgra las dbang po'i yul la de ltar rtog pa dang 'jug par yang 'gyur te /
translated: One would engage the object of the sense faculty through the word.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi yul gcig pa'o zhes pa'i rtog pa gang de yang rigs pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi yul gcig pa'o zhes pa'i rtog pa gang de yang rigs pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: Therefore the thought that the objects of those two are the same is illogical.

original: de kho na nyid rnam par dpyod par byed pa'i 'chad pa po rnams ni yul rnam par dbye ba 'di lta bu byed kyi /
analyzed: de kho na nyid rnam par dpyod par byed pa'i 'chad pa po rnams ni yul rnam par dbye ba 'di lta bu byed kyi /
translated: The commentators who analyze reality make this kind of distinction of objects.

original: tha snyad byed pa po rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tha snyad byed pa po rnams ni ma yin te /
translated: But those who make conventional expressions do not.

original: de rnams ni de kho na nyid du lhag par zhen pas snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don dag gcig tu byas nas tha snyad du byed do zhes pa shin tu 'phros par byed do //
analyzed: de rnams ni de kho na nyid du lhag par zhen pas snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don dag gcig tu byas nas tha snyad du byed do zhes pa shin tu 'phros par byed do //
translated: They make conventional expressions by taking the objects that appear and are to be imagined as one, because they are attached to reality.

original: de ltar rang gis rig par bya ba bstan bya min pa'i ngo bo ni mngon sum gyi yul te /
analyzed: de ltar rang gis rig par bya ba bstan bya min pa'i ngo bo ni mngon sum gyi yul te /
translated: Thus, the nature of the object of perception is not to be indicated as the object of self-awareness.

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu la rtog pa 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu la rtog pa 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not that conceptual cognition engages in an object of this kind.

original: de ni sgra dang yul gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa yul nges par bstan pas kyang mngon sum rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid du gzhung btsugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni sgra dang yul gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa yul nges par bstan pas kyang mngon sum rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid du gzhung btsugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is the same object as the word, the object is ascertained by indication, and thus perception is established as non-conceptual.

original: 'o na da ni mngon sum ma nges pa'i bdag nyid la ci ltar tha snyad du 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na da ni mngon sum ma nges pa'i bdag nyid la ci ltar tha snyad du 'gyur /
translated: But now, how can perception, which has an uncertain nature, be conventional?

original: 'di nyid do zhes nges pas ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi sgrub byed dag thob pa dang spong ba'i ched du rab tu 'jug pas so zhe na /
analyzed: 'di nyid do zhes nges pas ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi sgrub byed dag thob pa dang spong ba'i ched du rab tu 'jug pas so zhe na /
translated: “This is it” is ascertained by the memory that arises from the power of the experience of direct perception, and then one engages in the means of obtaining pleasure and avoiding pain.

original: skyon 'di ni med de mngon sum don la lta ba tsam yin na yang mngon sum gyis nyams su myong bas gzhag pa'i mthu las byung ba'i dran pa sngon du 'gro ba'i mngon par 'dod pa dang cig shos dag gis tha snyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyon 'di ni med de mngon sum don la lta ba tsam yin na yang mngon sum gyis nyams su myong bas gzhag pa'i mthu las byung ba'i dran pa sngon du 'gro ba'i mngon par 'dod pa dang cig shos dag gis tha snyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: This fault does not exist, because even though the direct perception is merely seeing the object, the memory that arises from the power of the experience of direct perception is preceded by the memory that is the seed of the very clear experience, and then the desired and the other become conventions.

original: 'di ni dngos po'i chos te /
analyzed: 'di ni dngos po'i chos te /
translated: This is the nature of things.

original: gang nyams su myong ba shin tu gsal ba dran pa'i sa bon 'jog cing ji lta bu'i bde ba'i sgrub par byed pa'am sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa nyams su myong pa de 'dra ba mthong ba las /
analyzed: gang nyams su myong ba shin tu gsal ba dran pa'i sa bon 'jog cing ji lta bu'i bde ba'i sgrub par byed pa'am sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa nyams su myong pa de 'dra ba mthong ba las /
translated: When the very clear experience of pleasure or pain is deposited as the seed of memory, one sees the experience of that kind of pleasure or pain.

original: 'di sad par gyur pa na de kho na 'di'o zhes dran par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di sad par gyur pa na de kho na 'di'o zhes dran par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one awakens from that, one remembers, “That is it.”

original: de las mngon par 'dod pa dang cig shos dag gis gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: de las mngon par 'dod pa dang cig shos dag gis gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: From that, the desired and the other become conventions.

original: de las kyang skyes bu'i ji ltar 'os par 'jug pa'o zhes pa'o //🔽de ltar re zhig ces pa la sogs pa ni mjug bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: de las kyang skyes bu'i ji ltar 'os par 'jug pa'o zhes pa'o // de ltar re zhig ces pa la sogs pa ni mjug bsdu ba ste /
translated: Thus, it is said.🔽Thus, it is said.🔽Thus, it is said.🔽Thus, it is said.🔽Thus, it is said.🔽Thus, it is said.🔽Thus, it is said.🔽Thus, it is said.🔽Thus, it is said.

original: 'dir de ltar re zhig dbang po lnga las skyes pa zhes pa'i tshig las /🔽re zhig gi sgras dbang po lnga las skyes pa ma yin pa gzhan yang yod la /🔽de'i yang mtshan nyid kyi khyad par logs su @24a * //
analyzed: 'dir de ltar re zhig dbang po lnga las skyes pa zhes pa'i tshig las / re zhig gi sgras dbang po lnga las skyes pa ma yin pa gzhan yang yod la / de'i yang mtshan nyid kyi khyad par logs su @24a * //

original: 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes pa 'di gsal bar byas so //🔽de thams cad kyang rtog pa med pa kho na'o zhes 'thad pa'i sgo kho nar yongs su rtogs par byas so //🔽des na mkhas pa'i blo gros can 'ga' zhig gi rtsod pa dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes pa 'di gsal bar byas so // de thams cad kyang rtog pa med pa kho na'o zhes 'thad pa'i sgo kho nar yongs su rtogs par byas so // des na mkhas pa'i blo gros can 'ga' zhig gi rtsod pa dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it is said.

original: de la 'di ni rtsod pa ste /🔽'o na mngon sum gyi dbye ba 'di rnams thams cad rnam par rtog pa med pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: de la 'di ni rtsod pa ste /🔽'o na mngon sum gyi dbye ba 'di rnams thams cad rnam par rtog pa med pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: Thus, it is said

original: de'i phyir yang mngon sum rtog pa dang bral ba zhes pa 'di kho nas bsdus te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang mngon sum rtog pa dang bral ba zhes pa 'di kho nas bsdus te /
translated: Therefore, it is included in this alone, “direct perception free from conceptuality.”

original: de ltar ni 'thad pa'i sogs 'di rnams kyi mtshan nyid tha dad par byas so //
analyzed: de ltar ni 'thad pa'i sogs 'di rnams kyi mtshan nyid tha dad par byas so //
translated: In this way, the characteristics of these, “correct,” etc., are made different.

original: des na 'dir mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba tha dad pa 'di logs su brjod par bya ba ci'i don du yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des na 'dir mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba tha dad pa 'di logs su brjod par bya ba ci'i don du yin zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, what is the purpose of stating this difference in characteristics here?

original: de'i phyir 'di'i lan glan pa'i ched du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di'i lan glan pa'i ched du gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, in order to answer this, he says,

original: 'dir khyad par na gzhan gyi 'dod pa la ltos pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir khyad par na gzhan gyi 'dod pa la ltos pa zhes pa'o //
translated: “Here, the difference depends on the assertions of others.”

original: khyad par dang bye brag dang dbye ba zhes pa ni rnam grangs so //
analyzed: khyad par dang bye brag dang dbye ba zhes pa ni rnam grangs so //
translated: “Difference,” “distinction,” and “division” are synonyms.

original: de yang skabs nyid kyi phyir mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid kyi zhes rtogs par bya'o//
analyzed: de yang skabs nyid kyi phyir mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid kyi zhes rtogs par bya'o//
translated: Moreover, because of the context, it should be understood as “the characteristic of direct perception.”

original: 'dir zhes pa ni rab tu byed par ro //
analyzed: 'dir zhes pa ni rab tu byed par ro //
translated: “Here” refers to the treatise.

original: gang 'di mtshan nyid kyi khyad par log pa de ni gzhan rnams kyis log par rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang 'dod pa de la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'di mtshan nyid kyi khyad par log pa de ni gzhan rnams kyis log par rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang 'dod pa de la ltos pa'o //
translated: That which is the opposite of the characteristic is dependent on the characteristic that is asserted by others as the opposite.

original: de la yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i mngon sum la dbang po'i shes pas nyams su myong ba'i don de kho na 'dzin no zhes 'ga' zhig log par rtogs so //
analyzed: de la yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i mngon sum la dbang po'i shes pas nyams su myong ba'i don de kho na 'dzin no zhes 'ga' zhig log par rtogs so //
translated: Some have the misconception that the direct perception of the mental consciousness apprehends only the object experienced by the sense consciousness.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rang rig pa de med de zhes so //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rang rig pa de med de zhes so //
translated: There is no self-awareness of attachment and so on.

original: rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa la yang 'di kho nar ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa la yang 'di kho nar ro //
translated: It is also like this for the consciousness of a yogi.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar gzhan rnams kyi log par rtogs pa de'i phyir de la ltos pas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar gzhan rnams kyi log par rtogs pa de'i phyir de la ltos pas /
translated: Because of this misconception of others,

original: mngon sum rtog pa dang bral bas //🔽ces pa 'dis bsdus kyang dbang po lnga las skyes pa ma yin pa'i mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid kyi khyad par log par brjod de gzhan gyi log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i ched du'o zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum rtog pa dang bral bas // ces pa 'dis bsdus kyang dbang po lnga las skyes pa ma yin pa'i mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid kyi khyad par log par brjod de gzhan gyi log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i ched du'o zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
translated: direct perception is free from conceptuality.🔽This is stated in order to eliminate the misconception of others, who say that direct perception is not produced from the five sense faculties.

original: gzhan rnams ni gang las khyad par 'di byed pa dbang po lnga las skyes pa rtog pa dang bcas pa yang yod dam ci zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: gzhan rnams ni gang las khyad par 'di byed pa dbang po lnga las skyes pa rtog pa dang bcas pa yang yod dam ci zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Others ask, “Why is this distinction made? Is there any direct perception that is produced from the five sense faculties and is also conceptual?”

original: gzhan gyi 'dod pa la ltos pa 'ang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'dod pa la ltos pa 'ang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: “In dependence on the assertions of others” and so on.

original: gzhan rnams dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pa 'ga' zhig rtog pa dang bcas pa ste gang tha snyad la byang ba'i'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pa 'ga' zhig rtog pa dang bcas pa ste gang tha snyad la byang ba'i'o //
translated: Some assert that some consciousnesses arisen from the sense faculties are conceptual, that is, those of those who are skilled in conventions.🔽Some assert that some are nonconceptual, that is, those of the opposite type.

original: 'ga' zhig rtog pa med pa ste gang cig shos kyi'o zhes 'dod pa de'i phyir de la ltos pas rtog pa dang bral ba @24b zhes pa 'dir dbang po'i shes pa'i khyad par te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig rtog pa med pa ste gang cig shos kyi'o zhes 'dod pa de'i phyir de la ltos pas rtog pa dang bral ba @24b zhes pa 'dir dbang po'i shes pa'i khyad par te /
translated: Therefore, in dependence on that, the qualification “free from conceptuality” is stated here in order to distinguish sense consciousnesses.

original: pha rol gyis yongs su brtags pa dbang po'i shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa rnam par gcad par bya ba'i don du'o zhes rnam par 'chad do //
analyzed: pha rol gyis yongs su brtags pa dbang po'i shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa rnam par gcad par bya ba'i don du'o zhes rnam par 'chad do //
translated: It is explained that the purpose of this is to exclude the sense consciousnesses imagined by others, which are conceptual.

original: de rnams kyi ltar na gal te gzhan gyi 'dod pa la ltos pas khyad par 'di brjod pa yin na /
analyzed: de rnams kyi ltar na gal te gzhan gyi 'dod pa la ltos pas khyad par 'di brjod pa yin na /
translated: According to them, if this distinction is stated in dependence on the assertions of others,

original: de ltar gyur na gzhan gyi 'dod pa la ltos pa'i khyad par 'di bya ba ma yin pa na /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na gzhan gyi 'dod pa la ltos pa'i khyad par 'di bya ba ma yin pa na /
translated: then this distinction in dependence on the assertions of others should not be made.

original: rang gi lugs kyi mtshan nyid ma brjod pa kho nar 'gyur la /
analyzed: rang gi lugs kyi mtshan nyid ma brjod pa kho nar 'gyur la /
translated: It would only be the case that the definition of perception in our system is not stated.

original: de las kyang mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid cir 'gyur /
analyzed: de las kyang mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid cir 'gyur /
translated: And what would be the definition of perception?

original: rtsod pa 'di yang mnyam par ma bzhag par 'gyur ro zhes pa 'di ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: rtsod pa 'di yang mnyam par ma bzhag par 'gyur ro zhes pa 'di ni mi rigs so //
translated: This dispute would also be non-meditative. This is unreasonable.

original: thams cad ni rnam par rtog pa med pa kho na'o zhes pa'i ni'i sgras mtshan nyid kyi khyad par log par brjod pa 'di rang gi lugs la ltos pa ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad ni rnam par rtog pa med pa kho na'o zhes pa'i ni'i sgras mtshan nyid kyi khyad par log par brjod pa 'di rang gi lugs la ltos pa ma yin te /
translated: The word “only” in “all are non-conceptual” expresses the negation of the distinction of definition, which is not dependent on our system.

original: log par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir zhes pa'i don gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: log par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir zhes pa'i don gsal bar byed do //
translated: The meaning of “because there is no misconception” is clarified.

original: mngon sum rtog pa dang bral ba zhes pa'i khyad par 'di kho nas mtshon bya thams cad bsdus so //
analyzed: mngon sum rtog pa dang bral ba zhes pa'i khyad par 'di kho nas mtshon bya thams cad bsdus so //
translated: This distinction alone, “perception is free from conceptuality,” includes all that is to be defined.

original: yid kyang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
