analyzed: yid kyang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The word “also” in “mind also” and so on.

original: kyang gi sgra ni bsdu pa'i don //
analyzed: kyang gi sgra ni bsdu pa'i don //
translated: The word “also” has the meaning of inclusion.

original: don gyi sgra 'di ni shes bya'i rnam grangs so //🔽'dod chags la sogs pa rnams kyi rang ni /
analyzed: don gyi sgra 'di ni shes bya'i rnam grangs so // 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams kyi rang ni /
translated: This word “object” is a synonym of knowable.🔽The nature of attachment and so on is

original: chags la sogs /
analyzed: chags la sogs /
translated: attachment and so on.

original: rang ngo // rang gi sgra 'di ni bdag nyid rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang ngo // rang gi sgra 'di ni bdag nyid rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: “One’s own nature” means one’s own nature.

original: don dang chags pa sogs rang ngo //
analyzed: don dang chags pa sogs rang ngo //
translated: The term “one’s own” indicates that it is one’s own nature.

original: de rig pa ni don dang chags la sogs rang rig pa ste /
analyzed: de rig pa ni don dang chags la sogs rang rig pa ste /
translated: “The awareness of that” means the awareness of one’s own nature, which is the awareness of the object, attachment, etc.

original: 'dis rig par bya shes par bya zhes pa rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis rig par bya shes par bya zhes pa rig pa'o //
translated: “This is to be known” means that it is to be known.

original: rig pa ni so sor mngon par sbrel lo //
analyzed: rig pa ni so sor mngon par sbrel lo //
translated: “Awareness” is to be connected with each of the terms.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i yid de ni mngon sum mo //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i yid de ni mngon sum mo //
translated: The nonconceptual mind is direct perception.

original: de la yid kyi rnam par shes pa dbang pos gzung ba kho na'i don 'dzin nam /
analyzed: de la yid kyi rnam par shes pa dbang pos gzung ba kho na'i don 'dzin nam /
translated: With regard to that, is the mental consciousness that apprehends only the object that is grasped by the sense faculty?

original: de las gzhan pa'o zhes pa brtags pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'o zhes pa brtags pa gnyis te /
translated: Or is it different from that? There are two alternatives.

original: gal te dang po yin na de las de tshad ma nyid ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te dang po yin na de las de tshad ma nyid ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: If it is the first, then it is not a valid cognition.

original: bzung zin pa 'dzin pa'i phyir dran pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bzung zin pa 'dzin pa'i phyir dran pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it grasps what has already been grasped, like memory, etc.

original: 'on te gnyis pa yin na de'i tshe long ba la sogs pas kyang don 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te gnyis pa yin na de'i tshe long ba la sogs pas kyang don 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the second, then even the blind would grasp objects.

original: gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pa dbang po'i shes pa la ltos pa med par phyi rol gyi don la rab tu 'jug na de'i tshe mig la sogs pa ma tshang bas kyang mthong ba thob bo //
analyzed: gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pa dbang po'i shes pa la ltos pa med par phyi rol gyi don la rab tu 'jug na de'i tshe mig la sogs pa ma tshang bas kyang mthong ba thob bo //
translated: If mental consciousness engages external objects without depending on sense consciousness, then even when the eyes, etc. are absent, one would obtain seeing, etc.

original: de ci 'dra ba yin pa de brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de ci 'dra ba yin pa de brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: What is it like? That should be stated.

original: yid kyang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yid kyang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The mind, etc.🔽are also forms, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yang de rnams yin @25a * //🔽la yul rnams kyang ngo zhes pa las 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yang de rnams yin @25a * // la yul rnams kyang ngo zhes pa las 'dzin pa'o //
translated: and are objects.

original: 'o na gzugs la sogs pa rnams yul kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na gzugs la sogs pa rnams yul kho na ma yin nam /
translated: Aren’t forms, etc. only objects?

original: yul smos pa de ci'i don yin zhe na /
analyzed: yul smos pa de ci'i don yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of mentioning objects?

original: dmigs bzhin pa min pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnam par bcad pa'i don du ste /
analyzed: dmigs bzhin pa min pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnam par bcad pa'i don du ste /
translated: The meaning is to exclude forms, etc. that are not being observed.

original: rnam par shes par bya bzhin pa ma yin pa rnams yul du 'gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes par bya bzhin pa ma yin pa rnams yul du 'gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: Those that are not being cognized do not become objects.

original: nye bar btags pas de'i rigs can nyid kyis yul gyi tha snyad du bstan par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: nye bar btags pas de'i rigs can nyid kyis yul gyi tha snyad du bstan par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Since they are imputed as being of that type, they are taught as objects by convention.

original: yul dngos nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yul dngos nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not actual objects.

original: yang de rnams ci'i yul zhe na /
analyzed: yang de rnams ci'i yul zhe na /
translated: Moreover, what is the object of those?

original: de ma thag pa dbang po'i shes pa'i ste /
analyzed: de ma thag pa dbang po'i shes pa'i ste /
translated: It is the object of the immediately preceding sense consciousness.

original: skabs nyid kyi phyir de kho na'i'o //
analyzed: skabs nyid kyi phyir de kho na'i'o //
translated: Because it is the context, it is the object of that.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams kyi rnam par 'gyur pa ni /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams kyi rnam par 'gyur pa ni /
translated: The transformation of the objects such as form

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi rnam 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi rnam 'gyur ro //
translated: is the transformation of the objects such as form.

original: de gang gi dmigs pa yin pa de ni de skad bshad do //
analyzed: de gang gi dmigs pa yin pa de ni de skad bshad do //
translated: That which is the object of that is explained in that way.

original: tshogs pa dang rnam 'gyur dang drug pa'i yang 'bru mang po pa ste /
analyzed: tshogs pa dang rnam 'gyur dang drug pa'i yang 'bru mang po pa ste /
translated: The plural particle is added to the six, such as the collection and the transformation.

original: tshig phyi ma dbyi ba yang ngo zhes pa'i tshig las tshig sdud dang / tshig phyi ma dbyi ba yang ste /
analyzed: tshig phyi ma dbyi ba yang ngo zhes pa'i tshig las tshig sdud dang / tshig phyi ma dbyi ba yang ste /
translated: The word “also” is added to the word “omitting the latter,” and the plural particle is added to the word “omitting the latter.”

original: dper na gser gyi rgyan zhes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gser gyi rgyan zhes pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the word “golden ornament.”

original: gang des bskyed pa'i skad cig phyi ma'i khyad par de de'i rnam par 'gyur ba zhes tha snyad kyi bya ba yul gyi rnam par 'gyur ba de ci zhe na /
analyzed: gang des bskyed pa'i skad cig phyi ma'i khyad par de de'i rnam par 'gyur ba zhes tha snyad kyi bya ba yul gyi rnam par 'gyur ba de ci zhe na /
translated: The transformation of the object of the activity of convention is the difference in the subsequent moment generated by that.

original: chos can gnas pa la chos gzhan ldog pa na /
analyzed: chos can gnas pa la chos gzhan ldog pa na /
translated: When another attribute ceases in a persisting subject,

original: chos gzhan gsal bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chos gzhan gsal bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: another attribute does not become manifest.

original: grangs can gyis yongs su brtags pa'i yongs su 'gyur ba bkag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: grangs can gyis yongs su brtags pa'i yongs su 'gyur ba bkag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the transformation imagined by the Sāṃkhya has been refuted.

original: des na 'di skad brjod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na 'di skad brjod par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, this is said:

original: dbang po'i shes pa'i yul las skyes pa de ma thag pa'i gzugs la sogs pa skad cig dmigs pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa'i yul las skyes pa de ma thag pa'i gzugs la sogs pa skad cig dmigs pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: “The object of the sense consciousness arises from the immediately preceding form, etc., and is the object of the momentariness.”

original: 'dis ni tshad ma nyid ma yin pa'i skyon spangs so //
analyzed: 'dis ni tshad ma nyid ma yin pa'i skyon spangs so //
translated: By this, the fault of not being a valid means of knowledge is avoided.

original: yang ci'i phyir de'i yul nges pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir de'i yul nges pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: Again, why is its object ascertained?

original: gang gi phyir de'i gang de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi khyad par de ni rang gi yul gyis nye bar bskyed pa de ma thag pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i skad cig gi lhan cig byed pa can kho nas de skyed par byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i gang de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi khyad par de ni rang gi yul gyis nye bar bskyed pa de ma thag pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i skad cig gi lhan cig byed pa can kho nas de skyed par byed do //
translated: Because that which is its immediately preceding condition, that particular form, etc., generated by its own object, is the co-operating cause of the momentariness of the immediately preceding form, etc., and it is produced by that alone.

original: de'i phyir de ji skad bshad pa kho na'i yul dang ldan pa'o zhes rtogs par gyis shig / nyams su myong ba'i rnam pas 'jug pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ji skad bshad pa kho na'i yul dang ldan pa'o zhes rtogs par gyis shig / nyams su myong ba'i rnam pas 'jug pa zhes pa ste /
translated: Therefore, understand that it has the object as explained. “Engaging by the aspect of experience” means:

original: 'dis nyams su myong bar bya'o zhes pa nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis nyams su myong bar bya'o zhes pa nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: “This is experienced” is experience.

original: rnam pa ni snang pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa ni snang pa'o //
translated: “Aspect” is appearance.

original: de yang gang dran pa la sogs pa rnams kyi nyams su myong ba'i tshul can ma yin pa yang yod do zhes pas de @25b rnam par bcad pa'i ched du nyams su myong pa smos so //
analyzed: de yang gang dran pa la sogs pa rnams kyi nyams su myong ba'i tshul can ma yin pa yang yod do zhes pas de @25b rnam par bcad pa'i ched du nyams su myong pa smos so //
translated: Moreover, there is an experience that is not of the nature of memory, etc. Therefore, in order to eliminate that, experience is mentioned.

original: gang gi nyams su myong ba rnam pa yin pa de de skad brjod do //
analyzed: gang gi nyams su myong ba rnam pa yin pa de de skad brjod do //
translated: That which has experience as its aspect is so described.

original: de yang ci zhe na sngar bshad pa'i rigs pas dbang po'i shes pa kho na ste nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa des zhugs shing skyes pa ni nyams su myong ba'i rnam par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang ci zhe na sngar bshad pa'i rigs pas dbang po'i shes pa kho na ste nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa des zhugs shing skyes pa ni nyams su myong ba'i rnam par zhugs pa'o //
translated: What is that? It is only the sense consciousness, as previously explained by reasoning. That which is engaged in, or arisen from, the aspect of experience is engaged in the aspect of experience.

original: 'di skad brjod par 'gyur te dbang po'i shes pa'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen las skyes pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di skad brjod par 'gyur te dbang po'i shes pa'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen las skyes pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: This is what is said: It arises from the condition of the immediately preceding sense consciousness.

original: 'dis kyang long ba la sogs pas kyang don 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes gang brjod pa de bsal to //
analyzed: 'dis kyang long ba la sogs pas kyang don 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes gang brjod pa de bsal to //
translated: This also eliminates the claim that the blind, etc., would apprehend objects.

original: gang gi phyir de phyi rol gyi don rnams la rang dbang du 'jug pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de phyi rol gyi don rnams la rang dbang du 'jug pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Because it does not operate independently with regard to external objects.

original: 'on kyang dbang po'i rkyen la ltos la /
analyzed: 'on kyang dbang po'i rkyen la ltos la /
translated: But rather, it depends on the condition of the sense faculty.

original: long pa la sogs pa la yang dbang po'i shes pa med do zhes pas de med do //
analyzed: long pa la sogs pa la yang dbang po'i shes pa med do zhes pas de med do //
translated: And because the sense consciousness does not exist for the blind, etc., it does not exist.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams la yang rang rig pa'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams la yang rang rig pa'o zhes pa ste /
translated: And with regard to desire, etc., it is reflexive awareness.

original: rang nyid la rig pa ni rang rig go //
analyzed: rang nyid la rig pa ni rang rig go //
translated: It is reflexive awareness because it is aware of itself.

original: 'dis rig par bya bas na rig pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis rig par bya bas na rig pa ste /
translated: It is awareness because it is that which is to be known by this.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par yang dag par bshad pa nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par yang dag par bshad pa nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of the experience of the apprehension of the aspect.

original: nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid kyis rab tu gsal ba rnams bdag nyid yang dag par rig par byed de /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid kyis rab tu gsal ba rnams bdag nyid yang dag par rig par byed de /
translated: Because it is the nature of experience, desire, etc., which are clearly manifest by the nature of experience, are themselves known by themselves.

original: bdag nyid rig pa zhes kyang bstan par bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: bdag nyid rig pa zhes kyang bstan par bya ba rnams so //
translated: They are also taught to be self-awareness.

original: de'i phyir nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid de ni 'di rnams kyi tshad ma'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid de ni 'di rnams kyi tshad ma'o //
translated: Therefore, that which has the nature of experience is the valid cognition of these.

original: gang yang rig pa dngos po'i ngo bo rang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid de ni de'i 'bras bur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gang yang rig pa dngos po'i ngo bo rang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid de ni de'i 'bras bur rig par bya ste /
translated: And that which is the awareness of the nature of entities, having the nature of self-realization, should be known as the result of that.

original: bdag nyid ni de rnams kyi gzhal bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid ni de rnams kyi gzhal bya'o //
translated: The self is the object of comprehension of those.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa smos pa ni gsal ba'i rig pa bstan pa'i don te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa smos pa ni gsal ba'i rig pa bstan pa'i don te /
translated: The mention of desire, etc. is for the purpose of teaching manifest awareness.

original: shes pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid rig pa ni mngon sum yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid rig pa ni mngon sum yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because awareness, which is the nature of all consciousnesses, is itself direct perception.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid ni de la brda mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid ni de la brda mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is non-conceptual because it is incapable of communicating that.

original: yul du byas pa la brda byed par nus shing /
analyzed: yul du byas pa la brda byed par nus shing /
translated: It is capable of communicating what is made into an object.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ma skyes pa ni rig pas yul du byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ma skyes pa ni rig pas yul du byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And that which is not born, having the nature of desire, etc., is not made into an object by awareness.

original: de yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis na ma skyes pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis na ma skyes pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: And that is because it is not born by the nature of having the nature of desire, etc.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bdag nyid skyes pa la yang rig pas brjod pa sbyor ba min te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bdag nyid skyes pa la yang rig pas brjod pa sbyor ba min te /
translated: Also, it is not that the application of expression by awareness is to the arising of the nature of attachment and so on,

original: de ltar ni des brjod pa bzung nas der sbyor bar byed cing /
analyzed: de ltar ni des brjod pa bzung nas der sbyor bar byed cing /
translated: because in that case, having apprehended the expression, one would apply it to that,

original: brjod pa zin pa na yang skad cig ma nyid kyi phyir @26a * //
analyzed: brjod pa zin pa na yang skad cig ma nyid kyi phyir @26a * //
translated: and when the expression is finished, it would be many moments.

original: de mang la chags pa la sogs pa rnams kyang med do zhes pas ci zhig ci zhig gis sbyor bar byed ces brda mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir chags pa la sogs pa rnams kyi rang rig ni brjod pa dang 'dres pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de mang la chags pa la sogs pa rnams kyang med do zhes pas ci zhig ci zhig gis sbyor bar byed ces brda mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir chags pa la sogs pa rnams kyi rang rig ni brjod pa dang 'dres pa ma yin no //
translated: Since attachment and so on do not exist, it is impossible to apply them to anything, and therefore the autocognition of attachment and so on is not mixed with expression.

original: gang gis gang la sgra'i brda mi 'dzin pa de ni de la sgra sbyar nas 'dzin par mi byed de /
analyzed: gang gis gang la sgra'i brda mi 'dzin pa de ni de la sgra sbyar nas 'dzin par mi byed de /
translated: One who does not apprehend the linguistic sign of something does not apprehend it by applying a word to it,

original: dper na dri la mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin /
analyzed: dper na dri la mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin /
translated: just as the eye consciousness does not apprehend smell.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bdag nyid la yang de yang dag par rig pas sgra'i brda ma bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bdag nyid la yang de yang dag par rig pas sgra'i brda ma bzung ba yin no //
translated: Also, one who is aware of the nature of attachment and so on does not apprehend the linguistic sign of a word.

original: rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The reason is nonobservation of a cause.

original: 'dir 'ga' zhig gzhi ma grub par smra bar byed de /
analyzed: 'dir 'ga' zhig gzhi ma grub par smra bar byed de /
translated: Here, some say that the object of knowledge does not exist.

original: de ltar ni rang rig par rtog pa med par bsgrub par bya na /
analyzed: de ltar ni rang rig par rtog pa med par bsgrub par bya na /
translated: In this way, if one establishes that there is no conception of reflexive awareness,

original: de yang re zhig shes pa la yang med na /
analyzed: de yang re zhig shes pa la yang med na /
translated: then, since it does not exist even in consciousness,

original: bde ba la sogs pa shes pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa rnams la ga la yin /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa shes pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa rnams la ga la yin /
translated: how could it exist in pleasure and so on, which are not the nature of consciousness?

original: de rnams ni bdag gcig pu la shes pa dang lhan cig 'du ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de rnams ni bdag gcig pu la shes pa dang lhan cig 'du ba'i phyir /
translated: They are the same nature as consciousness because they are included together with consciousness.

original: don gcig la 'du ba can des gzung bar bya ba'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: don gcig la 'du ba can des gzung bar bya ba'o zhes pa ste /
translated: They are the object of the apprehension of that which is included in the same object.

original: rang nyid gzhal bya'i ngo bo kho na'o //
analyzed: rang nyid gzhal bya'i ngo bo kho na'o //
translated: They are only the nature of the object of knowledge.

original: de'i phyir de rnams gzhan gyi yang rig par byed pa ma yin na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de rnams gzhan gyi yang rig par byed pa ma yin na /
translated: Therefore, if they are not the knower of that,

original: bdag nyid ga las yin zhe'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid ga las yin zhe'o //
translated: how could they be the knower of themselves?

original: de rnams kyis bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa de shes par gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyis bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa de shes par gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: One should definitely accept that they know the aspect of pleasure and so on,

original: gzhan du na de rnams de'i rig par bya ba kho nar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na de rnams de'i rig par bya ba kho nar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: otherwise they would not be the object of knowledge of that.

original: shes par 'dod pa nyid kho na don rnams kyi rig par byed par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shes par 'dod pa nyid kho na don rnams kyi rig par byed par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that consciousness itself, which is held to be the knower, is the knower of objects.

original: de ni thams cad la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni thams cad la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not different from all.

original: don thams cad 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don thams cad 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that all objects would be apprehended.

original: shes pa gang zhig gang gi rnam pa dang bral ba de ni de'i rig par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa gang zhig gang gi rnam pa dang bral ba de ni de'i rig par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: That consciousness which is devoid of the aspect of something is not the knower of that.

original: ba lang gi shes pa rta'i bzhin /
analyzed: ba lang gi shes pa rta'i bzhin /
translated: Like the consciousness of a cow is of a horse.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i shes pa yang bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i shes pa yang bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The consciousness of pleasure, etc. is devoid of the aspect of pleasure, etc.

original: khyab byed dang 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: khyab byed dang 'gal ba'o //
translated: It is contradictory to the pervader.

original: shes pa de'i rnam pa can du 'gyur mod /
analyzed: shes pa de'i rnam pa can du 'gyur mod /
translated: It would have the aspect of that consciousness.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What follows from that?

original: de las 'di ste /
analyzed: de las 'di ste /
translated: This follows from that.

original: gang dga' ba dang yongs su gdung ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa de kho na bde ba la sogs pa'o zhes bde ba la sogs pa shes pa'i ngo bor gyur bo //
analyzed: gang dga' ba dang yongs su gdung ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa de kho na bde ba la sogs pa'o zhes bde ba la sogs pa shes pa'i ngo bor gyur bo //
translated: That which has the aspect of pleasure, pain, etc. is just pleasure, etc. Thus, pleasure, etc. would be the nature of the consciousness of pleasure, etc.

original: dngos po tshim pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo can ni rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin par ni de rnams la yang grub ste /
analyzed: dngos po tshim pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo can ni rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin par ni de rnams la yang grub ste /
translated: The nature of the object, such as satisfaction, is established as the nature of the cognition.

original: de la shes pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes pa la sogs pa ming ji ltar 'dod par byos @26b shig /'di las bzlog pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: de la shes pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes pa la sogs pa ming ji ltar 'dod par byos @26b shig /'di las bzlog pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: You can call them whatever you like, such as consciousness, pleasure, pain, and so on, but there is nothing that is the opposite of this.

original: ji ltar shes pa'i tshim pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni shes pa med pa'i ngo bo bde ba la sogs pas byas par mi 'gyur ba de ltar gzhan du rtogs par byas zin te /
analyzed: ji ltar shes pa'i tshim pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni shes pa med pa'i ngo bo bde ba la sogs pas byas par mi 'gyur ba de ltar gzhan du rtogs par byas zin te /
translated: Just as the aspects of satisfaction and so on of consciousness are not produced by pleasure and so on that are not consciousness, we have already explained that this is the case with other objects.

original: 'dir ni gzhung mangs pa'i 'jigs pa las rab tu rgyas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni gzhung mangs pa'i 'jigs pa las rab tu rgyas par mi bya'o //
translated: Here, I will not elaborate further for fear of being long-winded.

original: gang zhig bde ba la sogs pa rnams ni nang ma yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig bde ba la sogs pa rnams ni nang ma yin la /
translated: Someone might say, “Pleasure and so on are not internal.

original: sems pa can yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sems pa can yang ma yin gyi /
translated: They are not mental states.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What are they then?

original: de las bzlog pa'i rang bzhin gzhal bya kho na'i zhes smra ba de'i yang /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i rang bzhin gzhal bya kho na'i zhes smra ba de'i yang /
translated: They are objects of knowledge that are the opposite of that.”

original: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis tshim pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa can rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos por grub cing /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis tshim pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa can rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos por grub cing /
translated: The nature of the self is established as the entity that is the realization of the aspects of satisfaction and so on, in the manner that has been explained.

original: de kho na yang rang rig pa'i mngon sum du brjod kyi /
analyzed: de kho na yang rang rig pa'i mngon sum du brjod kyi /
translated: And that reality is called “self-awareness” or “direct perception.”

original: de las gzhan pa'i bde ba la sogs pa gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i bde ba la sogs pa gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But pleasure and so on, which are imagined by others, are not.

original: rang rig pa de yang bsgrub bar 'gyur ro zhes pa rten ma grub pa med do //
analyzed: rang rig pa de yang bsgrub bar 'gyur ro zhes pa rten ma grub pa med do //
translated: And that self-awareness will be established.

original: 'o na shes pa thams cad kho na dang dbang po las skyes pa'i yang rten yod do zhes 'dod par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na shes pa thams cad kho na dang dbang po las skyes pa'i yang rten yod do zhes 'dod par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: But isn’t it accepted that all consciousnesses have a basis, and that they arise from the sense faculties?

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga rnams ni dbang po gnyis kyi rten can no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga rnams ni dbang po gnyis kyi rten can no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that the five collections of consciousness have a basis that is twofold.

original: de ci'i phyir 'di kho na yid las byung bar brjod par bya zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir 'di kho na yid las byung bar brjod par bya zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Why is it said that this [mind] alone arises from the mind?

original: dbang po la mi ltos pa'i phyir zhes pa ste gzugs can gyi dbang po la ltos pa med pa nyid kyi phyir zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po la mi ltos pa'i phyir zhes pa ste gzugs can gyi dbang po la ltos pa med pa nyid kyi phyir zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
translated: The intended meaning is that it is not dependent on a sense faculty, because it is not dependent on a physical sense faculty.

original: gang gi rten yid kho na yin gyi dbang po gzugs can ma yin pa de yid kyi mngon par brjod do //
analyzed: gang gi rten yid kho na yin gyi dbang po gzugs can ma yin pa de yid kyi mngon par brjod do //
translated: That which has only the mental faculty as its basis, not a physical sense faculty, is mental expression.

original: 'o na gang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po rnams dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa 'dod chags la sogs pa de rnams kyi rang rig pa ji ltar yid kyi mngon sum yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po rnams dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa 'dod chags la sogs pa de rnams kyi rang rig pa ji ltar yid kyi mngon sum yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is the reflexive awareness of the five collections of consciousness and the attachment and so on that are concomitant with them mental direct perception?

original: rang rig pa'i spyi bos de'i rigs can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i spyi bos de'i rigs can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the universal of reflexive awareness, it is a type of that.

original: yang dbang po la ltos pa med pa nyid na /
analyzed: yang dbang po la ltos pa med pa nyid na /
translated: Moreover, if it is not dependent on a sense faculty,

original: mngon sum gyi sgra ci ltar rigs she na /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi sgra ci ltar rigs she na /
translated: how is it tenable to call it direct perception?

original: ji tsam gyis dbang po'i rgyu mtshan can ni mngon sum du tha snyad bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji tsam gyis dbang po'i rgyu mtshan can ni mngon sum du tha snyad bya ba ste /
translated: Direct perception is conventionally designated to the extent that it is characterized by a sense faculty.

original: shes pa'i khyad par la yongs su bshad /
analyzed: shes pa'i khyad par la yongs su bshad /
translated: It is explained as a specific consciousness.

original: yod pa can ni ming 'di'o zhes pa 'di ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: yod pa can ni ming 'di'o zhes pa 'di ni bshad zin to //
translated: It is said that it is this that has the name existent.

original: yang na yid kyang dbang po yin pa nyid kyi phyir phyogs gzhan la yang skyon med do //
analyzed: yang na yid kyang dbang po yin pa nyid kyi phyir phyogs gzhan la yang skyon med do //
translated: Or else, because the mind is a sense faculty, there is no fault in the other position either.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way,

original: rnal 'byor pa'i zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i zhes pa ste /
translated: “the yogi’s”

original: ji ltar yid kyi rtog pa med pa mngon sum yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar yid kyi rtog pa med pa mngon sum yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the non-conceptual mind is a direct perception,

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi yang ngo //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi yang ngo //
translated: so it is for the yogis.

original: rnal 'byor ni ting nge 'dzin te /🔽de gang rnams la yod pa de rnams rnal @27a * //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ni ting nge 'dzin te / de gang rnams la yod pa de rnams rnal @27a * //
translated: Yoga is concentration.

original: 'byor ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'byor ba rnams so //
translated: Those who have it are yogis.

original: bla mas bstan /
analyzed: bla mas bstan /
translated: “Taught by the guru”

original: ma 'dres pa'i zhes pa ste /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa'i zhes pa ste /
translated: “Unmixed”

original: 'dir yul gyis yul can bstan pa la /
analyzed: 'dir yul gyis yul can bstan pa la /
translated: Here, the object is taught by the subject.

original: lung gi rnam par rtog pa ni bla mas bstan ba'i sgras brjod do //
analyzed: lung gi rnam par rtog pa ni bla mas bstan ba'i sgras brjod do //
translated: The conceptual thought of scripture is expressed by the word “taught by the guru.”

original: de dang ma 'dres pa ni bral ba zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: de dang ma 'dres pa ni bral ba zhes pa'i don no //
translated: Unmixed with that means free from that.

original: 'dis ni gsal bar snang ba nyid kyang de la thos pang byas te /
analyzed: 'dis ni gsal bar snang ba nyid kyang de la thos pang byas te /
translated: This clearly shows that the appearance itself is heard by that.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa ni gsal ba nyid la mi 'khrul ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa ni gsal ba nyid la mi 'khrul ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Non-conceptual is not mistaken with respect to the clarity itself.

original: tsam gyi sgra ni sgro btags pa'i don rnam par bcad pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: tsam gyi sgra ni sgro btags pa'i don rnam par bcad pa'i don du'o //
translated: The word “only” is for the purpose of eliminating the object of reification.

original: des na gang yang dag pa'i don gyi yul can 'phags pa'i bden pa mthong ba lta bu de kho na tshad ma ste /
analyzed: des na gang yang dag pa'i don gyi yul can 'phags pa'i bden pa mthong ba lta bu de kho na tshad ma ste /
translated: Therefore, that which has the object of the real is valid knowledge, such as the seeing of the noble truths.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don gyi yul can bslad pa zad par sa la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don gyi yul can bslad pa zad par sa la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: That which has the object of the unreal is not valid knowledge, such as the perception of a double moon.

original: 'o na don 'di 'chad par 'gyur ba'i dmigs bsal kho na la thob par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na don 'di 'chad par 'gyur ba'i dmigs bsal kho na la thob par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: Well then, isn’t this topic to be obtained only in the exceptions to be explained later?

original: de la tsam smos pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: de la tsam smos pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the point of mentioning “only” here?

original: 'di bden mod de lta na yang gtso bor shes pa'i don du 'di'i mtshan nyid kyi ngag kho na la don 'di yongs su gsal bar byas so //
analyzed: 'di bden mod de lta na yang gtso bor shes pa'i don du 'di'i mtshan nyid kyi ngag kho na la don 'di yongs su gsal bar byas so //
translated: This is true, but even so, the meaning of this definition is made clear only in the statement of the definition itself, which is primarily for the sake of understanding.

original: gtso bo nyid ni thar pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo nyid ni thar pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The primary meaning is because it is the cause of liberation.

original: yang rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid dang de'i gsal bar snang ba nyid ni sgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i 'bras bu yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yang rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid dang de'i gsal bar snang ba nyid ni sgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i 'bras bu yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, the absence of conceptuality and the appearance of clarity are the result of the completion of meditation.

original: gang sgom pa rdzogs pa'i 'bras bu shes pa de ni rtog pa med pa dang gsal bar snang bar yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang sgom pa rdzogs pa'i 'bras bu shes pa de ni rtog pa med pa dang gsal bar snang bar yang 'gyur te /
translated: That cognition which is the result of the completion of meditation is non-conceptual and clearly manifest.

original: dper na 'dod pa dang mya ngan la sogs pas nye bar bslad pa rnams kyi dga' ba la sogs pa'i yul can gyi shes pa bzhin /
analyzed: dper na 'dod pa dang mya ngan la sogs pas nye bar bslad pa rnams kyi dga' ba la sogs pa'i yul can gyi shes pa bzhin /
translated: For example, like the cognition of the object of joy, etc. of those who are affected by desire, sorrow, etc.

original: rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa'ang de lta bu'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa'ang de lta bu'o //
translated: The cognition of the yogi is also like that.

original: rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin no //
translated: This is the nature.

original: rtog pa'i shes pa yang zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rtog pa'i shes pa yang zhes pa ste /
translated: The cognition of conceptualization is also like that.

original: 'di'i don ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: gang rang rig pa bya ba de rang rtogs byed kyi ngor mngon sum ste /
analyzed: gang rang rig pa bya ba de rang rtogs byed kyi ngor mngon sum ste /
translated: That which is reflexive awareness is a perception in the perspective of the cognizer of that.

original: chags pa la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin /
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin /
translated: Like the cognition of attachment, etc.

original: rtog pa'i shes pa yang de lta bu'o zhes pa rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rtog pa'i shes pa yang de lta bu'o zhes pa rang bzhin no //
translated: The cognition of conceptualization is also like that. This is the nature.

original: 'di ni bden te zhes pa la sogs pa 'dod pa grub par ston to //
analyzed: 'di ni bden te zhes pa la sogs pa 'dod pa grub par ston to //
translated: This is true, etc. shows the establishment of the thesis.

original: 'di ltar dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar dgongs pa ste /
translated: The intention is as follows:

original: yul gang la shes pa gang sgra'i brda 'dzin pa de ni de la sgra'i sgo nas de'i yul 'dzin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dang bcas par 'gyur gyi rang gi ngo bo yang brda nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yul gang la shes pa gang sgra'i brda 'dzin pa de ni de la sgra'i sgo nas de'i yul 'dzin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dang bcas par 'gyur gyi rang gi ngo bo yang brda nus pa ma yin te /
translated: The consciousness that apprehends the sound-universal in regard to any object is conceptual, because it apprehends the object by way of sound.

original: sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The intrinsic reality is not capable of being signified, as was previously explained.

original: de'i phyir de rtogs par bya ba las so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de rtogs par bya ba las so //
translated: Therefore, it is from the object that is to be understood.

original: shes pa thams cad mngon sum kho na'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa thams cad mngon sum kho na'o zhes pa'o //
translated: All consciousnesses are only direct perception.

original: de ltar re zhig mngon @27b sum zhes pa la /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig mngon @27b sum zhes pa la /
translated: Thus, first, in regard to “direct perception,”

original: re zhig gi sgra ni rim pa la ste /
analyzed: re zhig gi sgra ni rim pa la ste /
translated: the word “first” is in terms of sequence.

original: mngon sum brjod nas de ltar snang brjod par byed do zhes pa rim pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum brjod nas de ltar snang brjod par byed do zhes pa rim pa'o //
translated: After stating “direct perception,” it is said that “thus it appears” is stated. This is the sequence.

original: 'o na mngon sum rtog pa dang bral ba zhes smras pas rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa mngon sum ltar snang ba'o zhes brjod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'o na mngon sum rtog pa dang bral ba zhes smras pas rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa mngon sum ltar snang ba'o zhes brjod par 'gyur la /
translated: Well, since it is said that “direct perception is free from conceptuality,” it would be stated that that which is conceptual is a semblance of direct perception.

original: de yang sngar kho nar ming dang rigs sbyor bas bshad na /
analyzed: de yang sngar kho nar ming dang rigs sbyor bas bshad na /
translated: Moreover, that was already explained by the combination of name and type.

original: de la ci'i don du slar yang de brjod ce na /
analyzed: de la ci'i don du slar yang de brjod ce na /
translated: What is the purpose of stating that again?

original: gang gi don du yin pa de phyi mar gsal bar byed bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi don du yin pa de phyi mar gsal bar byed bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of that will be clarified later.

original: 'khrul dang kun rdzob yod shes dang // zhes pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'khrul dang kun rdzob yod shes dang // zhes pa la sogs pa la /
translated: “ Delusion, conventional existence, knowledge,🔽and the non-existence of external objects.

original: 'dis ni mngon sum ltar snang rnam pa bzhir gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dis ni mngon sum ltar snang rnam pa bzhir gsungs so //
translated: ” This teaches the four kinds of seeming direct perception.

original: de la 'khrul pa'i shes pa zhes pa 'dis don gzhan rtog pa'i shes pa ci re zhig gsungs so //
analyzed: de la 'khrul pa'i shes pa zhes pa 'dis don gzhan rtog pa'i shes pa ci re zhig gsungs so //
translated: Among them, the so-called deluded cognition is the cognition that conceives of an object that does not exist.

original: de ltar ni chu la sogs pa don gzhan med pa kho na brda la brten pa las /
analyzed: de ltar ni chu la sogs pa don gzhan med pa kho na brda la brten pa las /
translated: In this way, in the absence of an object such as water, based on mere linguistic conventions,

original: smig rgyu la sogs pa rnams la sgro 'dogs par byed cing rtog pa skye'o //
analyzed: smig rgyu la sogs pa rnams la sgro 'dogs par byed cing rtog pa skye'o //
translated: one superimposes and generates a conception of a mirage and so on.

original: kun rdzob tu yod pa rnams la zhes pa la sogs pas /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yod pa rnams la zhes pa la sogs pas /
translated: “ Conventional existence” and so on.

original: brda la brten nas sgro 'dogs pa rtog pa'i 'jug pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: brda la brten nas sgro 'dogs pa rtog pa'i 'jug pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second engagement of the conception that superimposes based on linguistic conventions.

original: yang kun rdzob tu yod pa rnams la gang shes pa de mngon sum ltar snang ngo zhes pa'i ci'i rgyus she na /
analyzed: yang kun rdzob tu yod pa rnams la gang shes pa de mngon sum ltar snang ngo zhes pa'i ci'i rgyus she na /
translated: Again, if one asks, “Why is the cognition of conventional existence a seeming direct perception?”

original: gsungs pa / don gzhan sgro 'dogs pa las zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa / don gzhan sgro 'dogs pa las zhes pa ste /
translated: It is said, “Because it superimposes an object that does not exist.”

original: de ni btags pa'i dngos po gzugs la sogs pa rnams la don gzhan du gyur pa bum pa la sogs pa rnams sgro 'dogs kyi btags pa'i dngos po tsam du rtogs pa yang ma yin pas so //
analyzed: de ni btags pa'i dngos po gzugs la sogs pa rnams la don gzhan du gyur pa bum pa la sogs pa rnams sgro 'dogs kyi btags pa'i dngos po tsam du rtogs pa yang ma yin pas so //
translated: It is not that one realizes the mere things that are imputed, such as pots, etc., as other objects in relation to the things that are imputed, such as form, etc.

original: de yang ci ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How is that to be understood?

original: gsungs pa / de'i ngo bor btags nas 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa / de'i ngo bor btags nas 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir zhes pa ste /
translated: It is said: “because of engaging in them after imputing their nature.”

original: de ni kun rdzob tu yod pa de rnams la don gzhan nyid du rtog pa skye ste /
analyzed: de ni kun rdzob tu yod pa de rnams la don gzhan nyid du rtog pa skye ste /
translated: That is, the conception of them as other objects arises in relation to those that exist conventionally.

original: sgro btags pa'i don gyi rnam par brtags pas 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir kun rdzob tu yod pa'i shes pa ni bum pa la sogs pa rnams su sgro 'dogs par byed kyi /
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i don gyi rnam par brtags pas 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir kun rdzob tu yod pa'i shes pa ni bum pa la sogs pa rnams su sgro 'dogs par byed kyi /
translated: Because of engaging in them after imagining them as objects that are superimposed, the consciousness that exists conventionally superimposes pots, etc.

original: de btags pa'i dngos po tsam du rtogs par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de btags pa'i dngos po tsam du rtogs par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not cause one to realize them as mere things that are imputed.

original: de la re zhig gzugs la sogs pa chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gcig pa nyid kyis de las gzhan rnams las tha dad pa lan cig la brjod pa rnams la rang gi 'bras bu la nye bar sbyor ba'i don du de la 'jig rten gyi
analyzed: de la re zhig gzugs la sogs pa chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gcig pa nyid kyis de las gzhan rnams las tha dad pa lan cig la brjod pa rnams la rang gi 'bras bu la nye bar sbyor ba'i don du de la 'jig rten gyi
translated: The world, in order to apply them to their own effect,

original: sgra'i brda gang yin pa de rten du byas nas /
analyzed: sgra'i brda gang yin pa de rten du byas nas /
translated: takes as a basis the term of a word

original: don gzhan pa'i bum pa la sogs pa dang bral ba rnams la @28a * //🔽yang gzugs la sogs pa rnams la dngos po'i don gzhan sgro 'dogs pa'i rtog pa bum pa'o //
analyzed: don gzhan pa'i bum pa la sogs pa dang bral ba rnams la @28a * // yang gzugs la sogs pa rnams la dngos po'i don gzhan sgro 'dogs pa'i rtog pa bum pa'o //
translated: that is free from other objects such as a vase.

original: snam bu'o zhes pa la sogs pa rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: snam bu'o zhes pa la sogs pa rab tu 'jug go //
translated: Again, with regard to form and so on, the conception that superimposes other objects is “a vase,” “a cloth,” and so on.🔽It is engaged in that way.

original: de bzhin du tshogs pa la sogs pa rnam par gcod pa'i 'bras bu can gyi sgrar zhen pa la brten pas gcig nyid la sogs par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshogs pa la sogs pa rnam par gcod pa'i 'bras bu can gyi sgrar zhen pa la brten pas gcig nyid la sogs par zhen pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the conception of singularity and so on is based on the conception of a word that has the effect of excluding a collection and so on.

original: de bzhin du yul gzhan du skye ba rnams dang / de bzhin du yod pa rnams la dang / de bzhin du mang po 'bras bu gcig pa'i tshogs pa rnams la dang / de bzhin du bar med pa nyid la sogs pa'i gnas skabs rnams la /
analyzed: de bzhin du yul gzhan du skye ba rnams dang / de bzhin du yod pa rnams la dang / de bzhin du mang po 'bras bu gcig pa'i tshogs pa rnams la dang / de bzhin du bar med pa nyid la sogs pa'i gnas skabs rnams la /
translated: Likewise, with regard to those born in other places, and likewise with regard to those that exist, and likewise with regard to the collection of many that have a single effect, and likewise with regard to the situation of being without interval, and so on.

original: de ltar gyur pa ma yin par rnam par gcad pa'i ched du sgra'i brda btags pa la brten nas don gzhan du gyur pa'i las dang / yod pa nyid dang bum pa nyid la sogs pa dang / ldan pa la sogs par rim pa ji lta bar sgro 'dogs pa'i rtog pa nye bar skye'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa ma yin par rnam par gcad pa'i ched du sgra'i brda btags pa la brten nas don gzhan du gyur pa'i las dang / yod pa nyid dang bum pa nyid la sogs pa dang / ldan pa la sogs par rim pa ji lta bar sgro 'dogs pa'i rtog pa nye bar skye'o //
translated: In order to exclude the opposite of that, the conceptual thought that superimposes a different object arises in dependence on the designation of a word-sign, in order, as existence, as a pot, and so on, and as being endowed, and so on.

original: de ltar rab tu dbye ba las sgra'i rtog pa kho na brda tsam la brten pa 'di ni rtog pa'i shes pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rab tu dbye ba las sgra'i rtog pa kho na brda tsam la brten pa 'di ni rtog pa'i shes pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: Thus, this conceptual thought that is based on mere words, which is a conceptual cognition that arises from a differentiation, is the second type of conceptual cognition.

original: smig rgyu la sogs pa rnams la gang chu la sogs pa'i rtog pa de ni /
analyzed: smig rgyu la sogs pa rnams la gang chu la sogs pa'i rtog pa de ni /
translated: The conceptual thought that arises with regard to a mirage and so on, as water and so on,🔽is a conceptual thought that arises from a non-existent object.

original: gang gis brda la brten pa kho na'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir 'di logs su brjod par mi 'gyur ba chu ma yin pa rnam par gcad pa'i ched du chur byas pa'i brda tsam la brten nas rab tu 'jug pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gis brda la brten pa kho na'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir 'di logs su brjod par mi 'gyur ba chu ma yin pa rnam par gcad pa'i ched du chur byas pa'i brda tsam la brten nas rab tu 'jug pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Because it is included only within the dependent on sign-source, it is not mentioned separately. One does not engage in the mere sign-source of water, which is the cause for the exclusion of non-water.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: der 'byung ba 'dus pa la brda la brten pa las yod pa ma yin pa kho na'i chu la sogs pa sngar mthong ba'i don gzhan kho na sgro 'dogs pa skye ste /
analyzed: der 'byung ba 'dus pa la brda la brten pa las yod pa ma yin pa kho na'i chu la sogs pa sngar mthong ba'i don gzhan kho na sgro 'dogs pa skye ste /
translated: The conception of water, etc., arises only from the dependent on sign-source, which is the aggregation of the elements, and it is a superimposition of an object that is entirely different from what was seen before.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa chu la sogs pa'i rtog pa 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa chu la sogs pa'i rtog pa 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir zhes pa'o //
translated: That is why it is said, “because the conception of water, etc., is engaged.”

original: bum pa la sogs pa rnams ni rang gi nye bar len pa las gzhan yod pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa rnams ni rang gi nye bar len pa las gzhan yod pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: It is only that pots, etc., are not different from their own appropriated parts.

original: brda tsam gyi rgyu mtshan can kho na der sgro 'dogs pa'i rtog pa'o zhes pa snga ma las tha dad par brjod do //
analyzed: brda tsam gyi rgyu mtshan can kho na der sgro 'dogs pa'i rtog pa'o zhes pa snga ma las tha dad par brjod do //
translated: The conception that superimposes them is only the sign-source as the cause. This is stated as different from the previous.

original: rjes su dpag pa dang de'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'i shes pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dang de'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'i shes pa zhes pa ste /
translated: The cognition of inference and its effect, etc.

original: 'dis rjes su dpag bar bya bas rjes su dpag pa ste rtags so //
analyzed: 'dis rjes su dpag bar bya bas rjes su dpag pa ste rtags so //
translated: The sign is called inference because it is inferred.

original: de la de kho na du ba 'di'o zhes 'brel pa'i dus su nyams su myong ba'i don gyi rtog pa 'jug pa ni shes pa'o //🔽de'i 'bras bu rtags can gyi shes pa la yang sngar nyams su myong ba'i rtog pa yod de /
analyzed: de la de kho na du ba 'di'o zhes 'brel pa'i dus su nyams su myong ba'i don gyi rtog pa 'jug pa ni shes pa'o // de'i 'bras bu rtags can gyi shes pa la yang sngar nyams su myong ba'i rtog pa yod de /
translated: The cognition is the conception of the object experienced at the time of the connection, “This is smoke.”

original: de kho na 'dir me'o zhes rjes su dpog pa'i phyir ro //🔽dran pa la yang sngar nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa can gyi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na 'dir me'o zhes rjes su dpog pa'i phyir ro // dran pa la yang sngar nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa can gyi rtog pa ste /
translated: The cognition of the possessor of the sign, the effect of that, also has the conception of the experience of the object, because it infers, “There is fire here.”

original: @28b 'di ltar de bdag gis myong ngo zhes pa'o //🔽mngon par 'dod pa can yang sngar myong ba'i rtog pa las ma 'das te /
analyzed: @28b 'di ltar de bdag gis myong ngo zhes pa'o // mngon par 'dod pa can yang sngar myong ba'i rtog pa las ma 'das te /
translated: Memory also has the conception of the experience of the object, because it is like this: “I experienced that.”

original: de med na mngon par 'dod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med na mngon par 'dod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even desire is not beyond the conception of the experience of the object, because if it does not exist, desire does not exist.

original: sogs pa'i sgras the tshom gyi shes pa bzung ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras the tshom gyi shes pa bzung ste /
translated: The word “etc.” includes doubt.

original: de la yang ci de kho na 'di 'am 'on te gzhan yin zhes pa 'di lta bu'i rnam pa can sngar myong ba'i rtog pa skye'o zhes pa 'di ni sngar myong ba'i don can rtog pa'i shes pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang ci de kho na 'di 'am 'on te gzhan yin zhes pa 'di lta bu'i rnam pa can sngar myong ba'i rtog pa skye'o zhes pa 'di ni sngar myong ba'i don can rtog pa'i shes pa gsum pa'o //
translated: The third type of conceptual cognition is the one that has the form of the question, “Is this the same as that or is it different from that?”

original: rab rib bcas zhes pa 'dis dbang po la nye bar gnod pa las skyes pa rab rib la sogs pa'i shes pa mngon sum ltar snang ba bzhi pa gsungs so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rab rib bcas zhes pa 'dis dbang po la nye bar gnod pa las skyes pa rab rib la sogs pa'i shes pa mngon sum ltar snang ba bzhi pa gsungs so zhes pa'o //
translated: The fourth type of cognition is the one that is like a direct perception, but is actually a distorted cognition, such as the cognition of someone with an eye disease that sees falling hairs.

original: de la rtog pa'i shes pa snga ma gnyis dag ni mngon sum ma yin no zhes bshad pa'i don du gsungs so //
analyzed: de la rtog pa'i shes pa snga ma gnyis dag ni mngon sum ma yin no zhes bshad pa'i don du gsungs so //
translated: The point of the above explanation is to show that the first two types of conceptual cognition are not direct perception.

original: gang gis de bzlog pa'i ched du 'chad par bya ba slar yang de dag mngon sum du dogs pa ci las she na /
analyzed: gang gis de bzlog pa'i ched du 'chad par bya ba slar yang de dag mngon sum du dogs pa ci las she na /
translated: Why is it that the author of the treatise again raises the question of whether these two are direct perception, when he has already explained that they are not?

original: de dag ni mngon sum nye bar 'jug pa dag ste /
analyzed: de dag ni mngon sum nye bar 'jug pa dag ste /
translated: These two are direct perception in the sense that they are engaged in the object.

original: de'i phyir skye ba'i dus kyi rnam par dbye ba phra mo rtogs par dka' ba nyid kyi phyir nye bar mtshon pa med pa las 'di dag mngon sum kho na dag go zhes kha cig 'dod par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba'i dus kyi rnam par dbye ba phra mo rtogs par dka' ba nyid kyi phyir nye bar mtshon pa med pa las 'di dag mngon sum kho na dag go zhes kha cig 'dod par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Therefore, because the subtle distinctions of the time of arising are difficult to understand, some people think that these are direct perception alone, since they are not indicated.

original: 'ga' zhig rnams kyis log par rtogs pa mthong ba yang ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig rnams kyis log par rtogs pa mthong ba yang ste /
translated: And some people see them as wrongly understood.

original: dper na bum pa la sogs pa kun rdzob tu yod pa rnams la shes pa dang / smig rgyu la sogs pa rnams la chu la sogs pa'i shes pa ni mngon sum kho na'o zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bum pa la sogs pa kun rdzob tu yod pa rnams la shes pa dang / smig rgyu la sogs pa rnams la chu la sogs pa'i shes pa ni mngon sum kho na'o zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, in the case of pots and so on that exist conventionally, the cognition of water and so on in mirages and so on is direct perception alone.

original: de ltar ni smig rgyu la sogs pa la chu la sogs pa'i shes pa de kho na rnam par gcad pa'i ched du ma 'khrul pa zhes mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid la khyad par nye bar byas pas so //
analyzed: de ltar ni smig rgyu la sogs pa la chu la sogs pa'i shes pa de kho na rnam par gcad pa'i ched du ma 'khrul pa zhes mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid la khyad par nye bar byas pas so //
translated: In that case, in order to exclude that cognition of water and so on in mirages and so on, the definition of direct perception is qualified by the phrase “non-mistaken.”

original: de ni dbang po la nye bar gnod pa las skyes pa'i shes pa bzlog pa'i don du'o zhe na /
analyzed: de ni dbang po la nye bar gnod pa las skyes pa'i shes pa bzlog pa'i don du'o zhe na /
translated: That is for the purpose of excluding the cognition arisen from impairment of the sense faculties.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: don dang phrad pa 'dzin pa kho na las don med pa las byung ba zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i shes pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dang phrad pa 'dzin pa kho na las don med pa las byung ba zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i shes pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is only the cognition that encounters the object that is capable of excluding the cognition of a nonexistent object, such as the cognition of two moons.

original: gzhan du na dbang po las skyes pa shes pa nyid brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na dbang po las skyes pa shes pa nyid brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the cognition that arises from the sense faculty would be the object of expression.

original: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i shes pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i shes pa ni /
translated: As for the cognition of inference, etc.,

original: ji ltar sngar nyams su myong ba'i brda dran pa'i stobs las 'jug pa dang mngon sum ma yin pa'ang yin par grub pa kho na'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sngar nyams su myong ba'i brda dran pa'i stobs las 'jug pa dang mngon sum ma yin pa'ang yin par grub pa kho na'o zhes pa'o //
translated: it is established that it is not perception, because it arises from the power of the memory of the sign that was previously experienced.

original: de mngon sum ma yin par grub na'ang gang 'dir nye bar blangs pa de ni rtogs pa'i shes pa snga ma dag de kho na mngon sum ma yin pa nyid du sgrub pa'i @29a * //🔽ched du ste /
analyzed: de mngon sum ma yin par grub na'ang gang 'dir nye bar blangs pa de ni rtogs pa'i shes pa snga ma dag de kho na mngon sum ma yin pa nyid du sgrub pa'i @29a * // ched du ste /
translated: Even though it is established that it is not perception, the one who is engaged in this is proving that the previous cognition that apprehends that sign is not perception.

original: gang sngar nyams su myong ba'i brda dran pa'i stobs las byung ba'i ngang can de mngon sum ma yin te /
analyzed: gang sngar nyams su myong ba'i brda dran pa'i stobs las byung ba'i ngang can de mngon sum ma yin te /
translated: The one who is engaged in this is proving that the cognition that arises from the power of the memory of the sign that was previously experienced is not perception.

original: dper na rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i shes pa 'di bzhin shes pa snga ma dag kyang de lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i shes pa 'di bzhin shes pa snga ma dag kyang de lta bu'o //
translated: For example, like the cognition of inference, so are the earlier cognitions.

original: khyab byed dang 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: khyab byed dang 'gal ba'o //
translated: The pervasion and the contradictory.

original: de ltar rtog pa'i shes pa rnam pa gsum kho na ste /
analyzed: de ltar rtog pa'i shes pa rnam pa gsum kho na ste /
translated: Thus, there are only three kinds of conceptual cognitions.

original: mtshan nyid kyi tshig gi don gyis go bas bsal ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi tshig gi don gyis go bas bsal ba'o //
translated: The example is excluded by the meaning of the definition.

original: mngon sum ltar snang ba bzhi pa gang de ni 'dir dmigs kyis bsal bar blta bar bya'i mtshan nyid kyi tshig gi don gyis go bas bsal ba'i dper brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum ltar snang ba bzhi pa gang de ni 'dir dmigs kyis bsal bar blta bar bya'i mtshan nyid kyi tshig gi don gyis go bas bsal ba'i dper brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The fourth, which appears to be perception, is to be seen as excluded by the specification here, and is not an example of exclusion by the meaning of the definition.

original: gzhan dun mtshan nyid 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan dun mtshan nyid 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the definition would be mistaken.

original: de'i phyir dmigs kyis bsal ba'i tshig des phyi dang nang gi nye bar gnod pa'i rkyen gyis bcom pa'i dbang po'i shes pa rtog pa dang bral ba nyid na'ang mngon sum ltar snang bar brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dmigs kyis bsal ba'i tshig des phyi dang nang gi nye bar gnod pa'i rkyen gyis bcom pa'i dbang po'i shes pa rtog pa dang bral ba nyid na'ang mngon sum ltar snang bar brjod do //
translated: Therefore, by that specifying phrase, a sense cognition that is destroyed by an internal or external condition of impairment is said to appear to be perception, even though it is free from conceptualization.

original: rab rib bcas zhes pa 'dir /
analyzed: rab rib bcas zhes pa 'dir /
translated: In the phrase “with diseased vision,”

original: rab rib ni dbang po nye par bcom pa'i rkyen thams cad nye bar mtshon pa tsam du blta bar bya'o lo //
analyzed: rab rib ni dbang po nye par bcom pa'i rkyen thams cad nye bar mtshon pa tsam du blta bar bya'o lo //
translated: The eye disease should be regarded as merely an illustration of all the conditions that impair the sense faculties.

original: gang zhig zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i shes pa dbang po las skyes pa ma yin pa kho na ste 'on kyang yid kyi kho na'o zhes smra'o //
analyzed: gang zhig zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i shes pa dbang po las skyes pa ma yin pa kho na ste 'on kyang yid kyi kho na'o zhes smra'o //
translated: Some say that the cognition of two moons and so on is not produced from the sense faculties but only from the mind.

original: des na brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: des na brjod par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, we must ask:

original: dbang po las skyes pa'i mtshan nyid ci yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa'i mtshan nyid ci yin zhes pa'o //
translated: What is the definition of what is produced from the sense faculties?

original: dbang po yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa'o zhe na /
translated: It is that which conforms to the presence or absence of the sense faculties.

original: de 'di la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: de 'di la yang mtshungs so //
translated: This is the same for the cognition of two moons.

original: de rnam par 'gyur bas rnam par 'gyur ba can nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: de rnam par 'gyur bas rnam par 'gyur ba can nyid do zhe na /
translated: It is the transformation of the sense faculties that is transformed.

original: 'dir yang de kho na lan yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang de kho na lan yin no //
translated: This is the same for the cognition of two moons.

original: gzhan yang sbrul la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa bzhin du 'di 'dod pas ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang sbrul la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa bzhin du 'di 'dod pas ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, this is refuted by the desire of the opponent, just like the error of the snake and so on.

original: rtog pa 'di ni so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis bzlog par nus pas so //
analyzed: rtog pa 'di ni so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis bzlog par nus pas so //
translated: This conception can be refuted by the power of analysis.

original: gzhan yang dbang bo rnam par 'gyur ba can gyi rnam par 'gyur ba ldog pa na yang brtags pa las mi ldog par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan yang dbang bo rnam par 'gyur ba can gyi rnam par 'gyur ba ldog pa na yang brtags pa las mi ldog par 'gyur na /
translated: Moreover, when the transformation of the sense faculty is reversed, the transformation would not be reversed, because of the imputation.

original: de ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: But that is not so.

original: de'i phyir 'dir yang dbang po las byung ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir yang dbang po las byung ba kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, here also, it is only from the sense faculty.

original: slob dpon gyis gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis gsungs pa yang /
translated: The Acarya has said:

original: de rnams ni don dam par rnam pa gzhan du yod pa rnams ni zla ba gnyis la sogs par snang ba dang sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: de rnams ni don dam par rnam pa gzhan du yod pa rnams ni zla ba gnyis la sogs par snang ba dang sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: Those which exist in another form in the ultimate sense are the cause of the consciousness appearing as two moons, etc., and as blue, etc.

original: 'di la mngon par zhen par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la mngon par zhen par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: One should not cling to this.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar dbang po las skyes kyang bslad pa yang yod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar dbang po las skyes kyang bslad pa yang yod do //
translated: Because, although it is born from the sense faculty, there is also a corruption.

original: de'i phyir 'khrul pa zhes pa la sogs pas @29b bshad zin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i sde tshan zhes bya ba'i yi ges rnam par gcad pa las logs su rnam par rtog pa med pa mngon sum ltar snang ba rab rib bcas zhes pas slob dpon gyis gsungs
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khrul pa zhes pa la sogs pas @29b bshad zin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i sde tshan zhes bya ba'i yi ges rnam par gcad pa las logs su rnam par rtog pa med pa mngon sum ltar snang ba rab rib bcas zhes pas slob dpon gyis gsungs
translated: Therefore, the master says in the line “apart from the class of concepts explained as ‘mistaken’ . . .,” that apart from the class of concepts that are excluded by the words “mistaken” and so on, there are no other concepts that are like direct perception.

original: so // 'dir brtsad par bya ste 'dir slu pa med pa la 'jug par byed pa'i shes pa ni tshad mar mngon par 'dod de /
analyzed: so // 'dir brtsad par bya ste 'dir slu pa med pa la 'jug par byed pa'i shes pa ni tshad mar mngon par 'dod de /
translated: Here one should debate as follows: A cognition that engages its object without deception is accepted as valid knowledge.

original: 'di dag gis don yongs su bcad nas 'jug pa ni don bya ba la slu ba med pas so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di dag gis don yongs su bcad nas 'jug pa ni don bya ba la slu ba med pas so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because it is said that “when it engages its object by ascertaining it, it is undeceiving with regard to the object’s function.”

original: dbang po nye bar bcom pa las skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa la cig kyang yang dag par 'dod pa 'ga' zhig la slu ba med pa dang rab tu 'jug par byed pa nyid kyang yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: dbang po nye bar bcom pa las skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa la cig kyang yang dag par 'dod pa 'ga' zhig la slu ba med pa dang rab tu 'jug par byed pa nyid kyang yod pa kho na'o //
translated: There are some who assert that a consciousness arisen from a damaged sense faculty is undeceiving and engages its object.

original: de'i phyir gang 'di skra shad la sogs par snang ba rab rib la sogs pa'i shes pa ni gang gi yang dag par 'dod pa skra shad la sogs pa'i dngos po la slu ba med cing de tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur mod /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang 'di skra shad la sogs par snang ba rab rib la sogs pa'i shes pa ni gang gi yang dag par 'dod pa skra shad la sogs pa'i dngos po la slu ba med cing de tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur mod /
translated: Therefore, the consciousness of those with diseased vision, which perceives such things as floating hairs, is not valid knowledge with regard to the things that are its objects, such as floating hairs.

original: gang 'di mig ser gyis nye bar bslad pa'i mig can gyis dung dkar po la sogs pa dung ser po la sogs par snang ba dang / gang yang yun ring du rab rib kyis mig bsgribs pa nyid kyi phyir ram thag ring ba nyid kyi phyir gsal ba'i sngon po la sogs pa rnams la mig gsal ba'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang /
analyzed: gang 'di mig ser gyis nye bar bslad pa'i mig can gyis dung dkar po la sogs pa dung ser po la sogs par snang ba dang / gang yang yun ring du rab rib kyis mig bsgribs pa nyid kyi phyir ram thag ring ba nyid kyi phyir gsal ba'i sngon po la sogs pa rnams la mig gsal ba'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang /
translated: The eye consciousness of someone whose eyes are affected by the disease of cataracts perceives a white conch as yellow. The eye consciousness of someone whose eyes are long affected by cataracts or whose eyes are far away perceives a clear blue and so on as unclear blue and so on.

original: gang yang gru dang bzhon pa bskyod pas byas pa'i 'khrul pa shing sdong la sogs pa gnas pa rnams la yang 'gro ba'i bya ba dang ldan pa'i rkang 'thung la sogs par snang ba dang 'di lta bu'i rnam pa gzhan yang /
analyzed: gang yang gru dang bzhon pa bskyod pas byas pa'i 'khrul pa shing sdong la sogs pa gnas pa rnams la yang 'gro ba'i bya ba dang ldan pa'i rkang 'thung la sogs par snang ba dang 'di lta bu'i rnam pa gzhan yang /
translated: Also, the error that is produced by the movement of a boat or a vehicle is that trees and so on that are stationary appear to have the action of going, and so on.

original: de ma yin pa la der 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ma yin pa la der 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of apprehending what is not that as that,

original: 'khrul pa de yang dngos po la 'brel pa las 'dod pa'i don la mi slu ba'i phyir 'ga' zhig la tshad ma nyid du drang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa de yang dngos po la 'brel pa las 'dod pa'i don la mi slu ba'i phyir 'ga' zhig la tshad ma nyid du drang bar bya'o //
translated: that error is to be drawn as valid knowledge for some because of not being deceived with regard to the object that is asserted in connection with the thing.

original: de ltar ni de las rab tu 'jug pa ni gegs med na nges par dung la sogs pa'i dngos po tsam las 'ongs pa'i don bya ba nus pa'i don mngon par 'dod pa sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar ni de las rab tu 'jug pa ni gegs med na nges par dung la sogs pa'i dngos po tsam las 'ongs pa'i don bya ba nus pa'i don mngon par 'dod pa sgrub par byed do //
translated: In that way, the engagement from that is that if there is no obstruction, it definitely accomplishes the object that is asserted, the object that is able to perform a function that comes from the mere thing, such as a conch.

original: 'on te 'di rnams slu ba med kyang log par snang ba nyid kyi phyir tshad ma nyid du mi 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on te 'di rnams slu ba med kyang log par snang ba nyid kyi phyir tshad ma nyid du mi 'dod na /
translated: But if, although these are undeceiving, they are not asserted as valid knowledge because of appearing falsely,🔽then what is the use of the term valid knowledge?

original: de lta na rjes su dpag pa yang de nyid kyi phyir mi 'dod par byas na /
analyzed: de lta na rjes su dpag pa yang de nyid kyi phyir mi 'dod par byas na /
translated: In that case, if you do not accept inference for that reason,

original: mi 'dod pa yang ma yin no //🔽de'i phyir de rnams kyang yang dag par 'dod pa'i don bya ba nus pa dung la sogs pa'i dngos po tsam la gang du mi bslu ba de la tshad ma nyid du mi 'gal bar mthong zhing /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa yang ma yin no // de'i phyir de rnams kyang yang dag par 'dod pa'i don bya ba nus pa dung la sogs pa'i dngos po tsam la gang du mi bslu ba de la tshad ma nyid du mi 'gal bar mthong zhing /
translated: then it is not that you do not accept it.

original: smra bar yang nus te /🔽shes pa gang la rab tu @30a * //
analyzed: smra bar yang nus te / shes pa gang la rab tu @30a * //
translated: Therefore, it is not contradictory to see that those are valid cognitions in regard to mere things such as a conch that are able to perform the function of the object that is their real object, and it is also possible to say that.

original: zhugs pa'i skyes bus gegs med na nges par mngon par 'dod pa'i don sgrub pa de de la de'i tshad ma ste /
analyzed: zhugs pa'i skyes bus gegs med na nges par mngon par 'dod pa'i don sgrub pa de de la de'i tshad ma ste /
translated: A person who engages in a consciousness that is able to definitely accomplish the object that is its real object when there is no obstruction is valid in regard to that.

original: dper na mngon par 'dod pa'i mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa bzhin ji skad bshad pa'i shes pa las rab tu zhugs pa'i skyes bu yang gegs med na nges par mngon par 'dod pa dung la sogs pa'i dngos po tsam sgrub par byed do zhes pa rang
analyzed: dper na mngon par 'dod pa'i mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa bzhin ji skad bshad pa'i shes pa las rab tu zhugs pa'i skyes bu yang gegs med na nges par mngon par 'dod pa dung la sogs pa'i dngos po tsam sgrub par byed do zhes pa rang
translated: For example, it is like direct perception and inference that are real objects, and a person who engages in a consciousness that is explained in the above way definitely accomplishes the object that is its real object, the mere thing such as a conch, when there is no obstruction.

original: bzhin no // 'di yang rjes su dpag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bzhin no // 'di yang rjes su dpag pa ma yin te /
translated: This is also not inference,

original: rtags las ma skyes pa nyid kyi phyir dang rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rtags las ma skyes pa nyid kyi phyir dang rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is not born from a logical reason and because it is non-conceptual.

original: tshad ma gsum pa 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma gsum pa 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the third valid cognition, because🔽it is not a valid cognition that is other than direct perception and inference.

original: de'i phyir mngon sum kho na'o zhes khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum kho na'o zhes khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it must be accepted that it is direct perception.

original: gang rtog pa dang bral zhing 'dod pa'i don la mi bslu ba de ni mngon sum ste /
analyzed: gang rtog pa dang bral zhing 'dod pa'i don la mi bslu ba de ni mngon sum ste /
translated: That which is free from conceptuality and is non-deceptive with regard to the desired object is direct perception.

original: dper na mngon par 'dod pa'i mngon sum bzhin /
analyzed: dper na mngon par 'dod pa'i mngon sum bzhin /
translated: For example, it is like the direct perception of the desired object.

original: skabs kyi shes pa'ang de lta bu'o //
analyzed: skabs kyi shes pa'ang de lta bu'o //
translated: The cognition of the present moment is also like that.

original: rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin no //
translated: It is the nature.

original: 'di 'gyur mod dung la sogs pa tsam gyi dngos po 'dod par byas pa la mi bslu ba'i phyir de kho na la de mngon sum nyid du 'dod kyi ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i khyad par la ni slu ba med par mi 'dod
analyzed: 'di 'gyur mod dung la sogs pa tsam gyi dngos po 'dod par byas pa la mi bslu ba'i phyir de kho na la de mngon sum nyid du 'dod kyi ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i khyad par la ni slu ba med par mi 'dod
translated: This is so, but because it is non-deceptive with regard to the mere entity of a conch and so on that is accepted, it is accepted that it is direct perception only with regard to that, but it is not accepted that it is non-deceptive with regard to the specific features possessing the aspect of yellow and so on.

original: do zhes pa de lta na rab rib bcas zhes pa dmigs bsal gyi tshig 'dis phyi dang nang gi nyer gnod kyi rkyen can dbang po nye bar bcom pa'i shes pa rtog pa dang bral ba nyid na yang mngon sum ltar snang bar gsungs pa dang /
analyzed: do zhes pa de lta na rab rib bcas zhes pa dmigs bsal gyi tshig 'dis phyi dang nang gi nyer gnod kyi rkyen can dbang po nye bar bcom pa'i shes pa rtog pa dang bral ba nyid na yang mngon sum ltar snang bar gsungs pa dang /
translated: The word “also” indicates that the phrase “with an eye affected by cataracts” is a special case. It is saying that even though a cognition is free of conceptuality and is impaired by an internal or external cause of error, it is still a case of seeming direct perception.

original: rab rib bcas zhes pa'i tshig der rab rib ni dbang po la nye bar gnod pa'i rkyen can thams cad nye bar mtshon pa tsam 'ba' zhig go zhes pa 'di ltar bshad par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rab rib bcas zhes pa'i tshig der rab rib ni dbang po la nye bar gnod pa'i rkyen can thams cad nye bar mtshon pa tsam 'ba' zhig go zhes pa 'di ltar bshad par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: It cannot be explained that the phrase “with an eye affected by cataracts” is merely an illustration of all the causes of impairment of the sense faculties.

original: dpang po la nye bar gnod pa'i shes pa yang 'ga' zhig kha cig tu mngon sum yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dpang po la nye bar gnod pa'i shes pa yang 'ga' zhig kha cig tu mngon sum yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because some cognitions that are impaired in regard to the sense faculties are direct perceptions in some cases.

original: ma 'khrul ba zhes pa'i khyad par yang bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ma 'khrul ba zhes pa'i khyad par yang bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The qualification “nonerroneous” cannot be applied.

original: 'khrul pa yang 'ga' zhig kyang 'ga' zhig tu mngon sum nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa yang 'ga' zhig kyang 'ga' zhig tu mngon sum nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: This is because some erroneous cognitions are asserted to be direct perceptions in some cases.

original: de'i phyir rab rib bcas zhes pa dmigs bsal gyi tshig 'di rnam pa gzhan du bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rab rib bcas zhes pa dmigs bsal gyi tshig 'di rnam pa gzhan du bshad par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the word “with” should be explained in a different way.

original: rab rib kyi sgra 'di ni 'dir mi shes pa rjod par byed pa ste /🔽dper na / dman rnams rab rib kyis bcom pa //
analyzed: rab rib kyi sgra 'di ni 'dir mi shes pa rjod par byed pa ste / dper na / dman rnams rab rib kyis bcom pa //
translated: The word “cataract” here expresses ignorance.🔽For example,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'i ngang la bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'i ngang la bzhin no //
translated: the inferior are destroyed by cataracts.

original: rab rib la yod pa ni rab rib can te /
analyzed: rab rib la yod pa ni rab rib can te /
translated: The one who has cataracts is the one with cataracts.

original: ngag ni rnam par gcod pa'i 'bras bu can nyid kyi phyir ngag thams cad nges par gzung ba dang bcas pa'i zhes pas rab rib kho na @30b la yod pa zhes nges par gzung ba dang bcas pa'i ngag gi don la de phan du 'gyur ro //
